review.title: not too far from UCSF.
review.reviewText: Room was nice and clean.  Coffee shop has very good coffee and rolls.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice and quiet

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText:
We did not get the double room we had confirmed online, so we were a little disappointed. Plus, our view did not have a nice water view like we saw in the photos on the website. Our view was basically a gravel area.
Still, the bed was very comfortable and the location is great. 
Parking costs extra and was expensive...it was an unexpected surprise for us. At $25.00 per night, we will stay elsewhere next time to save that extra money.
review.positiveRemarks: The overall clean and nice feeling was good.
review.negativeRemarks: We do not want to pay for parking next time.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is fairly well located to Redwood City and the SFO Airport too.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here while waiting for a flight out back to my home, was great with lots of dining options, very accessible to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Room Wita a View
review.reviewText: I decided to upgrade to a one bedroom suite when I made the reservation. I was so happy I did!! It was the most amazing room with several large windows offering a spectacular views of the lagoon, city and the San Mateo Bridge.  Had a great breakfast in the restaurant the next morning too.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice location, clean and safe!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of restaurants, stores and businesses a five minute drive away.  Watched people on canoes from our suite and there is also a running path.

review.title: Nice quiet place to relax
review.reviewText: Was going to a couple of Giants games and didn't want to stay in the city. An upscale, safe place to stay that is worth the drive!

review.title: Amazing Stay - Peacefully & Relaxing
review.reviewText: Hotel was above and beyond.  Distance from SFO & airport was perfect.  Location is great not craziness.  Felt like I was back home.   The rooms were also great.  And the bed I wanted to take back with me.  I had the best sleep of my life. Would definitely recommended it to anyone.  Wish I could live there.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that the room was very big and clean.  The hotel itself looked amazing from the outside and especially the inside. Better then I expected.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, even though they had a big garage with a lot of parking space you still had to pay a daily fee of $25.  But at least you can go in and out.
review.locationRemarks: Location is amazing.  Quite calm and relaxing.  Yet not far from all the attractions like San Fran.

review.title: Not as close to SF as it looks but I nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Quick to rectify and issues and very eager to please their guests.
Pool and outside patio was in poor condition. Pool was old and dirty. The rest of the hotel is nice and clean.

review.title: Posh lobby
review.reviewText: Great valet parking. Impressive lobby would have been nice to see some of that posh go into the rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location
review.negativeRemarks: Update or fix bathroom,much wrong with the one in our room.
review.locationRemarks: Good for business trips.

review.title: Convenient Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located 10-15 minutes from the airport. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The rooms were nice and very clean. The shuttle wasn't incredibly convenient. It's only once every hour and stops at 11 pm. Nonetheless, the location makes the hotel a good choice for a stay for a late night or early morning flight. I would definitely stay there again.
Hotel is nice and all the staffs are very friendly!

review.title: 12 minutes from the airport
review.reviewText: Near a running trail by Oracle headquarters for those who like walk and run.

review.title: Nice Lake View!
review.reviewText: Honestly, I had a pleasant experience, and would come back here again.

review.title: Very nice for the price
review.reviewText: This was the second time we stayed here, and it will be our go-to hotel any time we are in the area. It's dog friendly, very nice, lovely location and view of the water, great food, and great service.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the customer service is great.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing I can think of
review.locationRemarks: It's near Oracle in a big business park area in Redwood City. You are only about 20 minutes from SF, so there are lots of things to do nearby.

review.title: slow process
review.reviewText: We were double charged for the parking and called the hotel. We were told it will refund after we provide the prove of payment. We send the receipt immediate. The refund still hasn't be processed when I call to follow up a week later. Very disappointed for the service in a 4 start hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport about 10-15 min
review.reviewText: Nice hotel about 10-15 min away from airport. I would stay here again and recommend to friends and family.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: I am glad i stayed here.  It was quiet, with great beauty. I loved being on the lagoon.
review.positiveRemarks: location, quiet rooms, beauty, lagoon views
review.negativeRemarks: Pool, no heater in pool, and no hot tub, at all. A hot tub is needed when no heater for the pool water.. Poor WIFi in the rooms, necessary to buy WiFi
review.locationRemarks: 15 miles from SFO airport

review.title: Great hotel in between SF and Levi's Stadium
review.reviewText: Great hotel to be in between San Francisco and the Levi's Stadium. Staff assisted well and the hotel is really well kept.

review.title: Great place, good price
review.reviewText: Great place it looks and feels like a high end hotel that you pay a lot more money for
Hotel room is old and staff works there are lay back.  We check in at late night, it's still take us 15 mins to check in

review.title: OK hotel far from airport
review.reviewText: Room was unremarkable and small. Shuttle to airport  is hourly, first come first serve, with only 6 seats, and stops after 11pm. If you have business with Oracle, it's right there. Otherwise not a good choice for the airport. Staff was very nice.

review.title: Great Hotel, But Name Is A Bit Misleading
review.reviewText: Hotel amenities are great, the place is very clean, staff is quite responsive; however, this hotel is nowhere near San Francisco.  In fact, on a good day it's about 30 min away, as the Hotel is in Belmont California.  If you are heading to San Francisco for the first time, you should consider this and especially if you are planning to use Lyft or Uber to get around as it will cost you a pretty penny to take an Uber or Lyft from Redwood to San Francisco.  On the other hand, this hotel is probably a great option if you are heading to Silicon Valley.

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: My stay at the Sofitel was everything and more you come to expect from a great hotel!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, great view, and exceptional value.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for self parking
review.locationRemarks: Because of my girlfriend's flight getting cancelled on both Friday and Saturday, my stay was cut short.

review.title: Clean and good location
review.reviewText: Check in was smooth and efficient. I can't talk much about the amenities since we didn't use any of them but the room was clean and the bed comfortable. They helped accommodate us by holding to our bags after checkout since our flight was much later in the evening.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and well run. Parking structure next to hotel makes it easy to find parking no matter what.
review.negativeRemarks: Charging $25 a night to self park seems a little excessive to me.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco and San Jose are near by and this location puts your right in between.

review.title: Luxurious and Relaxing
review.reviewText: Arrived late but was welcomed warmly and they even gave me complimentary parking as a new guest.  Found a killer deal on the price through a special on Expedia too!
review.positiveRemarks: The feather bed was great and the linens and pillows enveloped me.  Loved the robe and the comfort of the room.  It was a great stay.

review.title: Quiet and relaxing
review.reviewText: The staff is really nice and the service was good. The arrival treat was nice surprise.

review.title: Don't belong
review.reviewText:
Awesome hotel, but upon check in, the front desk lady gave us the feeling that we don't belong to a 4-star hotel.  Granted, we look haggard from our trips but that doesn't makes us not worthy to be there.  
Other than the check in, the room was nice & comfortable room.  Our room had a view of the parking lot (after all we don't belong there).  Bay 223 was wonderful, excellent food.

review.title: Very nice Hotel. Enjoyed our stay.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay. This hotel seems to cater more toward the corporate crowd with all the big corporate businesses nearby. But we felt very comfortable there for a family vacation even if we weren't dressed in suits. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel convenient to all venues in the Bay Are
review.reviewText: I had such excellent service and room was clean, hotel still look new. I love everything about this hotel. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my family, friends and co-workers.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and fresh scent everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe the valet parking service.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfectly quiet and not too close to freeway noise. Yet, it is convenient to all shops, airport and city locations.

review.title: Decent hotel, overpriced for what it is
review.reviewText: Sofitel San Francisco Bay thinks it is a posh city hotel, but it's really just an average hotel trying to look fancy. None of the staff was particularly friendly or went out of their way to help. We were four to a room, and were given only two sets of towels. When I called down to the front desk, they fixed it, but acted annoyed about it. The pillows are so mushy, your head sinks to the bed. And the restaurant is extremely expensive, although the food is very good. That said, everything was very clean. Just nothing particularly great to make you rave about the hotel. Compared to our stay at the Doubletree in Berkeley, this wasn't great.
Excellent staff and beautiful hotel.Pool is warm and hotel view was amazing!

very nice hotel,forty min from the piers, 20 min to air port.  break fast over priced but over all I loved the place . visitors did not tip the shuttle drivers,i did.   free shuttle from airport to hotel during operating hours
review.positiveRemarks: super clean very good late nite pizza
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast buffet should be lower price

review.title: Nice place in upscale area.
review.reviewText: Had a very pleasant over night, nut didn't spend much time at hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Styling, the location, safety.
review.negativeRemarks: The single piece bedding cover is too hot for a normal temperature room.  With a comforter like that, it would have had to been in the 50's F to sleep
review.locationRemarks: Near bay, probably could walk on some paths with views.  Especially quiet during weekends because its an office area.

review.title: Close to airport, but far enough away.
review.reviewText: Beautiful setting. Located on bay inlet. Listed as four star. Beautiful.
review.positiveRemarks: New appearance. Staff well trained. Eager to help.
review.negativeRemarks: Other hotels could learn from them.
review.locationRemarks: When leaving SFO, great place to say goodbye from.

review.title: Slightly tired hotel by the bay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel; nice staff. But the common areas need to be freshened up.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasant staff
review.negativeRemarks: common areas need to be updated
review.locationRemarks: convenient to SFO

review.title: Beautiful hotel close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel; reasonable price for the quality. About 15 miles to SFO so it was convenient

Decent. First stay, booked room for 3, they had a roll away bed set up.. Only 2 towels in the room for 3 guests. Second stay, booked same room for 3 guests. No roll away bed set up. Had to call to request one and was told I was going to be charged $20 when I reserved the same room as the first stay for 3 guests. They did not end up charging me. Still only 2 towels for 3 guests. Breakfast of any form is not included which I find highly unacceptable. You are paying a large amount to stay here so breakfast should be included especially if you are a calling yourself a luxury hotel. Parking should also be included. You pay for a room, you should get all of the comforts and amenities to support your stay there. The pool was VERY dirty.

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable room. Close to the airport but far from the city.

review.title: This is really just a near airport hotel
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at other Sofitel hotels, and always found them to be very nice. This one was s bit of a disappointment. The location is basically a corporate park with nothing nearby. The very small pool was just ok, no hot tub. The bar/lounge area lookednice but we got out and had a lovely dinner in south San Francisco. 
Long wait to check in, but staff were very nice.

review.title: Great for me and my dog!
review.reviewText:
Lovely, pet friendly hotel. The only complaint is the parking structure is the only place to park in the area, and they charge $25 for an overnight stay (I arrived at 11pm and left by 10am). I didn't ask what 2 nights would have cost...
Also, the tub/shower had nicks that weren't repaired, but being on the dog floor, I didn't mind.
Everyone was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should be included.
review.locationRemarks: Just passing through.

review.reviewText: excellent hotel, staff, location. It has a shuttle service.

review.title: I would not recommend
review.reviewText:
Food was below average, staff morale seem low and not happy people, over priced for what you get, rooms are outdated. 

I travel to the Bay Area frequently and would not recommend. Work or pleasure

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Loved my stay. Everything was great. Comfy bed, clean new bathroom, great hotel amenities, stable internet connection, free shutle to the airport.

review.title: Nice hotel, great staff, good location
review.reviewText:
Reception staff always friendly and very helpful.

Location on the lake is great for getting out to complete my morning exercise and also made a nice walk to the office and back with the colleagues I had over for a workshop.

Restaurant small and friendly with good food, never felt crowded. Good service in the bar area. Rooms a nice size and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff service, particularly the way they addressed an issue not of their making, which really demonstrated customer focused flexibility. Great sleep!
review.negativeRemarks: Larger gym with more bikes and some weights - can get very busy some mornings and only one upright bike.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet business location on a lake which is nice. Walking distance to offices. For restaurants outside the hotel you need a car/taxi.

review.reviewText: 2nd time staying here..great experience both times..
Our view through our Junior suite was very impressive.  Room service was excellent. Faster than I expected. Definitely looking forward to booking this hotel again on out next visit to the Bay Area.

review.title: Nice hotel by a beautiful bay.
review.reviewText: excellent.  The only pity is the food  in the restaurant is too "expensive" given the amount and quality of it, i.e., value does not match the amount of money paid for the food.
review.positiveRemarks: excellent location in a beautiful setting, comfortable room and bed and amenities; nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: more alternatives in prepared food with lower prices; a nice map highlighting local restaurants, attractions, famous companies such as Oracle.
review.locationRemarks: location is wonderful, but not sure what things we could do since the information from the Concierge was not enough -learn from Courtyard by Marriott.

review.reviewText: Room was small and beds were extremely uncomfortable- needs an upgrade

review.title: On the water  (lagoon)
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel glitch at check in but was taken care of

review.title: Nice hotel. Excellent service.
review.reviewText: This was our 6th time staying at this location. Service is consistently excellent. Rooms are usually clean. The sofa bed pull out doesn't have enough back support,  but overall everything else was good.
Such a beautiful hotel!  The staff were so kind and courteous. The bed was so comfy!  Everything was amazing.
Great experience! Beautiful view. Friendly staff. Overall, felt luxurious... I look forward to staying there again in the near future !

review.title: Comfortable, clean and pleasant
review.reviewText: We booked at a hotel that was really awful. We stayed one night and fled to the Sofitel as we had stayed there before. What a relief to be in such a comfortable, pleasant and luxurious space!
Friendly staff and beautiful luxury hotel. Restaurant food and service was five star!
review.positiveRemarks: Gorgeous lobby, outstanding service, excellent restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms nice but needed updating.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was in a business district so need transportation or short walk to food and grocery. Quiet and peaceful area.

review.title: Nice mini vacation
review.reviewText: Two night was excellent and affordable.  We almost didn't wanna leave
The staff was lovely and the room was very clean and comfortable. The food was exceptional.

review.title: Convenient, comfortable
review.reviewText: Best hotel in the area. While not as nice or as fancy as other Sofitel locations, I still enjoy staying here. The staff is always welcoming and friendly, the rooms are well kept and I always sleep soundly. I love their beds!

review.title: Beautiful & Peaceful
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel from the moment we saw it.  Although it is very far from the site in San Francisco, the area itself was very beautiful. The room was very nice all though I thought it a bit small, and I was disappointed that I didn't get the Lagoon view that I thought I would have. Overall the experience was great, and the staff with excellent.  My biggest complaint would be the shuttle service. It is very unclear to the customer that they are required to call to reserve pick up at airport. I waited over an hour for the shuttle. Then to leave the hotel there's only the one shuttle that holds six people, and if it's full you have to wait another hour. I will say that the staff handled the situation very well,  and was able to get me to the airport without me waiting. I do thank them for that, and they are very very professional.

review.title: Nice hotel but out a ways from San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and accommodating, room was good with comfortable beds. Only complaint about the whole place is the pool being too shallow at 4 ft but besides that I'd recommend it as a nice place outside the city

review.title: Lovely snd  elegant
review.reviewText: Near a lagoon with a nice walking path, shuttle to airport, bar/ restaurant and coffee shop in lobby, most excellent customer service with well-dressed staff, safety features  for the single female traveler, very comfortable room with a clean, modern look- I will definitely stay again!

review.title: Chic, nice and quiet hotel.  Convenient location
review.reviewText: Will check in again.  Never fail to please. Good locale. Tasteful decor.  Reasonably priced.
It was a nice hotel.  However, the bathroom could use an upgrade.  The common areas are very nice and modern.  The coffee shop is very convenient.  Overall, a nice upscale hotel.

review.title: nice, and peaceful hotel
review.reviewText:
beds are comfortable, staff are courteous.
Definitely recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: ambiance is relaxing

review.reviewText: was good , had to pay for parking 30 a day. room was nice and area was good

review.title: Not quite upto the mark
review.reviewText: The location was quiet but the rooms seemed to have very old fixtures.. It seems like the hotel got a 4 star only because of the "Sofitel" brand name.. I would prefer Best Western Plus near San Francisco airport as a better deal for the same price I paid..

review.title: They were short staffed - long waits
review.reviewText: I waited in line for 19 minutes behind 5 other to checkin. Finally had to CALL on my phone to get someone to the desk. Same story on checkout. Waited 20 minutes in long line finally dropped my key. No bell staff at check in and $55 dollar parking fee. I expected more for the price and 4 stars. I travel a lot and will never stay there again. Probably a 2-3 star hotel.
It is a clean and convenient hotel located by lake. However I was confused with parting since the front dest clerk didn't tell me details about parking.

The check in was a problem  I told the hotel clerk that two of my guests were leaving the next day and the hotel told me I had to deal with it with Expedia.  Expedia told me I had to deal with it with the hotel  I am not sure if I am ever going back to the hotel and if I am ever booking a hotel thru Expedia again

review.title: Close enough to the airport
review.reviewText:
I was looking for a hotel to stay at the night before my girlfriend had to fly out of SFO. We had planned to attend the Giants baseball game that evening. I wanted something close to the airport and had transportation options to get to the ball park. The Cal Train was a couple miles away from the hotel. 

The hotel was very clean and modern looking. It has a European feel to it. The name is French if I'm not mistaken. There was plenty of hotel guest parking available in the adjacent parking structure. Valet parking was also an option. My room had a personalized greeting card waiting for me in my room along with a small box of chocolates. The bathroom was large and the room had a great view of the lagoon next to the hotel. During my stay I ordered room service late in the evening and it arrived quickly. This was a very nice hotel and would stay at it again if giving the opportunity.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk reception was very courteous and professional. Door person was there upon my arrival to open the front door for me and greet me.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the freeway, far enough from the airport that I could not hear the planes take off

review.title: Great hotel convenient to SF and Silicon Valley
review.reviewText: Great location. Easy check in and friendly staff. Had a nice view of the lagoon. Super comfy bed and slept very well.
Very nice,clean,comfortable rooms,nice and clean area

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the beach
review.reviewText:
Nice facility, clean & beautiful but service was not very good!
I reserved 2 queen beds room for 3 adult though when I got confirmation later my room was 1 king bed.
The staff drought role in bed and towels for 3rd person finally after we asked twice.
Next day, when we check out they charge $20 more for the role in, they waived it cause we complained though their customer service wasn't very professional.
review.positiveRemarks: beautiful fcility
review.negativeRemarks: customer service
review.locationRemarks: near air port & beach, shuttle bus goes every hour to airport & bard ( train to the downtown)

review.reviewText: The only thing I don't like is the $25 per day for parking. We stay at the Sofitel whenever we come to the Bay Area and I think they should give us a break on that. I like the fact that it's self park.

review.title: would recommend highly
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable rooms. Nice safe area. Received excellent customer service at time of arrival. Friendly courteous staff and handled our check in quickly

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. This was our second time staying. Location is just 15 min south of SFO. Nice lagoon view. Convenient for touring around San Francisco. One thing I wish all hotels would start offering is the use of coin laundry in their hotels.
We have stayed her a number of times, and it is always superb. Great service, excellent accommodations, and delicious food.

review.title: Very good accommodation and very good place
review.reviewText: It was nice stay and very good location and pleasant one
Easy check-in and nice staff. Rooms are very nice and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice amenities and extras for Expedia VIP status.
review.negativeRemarks: The store that sells sandwiches, ham & cheese croissants, etc. should have the ability to warm up food.

review.title: Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: My experience in Sofitel Hotel is excellent, because, the ubication is an exclusive area, clean, tranquility, the staff are very polite. Of course I will recommend to friends and family. Congratulations!
Thought the tub was going to be. Offer since I had gotten a luxury king with lagoon view but not it was tiny

review.title: Beautiful
review.reviewText: Gorgeous and classy. They provide a shuttle to and from the airport. The grounds are awesome. Very friendly staff. The food is awe inspiring!
This hotel is quite and away from all the tourist attractions which i liked. I rented a car and traveling to pier 39 took 20 min.

review.title: Very comfortable hotel for a great nights sleep
review.reviewText: Very comfortable stay on business, nice setting by the lake, basic gym allowing a workout in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet and relaxed and able to have a nice 20 minute walk to the office.
review.negativeRemarks: bigger gym with more variety of equipment.
review.locationRemarks: Lovely setting on the lake which you can run around.

review.title: Birthday trip
review.reviewText: The staff at the front desk/cleaning staff were nice and professional. The bed was comfortable, the carpet was stained.
review.positiveRemarks: the bed/the gentlemen at the front door
review.negativeRemarks: the stained carpet
review.locationRemarks: eating places

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with very comfortable rooms.  Beds were some of the most comfortable out there.  Very secure hotel with room keys required to get to every floor

review.title: Excellent hotel, staff and standards but...
review.reviewText: There is nothing in the area and a 25 min car drive or 1hr 15 min and 2 mile walk public transport. The facilities are wonderful. It is very relaxing. The lady restaurant manager is wonderful. Go to relax and escape-there is a pool & gym-or if working in Silicon Valley but not so good if you want to explore San Fran and don't have transport.

review.title: Spring Break
review.reviewText: Booked my daughter and friends for spring break from college as s surprise, not a warm welcoming from front check in staff:( No personality, snobbish they were not treated like a first class customer! Hey! Our money is just as good as your other snobby people that patronize your hotel! My company will take our business meetings elsewhere for the future! As for management...get your staff in order or hire new!!   Oracle Rep
It was not good they put a small price but then charging for parking , for upgrade room and etc..

review.title: Mediocre Experience
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very non 4 star.  The "king" bed is very small and should be re-certified and checked.  The mattress was extremely hard and uncomfortable with pillows that were very hard and large, had to sleep without a pillow because they were hurting the neck.
The staff was very unwelcoming at the check-in.

Everything else was 4 star quality.

review.title: Dated
review.reviewText: The furniture is very dated.  WIFI is passable at best.  remotes for TV's were either slow or didn't work..  Almost none of the headphone jacks in gym worked.  Menu in restaurant is very limited.  place will always be busy because of proximity to Oracle, so wonder if they feel they don't have to try very hard anymore.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Update

managementResponses.response:
We very much appreciate your comments regarding your stay at the Sofitel San Francisco Bay.  It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.
I will share your comments with our team.  I am sure that this feedback will serve as an encouragement to all of our staff as we strive to continuously improve the quality of our services.
Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope your next visit will be as pleasant as the previous one.

Sincerely,
Jim Gould
General Manager
Sofitel San Francisco Bay, California

review.title: Lovely Hotel, but some distance from SFO Airport
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel; the hotel is immaculate as are the rooms, but the overnight parking fee is a little excessive. The major downside for us was the distance from the Airport and the poor airport shuttle service which is hourly at best. We ended up taking a taxi from the airport as the hour plus wait for the shuttle offered by the hotel was too much after a long flight.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel public space, the rooms and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The Airport Shuttle Service.
review.locationRemarks: This is really a Business Hotel in the heart of Oracle HQ land; there's not much in the local area, but San Francisco is not too far away.

review.title: Nice hotel, very pretty
review.reviewText: Unfortunately some of the staff were not at all personable. In particular the Valets. I was made to feel bad for choosing to self park instead of valet. Not good.

managementResponses.response: Thank you very much for lovely comments! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

review.title: Wow
review.reviewText: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: No

review.title: Spacious rooms, Great staff.
review.reviewText:
At first we didn't understand why this hotel is more expensive than other 4 stars hotel, but after coming, we understood. Not only were the rooms extremely neat and spacious, but the staff were just amazing!
The interior is bright and stylish (not like some old 4 star hotel)
The hotel is next to a lake! So it's great for a morning jog outside or even just seeing the view from the gym.
review.positiveRemarks:
Great staff. 
Spacious room
Lake
review.negativeRemarks: The parking fees are high for a parking that is outside of the building.
review.locationRemarks: Great food places. Close to the airport

review.title: Hotel has beautiful view
review.reviewText: Staffs were so nice and welcome. Service is wonderful. Room is very clean. The view is so beautiful. It is very quiet in the weekend. I has a good time to stay here.

review.title: Highly unprofessional Front Desk, including manage
review.reviewText: A 4-star hotel should have better trained front desk, especially managers.  All are equally ignorant and unprofessional.
review.positiveRemarks: Facility was good. Shuttle was good. Check-in staff was highly unprofessional.
review.negativeRemarks: Better training for front desk, including the manager.
review.locationRemarks: Not applicable.  In transit.  Rested for a few hours and left.

review.title: Close to SFO Airport
review.reviewText: One day stay for business. Nice location in Redwood City. Not really close to train or Bart.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to airport, and well fashioned facility.
review.negativeRemarks: Advertises free airport shuttle. You need to phone them for a pick up. Returning to SFO prior to 6 a.m. necessitates a forty dollar cab ride
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located between San Francisco and San Jose

review.reviewText: Only needed to stay over night so chose this for proximity to APO and on site restaurant so we didn't have to bother going out for a meal with an early flight next morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, beautiful room.
review.negativeRemarks: Thet tried to change $50 unrequested room upgrade which we would not pay as we were not asked if we wanted a room upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Only there overnight with early flight next morning.

review.title: Fine for a one night stay
review.reviewText: Large rooms and convenient business location. The hotel is a bit tired.... could use a refresh. It's no quite up to the Sofitel standards I am used to.
review.positiveRemarks: large room
review.negativeRemarks: Freshen it up

review.title: Overall Nice
review.reviewText: The room was fairly good overall, featuring a comfortable bed and a great view of the bay. The hotel features a reasonable French restaurant and is very pet friendly.The body care products provided by the hotel is great... You can buy them online even!  However, the time for room service is rather inconsistent, ranging from about 9a to about 4p... The shower caps and the shower gels were not refilled during room service.
review.positiveRemarks: View, location, and body-care products
review.negativeRemarks: Room service, staff

review.title: Long Term Stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel during the Xmas season...it is starting to look a little dated....shower curtain falling off,,,tiles in poor condition...wall paper stained in spots,,,and carpet for sure needs replacing...on the plus side staff is great and food is good as well...parking is expensive and they should give a discount for people staying for a long stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are dated and not up to the standard expected of this hotel.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText:
It was a nice place to stay. The room had great views of the water. The staff were amazing!!!! 

The hotel staff were especially helpful when I walked out of the lobby one afternoon. I was carrying my 10 month old in a car seat, my 2 year old was dragging behind me, and I was carrying 2 bags. A hotel staff saw me and took my bags. He offered to take my 10 month old, so I politely turned down his offer. Instead, he took the hand of my 2 year old and helped him walk quickly. The staff person walked with me to the car garage. 

Speaking of car garage. I didn't expect to pay a parking fee. In the end, I was OK with that because it wasn't far from the lobby.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Room and services were excellent. Very difficult to locate even though it was in sight!  Streets leading to hotel were a maze and poorly marked.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything except very difficult to locate even though it was in sight!  Streets leading to hotel were a maze and poorly marked.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing within the scope of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Locating (see above).

review.title: Nice hotel, parking a problem
review.reviewText: Although it is in a business area, the only place to park is in their parking structure, for which they charge $25.00 per night for self parking.  This policy started about 2 1/2 years ago.  Did not charge before, it was complimentary for guests.   There are other hotels closer to the downtown/shopping for the same price, are very nice, and includes parking at your door.
review.locationRemarks: Out away from shopping and entertainment.  Need a car.

review.title: Simply the best!!
review.reviewText: Love this place. Second stay here in the last month. Wonderful place to stay, people, atmosphere, amenities, rooms, nothing negative about this one. Can't go wrong, even a blue collar working man like me can appreciate this place. Respectful and help me out with parking my truck as it doesn't fit in the parking garage.

review.title:

34.00 double

review.title: Wonderful hotel with great staff. Close to freeway
review.reviewText: Great time we have. We will tell our friends about this hotel.

review.title: A couple of issues
review.reviewText: The amenities were great but there were a couple of issues: the shower door did not shut all the way; the parking garage key did not work; the roll away bed I requested at 3pm I had to request again at 9pm; The 5:15am wake up call we requested never happened; there was an outlet on the floor in front of the couch I did not see a I cut my foot on it. However, I spoke to the Director of Guest Services who seemed extremely interested in my comments and wanted to make sure that none of this happens again. This is absolutely a 4 Star Hotel that just had a hiccup during my second stay there. Please always tell your hotel what they can improve on for future guests.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the Suite 1 King Bed Prestige room. Lots of room, very romantic, quiet, comfortable and perfect for work, families or a couples get away.
review.negativeRemarks: Other than the few issues we had with our second stay, which I am sure they will resolve, everything was great.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is next to a water area which is nice but more in an business area which makes it quiet. The Same Mateo Events Center is very close.

review.title: Very nice hotel and Super pet-friendly!
review.reviewText: My wife and I booked a last minute room after having a hard time finding somewhere truly Pet Friendly without a million crazy pet fees. Upon arrival and check-in, the staff was extremely nice and helpful. Something that we found very neat is that the entire 3rd floor is dedicated for guests with pets. When entering the room, the first thing we notice was a doggy bed, with toys, dog bags, a food & water bowl, and they even had doggy room service!  It was an overall pleasant stay and I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone, especially if traveling with pets!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is next to water. It makes for a nice walk and good place to take pictures.

review.title: more less in business zone no curb parking
review.reviewText: hidden parking on facility costs, refrig in room had something in frig blocking anything a normal small frig can hold. when told we would get parking fee back they skimped on first day parking.
review.positiveRemarks: the presentation when coming into the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: more refrig room for customers, possibly a small microwave for customers. you own the parking lot why charge to park or add to room price
review.locationRemarks: kinda a ways from downtown san fran

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel good drinks and very nice workers

review.title: Elegant Hotel with Comatose Front Desk Clerks
review.reviewText: 5 stars for Valet attendants and housekeeping. 2 stars for front desk. Valet attendants are very accommodating to guests' needs. They are warm and polite and the epitome of Sofitel service. Front desk personnel need to be warmer and more attentive. The idiot that checked me in kept referring to me as Mr. and Sir. While this was hilarious to my daughter and myself, it was obvious that the clerk was only looking at my name. He never once made any eye contact with me, which is really hard. But mostly he talked to the paper in front of him. Names such as Teri, Leslie, Dana can be either male or female. Mr. Comatose then took my credit card for typical security, but at 4 a.m. I woke up to the blinking message light. I called down to the front desk and was told that they did not have my credit card on file. for me. I could not do an express check out. I went down the next morning to check out and was told yet another story: they did have my card on file, but still needed me to check out in person. I expressed my dissatisfaction of being awakened by a blinking message light at 4 in the morning, and was told that they do that every night. Really? I'm the only guest that finds this practice disruptive. The lack of empathy was evident. Cashier #72 with the User ID of 0922ALBAR seemed bothered and inconvenienced, but, at least he did make eye contact and recognized that I was a woman. What a relief! I could have departed with a gender identity crisis!
review.positiveRemarks: The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The linens and towels are luxurious.  The rooms are kept at a perfect temperature.
review.negativeRemarks:
Front Desk: a terrible combination of arrogance and stupidity.
Housekeeping should keep Keurig coffee maker clean.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet and safe location with easy freeway access. The elegant Michelin Star All Spice Restaurant is less than 10 minutes away.

review.title: Great Hotel at a great place close to the Airport
review.reviewText: We only stayed one evening, but thought it was a wonderful hotel.  Only complaint was the hotel shuttle.  Had requested a shuttle and ended up waiting over and hour and half for it to come.  Another couple at the shuttle stand had also requested a shuttle and were waiting as well with us for the shuttle and were equally frustrated.  Other than that, all and all, had a pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the French theme
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: Only stayed one night, but a short distance to San Francisco

review.title: Extremely comfortable
review.reviewText: The sweet words huge extremely clean and amazingly comfortable. The staff was excellent and the hotel amenities were amazing. I would recommend this to anybody staying in the area. It is well worth your time.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel in the heart of Silicon Valley.
review.reviewText: Fast, friendly, helpful check in.  Gorgeous room with Frette robe and extremely comfy bed. This is my prefer hotel when staying in the area.  The only negative is they charge for parking.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here based on its proximity to SFO but still found it to be quite a drive to the airport. Paying $25 dollars for parking seemed a excessive seeing as how the hotel was quite removed from the main road but what can you do. Other than all that, the stay was great, and comfortable. The room was awesome, and it had great views.

review.title: Complimentary shuttle to SFO
review.reviewText: Overall satisfied, only complaint is with the bathroom. The shower was slow to drain and there was only one light setting in the bathroom ... ridiculously bright with the pink/daytime hue to highlight all of your imperfections! Eeek!
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary shuttle was very nice, especially to take into SFO to catch the BART for more financially friendly travel to Fisherman's wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing for bottled water/beverages in the caf was a bit much at $4.25 for a small bottle of coke... $5 for a bottle of water

review.title: It seems that Expedia failed to share our request
review.reviewText:
It seems that Expedia failed to share our request for an "Accessible shower with hand rails" with the hotel.  Luckily, the on duty manager, Dawn, went far out of her way to reassign us to a room with a suitable shower for the full 6 days of our stay.  Our replacement room did have a higher rack rate.  To Sofitel's credit, they did not charge us anything extra for the upgrade.

Much to our surprise on our last full day, Sunday, housekeeping failed to do our room even though we were away from approximately 0930 to 1700 and the do not disturb indicator was not on the outside of our door.  Housekeeping was contacted and came while we were out for supper.

It was a pleasant surprise that low speed wifi was available at no charge and we found the speed to be quite acceptable considering the price.
review.positiveRemarks: See above
review.negativeRemarks: The floor pan in our shower was cracked.  ( room 847)
review.locationRemarks: The location is in a high tech industrial park.  Because of this, I believe their rates were greatly discounted the thanksgiving interval.

review.title: We loved it!
review.reviewText: Everyone was so nice. The room was very comfortable. And the price was great. We will stay there again.

review.title: Ok for the price.
review.reviewText:
Stayed for a week during thanksgiving. Had  few issues. Sink was backing up. After calling to hotel staff a few times, it finally got fixed. Next issue was with HVAC and it also took a few calls to hotel personal to be fixed.
However restaurant was nice. Listened some live music one night so it was good.

review.title: 1st class all the way
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay. Treated us blue collar working men with respect. We looked like the Beverly Hillbillies rolling in but the were gracious. Wonderful stay, bed is awesome!! Food great, plenty of amenities. The fastest elevators I have ever been on, always an elevator with an open door waiting in the lobby. Nice walking area along the waterfront, a dock for boats. Not much more to ask for.

Very friendly people.  Comfortable bed.  Super clean.  Asked for a top sheet and a wine opener and they were brought in minutes.  Service was great.  $25 charge for parking car in their garage should be added to the room charge so u actually know what price you are comparing to with other hotels. The hotel is great.  Quiet. Professional. Really great shower.

review.title: beautiful hotel with view of bay
review.reviewText:
I stood at Sofitel san Francisco with my husband for our 10 year anniversary...this hotel is beautiful !! inside and out would have loved to enjoy the pool but we went in November 

we had complimentary macaroons(delicious) waiting for us in our room upon arrival, we came in late due to a late flight which was no problem with checking in. we had a beautiful room with an amazing view of the pool and bay area. the bed was sooo comfortable I would've slept in all day if I didn't want to enjoy my trip! lol also had complimentary coffee we could make ourselves in the room which was a big plus! we forgot our keys in the room once and there was no problem getting a replacement. room service was also very good and quick. 

valet-one gentleman was especially nice ONE DAY when he brought our car over the parking lot note this was the ONLY employee to do so.(we stayed 3 days) we tipped him and he was very happy! :-) 

cons- while leaving the hotel many times we were not greeted ie: good morning BUT every time the couple or people behind my husband and I would be greeted. even though we may be a young couple we should be treated fairly as other couples regardless of image or age!! this impacted my view of the staff greatly.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the hotel area it was very quiet and peaceful far enough from the city but close enough to do our escapades
review.negativeRemarks: I think the only thing that would be better would be not charging the guest for hotel parking. they are different fees applied to daytime/nighttime
review.locationRemarks: we visited the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz Island, Painted Ladies/Full house, Winchester Mansion, Gloria Ferrer Winery, and downtown SF - AMAZING

review.title: probably best hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: it's great for SFO proximity ....could use a steam,shower and locker room for gym....a proper coffee shop separate of the main restaurant ....all in all 31/2- 4 Star

Everything was great from check in to check out. Facilites and amenities were luxury experience. We will definitely staya t another sofitel next time. The receptionist when we checked in was very helpful. We booked through expedia as we were driving so it was within 30 mins and when we got there the reservation was not there yey but he kept apologizing for the wait and gave us a free room upgrade.

review.title: Absolutely the best place ever to stay!!!!
review.reviewText:
The management has done a stellar job hiring the most lovely, caring, well groomed and mannered staff.
It was like going back in time to an age where people actually cared about you.
Old world grace and integrity in a new world setting.
The facility is spotless, indulgently beautiful, and the food was excellent.
I have been telling my friends that there is no place else that would be better; if going to San Francisco and
surrounding areas.
review.positiveRemarks:
The pillows were amazing....
The room cleaners were compulsively amazing...
The hotel lobby and valet staff were self less , kind and caring.
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure you put these all over the world.
review.locationRemarks:
This is in Redwood City and that is a small trek down Hwy 101 into San Francisco.
Easy access to the city and places beyond.

review.title: Great room!!
review.reviewText: Stay the weekend for the Niners game, very quiet hotel. Room was so comfortable, wife didnt even want to leave the bed. Bad thing was the guy up front told us parking would be a flat rate of 30 bucks, he didnt mention per day. So we thought it was a one time fee. Other than that it was a great hotel.
I'll keep this hotel simply the best secret place to stay in California

review.title: First trip to San Francisco.... 49er football
review.reviewText:
It was great and rewarding!!! We were able to visit Golden Gate Bridge and attend game winner 49ers. 
Wonderful food and hospitality at its best

review.title: Sexy & Private
review.reviewText: It's my own mini Las Vegas where whatever happens in the privacy of your room stays in your room. All personnel were kind and respectful in all areas of service. Loved the atmosphere, the food and the location,

review.title: Good hotel overall
review.reviewText: The amenities are expensive. Parking is $25/day, $30 if you valet. Breakfast is fabulous. Best shower I've ever uses at a hotel! A little mildew around the sink area.
The grounds surrounding the hotel were so serene, offering travelers a wonderful escape from business dealings or the flurry of San Francisco traffic. We loved it!

review.title: High quality at great price
review.reviewText: The hotel proved to be even more comfortable and elegant than the pictures.  Well worth a stay, if you're in the San Francisco area.

review.title: Great Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: Perfect place to stay..Hotel is very nice. well kept..Only thing is parking fees.. As a guest  you should not have to pay for parking..all other yes..
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel is located in a nice quiet area, yet not far from many nearby stores an restaurants..
review.negativeRemarks: Need to eliminate the parking fee for guests..All others should pay..

review.reviewText: I love the hotel and staff!  They are so courteous and willing to help.  Get some more sets of handweights in the gym and it would be great if it were larger.  Overall, I truly enjoy staying.
review.negativeRemarks: The Gym could use some upgrading and add'l handweights.

review.title: Great hotel near SFO airport
review.reviewText: The entire stay went very well. Helpful staff and well kept facilities. Shuttle services to and from airport was very efficient and helpful as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, well kept hotel with professional staff. Pool and outdoor seating area was very nice as well.
review.locationRemarks: Only a few minutes from SFO and their shuttle services made getting to and from the airport and BART station very easy.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Ron, 

Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Sofitel San Francisco Bay.  I am sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations; please allow me to express my sincerest apologies.

At Sofitel, we strive to provide a superior service experience for every customer; therefore your feedback is very important to us.  Please contact our hotel to discuss your stay further so we can ensure your next stay with us in enjoyable.

To make our guests' stay more comfortable, we also offer complimentary coffee service on the 3rd, 5th, 8th floor and hotel lobby every morning.  Our suites also feature the Keurig single cup coffee makers.

It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to better serve you in the near future.

Sincerely,

John Hutar
General Manager
Sofitel San Francisco Bay, California

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: Everything was very nice. Room was very homey also. Only problem I had the cost for parking. 25 dollars for just an overnight stay. Should have had an armed guard for that price!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the beach
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent our honey moon. It was very pleasant and beautiful surprises in the room. We had put on the table a bottle of champagne with strawberries with chocolate and a cute note of congratulations.  Many thanks to you for making it a very special day in our lives.

review.title: Housekeeping was mint!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. The JR Suite was quiet, clean and pleasant. The room was always clean, fresh, replenished and tidy upon our return from our daily excursions.
review.positiveRemarks: Housekeeping was excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: Greater seating capcity on the free shuttle service would be my recommendation for improvement.

review.title: Purell Purell Everywhere
review.reviewText: Hotel is "fine".  But I was actually troubled by the fact that there are bottles of Purell literally everywhere!  In the rooms, at check out. Etc.  If they think they are trying to convey a sense of "clean", for me, they did just the opposite:  What germs are they trying to hide!
review.positiveRemarks: Efficient
review.negativeRemarks: Feels a bit "institutional"
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do unless you like staring at the Oracle yacht that won the America's cup

review.reviewText: It was my birthday and when we checked into the hotel, not 10 minutes later there was a knock on the door and a staff employee was there with a gift for me.  The staff was very friendly, especially the shuttle drivers and doorman, lovely gentleman!
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious rooms, comfortable bed and linens, and nice view from our room, 633.
review.negativeRemarks: The shuttle service to and from the San Francisco Airport to catch the BART, there was only one shuttle so the wait time was too long.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is designed for business people.

review.reviewText: I was told that there were no King beds available even though I booked a King bed on Expedia. I told then that I just flew in from Puerto Vallarta, MX after being evacuated for hurricane Patricia and all of the sudden a King bed magically became available. If I had not said that, I would not have received what I had paid for online :(

review.title: Really good hotel and convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Our experience was very good.  The staff could not do enough for us.  One glitch was the airline ticketing machine did not work.  It took us some time to figure this out.  We then went to the business office and printed our tickets in minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and upscale.
review.negativeRemarks: I have no recommendations
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to SFO and we found a great restaurant nearby (Iron Gate).

review.title: Quiet hotel close to small shopping center.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay. Good looking hotel. Friendly accommodating staff. Rooms need some updating though.

review.title: Great room!!
review.reviewText: Great room wonderful staff. Very quiet and comfortable.
Very nice hotel, good stay! I would recommend this hotel to everyone! Front Desk Clerk very helpful!

review.title: Nice hotel with a chic and modern feel
review.reviewText: the Sofitel chain of hotels are always very chic.  I find it funny that many of their staff have accents and are foreigners.  I added a friend to my reservation and they spelled her name totally wrong, even though I spelled it out, but still let her check in because it was "close enough".  The lobby has a trendy bar to hangout at and a nice little French cafe.  The rooms were nice an clean with modern furnishing, but insulation between rooms is lacking.  There is complementary bottled water and coffee and tea in each room.  They do not have a charger for electric vehicles which is surprising for a high end hotel line.

review.title: Beautiful French feeling!
review.reviewText: Beautiful French styled hotel! I just love it pretty. I love the entry mural, the green elegant door, the inner blue-hued design, bar/dining area. and beautiful outside lagoon. It totally pleased me who cares about the lookings! I liked it!
review.negativeRemarks: room is dry, humidifier
review.locationRemarks: close to SF airport, easy drive, right next to Oracle campus, also close enough to the tech area. Very easy drive to SF downtown.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Hotel near the airport. Has great restaurant and bar. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Close to airport and Highway
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, French like hotel, the only thing is there website really didn't tell you much as we well it didn't have a hot tub, just a swimming pool and no free parking you have to paid for parking $25 a night.... everybody is always trying to get that extra dollar from us....

review.title: Gorgeous lobby, trendy lights, bar and decor.
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel with amazing cafe and nice and quiet. Shuttle from airport is unreliable and did lose clothing after room was serviced but was compensated. Taxi to San Francisco about $40 each way

review.title: Beautiful Hotel between airport and Levi Stadium
review.reviewText: Loved everything about this hotel. High end. Great restaurant in the Lobby. Great visual view from the bar and pool. Staff was great very friendly. Hotel was clean. Next time I come to watch the football game I'll be staying here again.

review.title: Amazing Hotel........but
review.reviewText: Stayed for a one day stop over on route to Kona for the Ironman - 7 of us and a small child. We landed at SFO Airport thinking there would be a good shuttle service but unfortunately it leaves on the hour every hour and cannot cope with a group more than 6 people and only limited luggage capacity. So we had to take taxi's at $50 per trip for 2 cars both ways because same thing the following morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Absolutely everything! it is a top quality hotel that wont disappoint you. Rooms, beds, staff cleanliness all top drawer standard.
review.negativeRemarks: When you land after long flight you don't want to be stood for hours waiting for a shuttle to hotel, get a grip guys
review.locationRemarks: we only stayed for one night so went to the Hillsdale shopping mall (home of the cheesecake factory and excellent food) worth a visit

review.title: Nice hotel near to SF airport and restaurants.
review.reviewText:
Loved the hotel.  Wish that when you use Expedia or similar sites that it means you will almost always be
at the very end of the halls by fire escapes and service areas.
review.positiveRemarks: Nicely appointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish self parking was free to hotel guests.

review.title: The glitz and the glamour only extend to the lobby
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this place because it was: a) a 4-star hotel b) looked glitzy and modern from the images c) close to wedding. When we arrived at the airport, we called the front desk to arrange for a shuttle to pick us up. It comes every hour or so and only seats 6 people (5 people in the back and 1 next to the driver). The shuttle arrived and it was an old, run-down van with Sofitel affixed on the side. Now you'd think that for a place like this that markets itself as a fancy schmancy establishment would actually invest in an actual shuttle/bus!

When we arrived, the lobby looked amazing, so we were excited to see our rooms. When we got our room key (room number on key didn't match what front desk person said...nice), we went straight to our room and were very disappointed by what we got. The lights didn't work, the TV was the size of my work computer monitor, and the phone was broken. And whoever said the robes were super plush must've lucked out because ours were thin, ratty, and course.

Before checking out, we called an hour ahead to the front desk to ask when the shuttle would come, which they said would be at the top of the hour every hour. Word to the wise, get to the front desk 15-30 min before the hour to get a spot...6 people per the 1 shuttle is extremely limited space. As we were waiting, the bellhop started counting the people waiting for the shuttle with a worried look on his face. He then went to a couple and straight up said "no room, next shuttle in 1 hour."
review.positiveRemarks: We didn't get a chance to check out the bar, but it looked nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service. Get more vans or at least invest in a nice bus. Oh and it's 2015, get up-to-date TVs.
review.locationRemarks: There is nothing around here. Uber is your friend though.

review.title: A getaway with the mistress
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful. The restaurant was ok. The staff was friendly. The view was gorgeous.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly efficient staff, clean, neat hotel not too close to airport with bonus free shuttle
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, clean, great staff
review.locationRemarks: Handy to Bart at airport wiht free shuttle to an d from so easy to get into city

review.title: It was our 38th Wedding anniversary
review.reviewText: The Hotel was spectacular! We felt so comfortable while we were there. Saturday we ate at the Hotel French restaurant and it was awesome! After dinner the waiter came up and said we heard it was your 38th wedding Anniversary. He presented us with a desert tray that was out of this world on the house.
review.positiveRemarks: There was a young man named Hector who is the assistant guest services manager. He was just awesome period!
review.locationRemarks: Kingfish restaurant in San Mateo. Sunrise over the Lagoon.

review.reviewText: Hotel 4 star. Why you guy take fee for parking lot.  I dont like get. When I just buy package include hotel and parking free.

review.title: Nice hotel but it was far from SF
review.reviewText: Location was very far from San Francisco, it was not close how it said in the website!! Was completely different from description on Expedia website for location reasons. Next time I will do better research. I would of booked a much closer location. Expedia falsely advertised this hotels location.

review.title: Very nice with good view of the bay from our room
review.reviewText:
Nice Hotel.  Staff was friendly and helpful. Self Parking was an additional $25.00/night which I thought was a bit steep. 
Valet parking would have been $38/per night.  Otherwise, a nice place to stay
review.positiveRemarks: Modern, rooms with fridge and extra amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much to improve on
review.locationRemarks: Not a lot to do nearby.  We went into to SF for things to do

review.reviewText: Luxury for cheap... One of the best hotels i have been to.

review.title: Not SFO airport destination
review.reviewText: SFO travelers - this Sofitel is a 20 minute drive from the airport.  It's not an "airport hotel".  The shuttle runs once an hour and you have to summon it on arrival.  I waited 55 minutes for the van to arrive inbound, outbound when I went to the front desk at 8 a.m. to leave I was told they only seat 6 and it was first come first served - as a single traveler I was able to take the last seat but if you were depending on this to the airport you were going to be faced with an expensive cab ride if there was no room for you at the appointed hour - compared to the minibuses that service every other hotel much closer, this is not a good thing.  The hotel itself is first-rate, gorgeous, nothing out of place.  But this is a Silicon Valley business spot, not a SFO stayover stop, and and SFO stayover stop was what I needed after 15 hours of travel to get there.

review.title: Too far from San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice enough hotel, but a long drive to Fisherman's Wharf and AT&T Park.  Also nothing close by to walk to (as in restaurants or even convenience stores). Restaurant I hotel is ok, but pretty expensive...$25 for bacon and eggs and coffee...

review.title: Convenient & Lovely!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in a quiet location. Tucked between the airport and downtown. We'd stay here again!

review.title: Trying to be more than it is.
review.reviewText:
Not sure what Sofitel is going for, but I get the sense that it wants to appear as a 5-star experience, but is really nothing more than a best western with a huge lobby and more elevators. Actually, that is doing Best Western a disservice, at least they have a breakfast bar in the morning and free parking. 

Booked the 'Magnifique Breakfast' package, so I assumed that we would be able to get breakfast before the airport. We ventured downstairs to get a bite to eat, to discover that they do not actually have a breakfast buffet and were offered a la carte items instead. Seeing the offering and prices, we opted out. I don't care if I have to pay for breakfast, but don't pretend that there is a free one if you are not prepared to deliver on that (or charge extra for the privilege). 

Paying for wi-fi and parking seems a bit outdated. I have paid for both before, but in the last 3 years, even the Motel 6 offers these items for free. Just include it in the room charge if you feel the need.

It was clear that the reception staff does not feel the need to treat Expedia customers as full paying patrons, I assume that this is true of other discount bookings as well. Don't offer the discounts if you don't want the customers.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice looking lobby, but that's about it
review.negativeRemarks: in addition to the above items, the room had garbage under the bed that my daughter found, some moldy corners in the shower, and dirty carpet.
review.locationRemarks: Not nearly as close to the airport as it should be to advertise as SFO/Airport location. Office park, so nothing to eat nearby either.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText: We spent 2 nights at the Sofitel at Redwood Shores. We have stayed here many times before and this is our go to accommodation when visiting the bay area. The reason for our stay this time was my husbands 50 year high school reunion and we had the pleasure of sharing the hotel with the Baltimore Ravens football team. What a nice group of men and what a special weekend for us.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is clean, well kept and in a beautiful location on a lagoon with walking paths. Nice lobby and bar area. There is also a restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the 101 freeway for easy driving to San Francisco or Half Moon Bay and the Pacific Ocean in 30 minutes depending on traffic.

review.reviewText: Nice place with nice amenities.  Bar is a little pricey but very comfortable overall.

review.title: Very nice hotel by the lagoon
review.reviewText: The whole family loved this hotel.  It was very roomy and nicely decorated.  And the view, just lovely.
The room was very comfortable and quite nice.  However the restaurant waitstaff was very unfriendly, condescending and inattentive.

review.title: Sofitel Redwood City
review.reviewText: Stayed one night for a very quick trip.  Checked in late afternoon, out the next morning early before 6:00 AM
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient, good shape, comfortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: High price for parking, no late night food, no stores nearby.

review.reviewText: Enjoyable and exceeded expectations . The American breakfast was exceptional .

review.title: Between SF and SJ
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful.  Rooms are quiet and clean. The lobby and dining / bar area are very nice. For some reason the carpets were wet when I checked in??  Overall very nice and would stay there again
Nice hotel. Clean and well staffed. Great location on the Peninsula.  Close to highway 101 and yet far enough off the freeway to not hear any noise. Nice waterway out back.

review.title: Just okay,  very corporate atmosphere
review.reviewText: The hotel  was beautiful, but seemed like a business hotel more than a vacation hotel.  The pool was very small and shallow, not deep enough to swim in. The rooms were very nice and clean and the restaurant was good. The hotel was also about 40 from the city of San Francisco and all of the main attractions and parking was $25 per day. I just felt the hotel was very expensive and didn't seem worth it. A complimentary breakfast would have been nice.

review.title: Nice view of the lagoon
review.reviewText:
1. Given that Sofitel is a luxury hotel, I am a little disappointed that you charge $25 for overnight parking.  I can understand if the hotel is located in San Francisco but since this is in Redwood Shores,  i cannot justify the $25 charge on overnight parking.   

2.  Room WIFI is free for 512K only.  Most hotels offer free high speed wifi internet.

3.  Pool is closed by sunset.  Most hotels with pools are open until 10PM
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, nice ambiance.
review.negativeRemarks:
Parking should be free.

Make high speed wifi free

Pools should be open until 10PM

review.title: Hotel not so close to SF
review.reviewText: Even though this is close to the airport,  it is also far from SF. good place to R&R, could not believe the price for the breakfast and there isn't any close by place to eat without transport. great room, great bed and great morning view from the windows. this is more of a business oriented hotel and location......................
review.positiveRemarks: Sofitel brand hotel
review.negativeRemarks: don't charge parking for the weekend and holiday
review.locationRemarks: none to do anything nearby............

review.title: Issue with airport shuttle service
review.reviewText: Took nearly an hour for hotel shuttle to pick us up.  Hotel claimed only 10 mins from airport but took over 25 mins to get there.  Only one shuttle van at all times (with a broken sliding door).  Hotel itself was fine, staff good, we are grateful to David, on the belldesk helping us with bags and transport back to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: More shuttles

review.title: Old and tired and neither French nor American
review.reviewText:
It started badly!   The door staff greeted me in French, so I replied in French but they did not understand; in fact they had no French except the few words of greeting they had learned parrot-fashion.  American pretentiousness with no substance.  The lobby had had a make-over but once you got past the lobby, it was an old tired and "tatty" hotel, about as far from their "luxury"claim as you can get. Their food that was highly advertised was poor - the only good thing were their prices - they were sky-high.  In Europe the Accor chain has many faults but it usually offers value for money - this old lady did not. 

The hotel has about 300? rooms, but ONE very small shuttle van that goes to SFO once an hour.  You cannot book it so it is "first come - first served"; as a result, we had to spend $85 on two taxi fares. Breakfast was fine and we wondered why it was almost empty until we got the bill - nearly $100 for breakfast - they have charging down to an art form!  

We arrived at the hotel direct from London Heathrow T5 and the Sofitel there is on a different planet.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing at all
review.negativeRemarks:
1. A proper shuttle
2. Stop pretending the staff are French
3. Charge sensible sums for breakfast
4.  Fix the room decor and clean the carpets
review.locationRemarks: It is an airport hotel what more is there to say!

review.title: Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I were in the San Francisco from 9/4-9/8/2015 and stayed at the Sofitol......A WONDERFUL and relaxing place to stay......first class service, rooms, location, ambience, comfort.......I do not normally write reviews but this place was exceptional.  We will return.
review.positiveRemarks: EVERYTHIG

review.reviewText: Bad choice. Do not pay for the hotel it has bad customer service.

review.title: Beautiful place to stay!
review.reviewText: We only stayed in this hotel one night and got an excellent rate on the Internet.   I wish we would hav had more time to spend there. We had a junior suite and it was a beautiful room.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the idea they had a bathroom scale and a  Keurig coffee maker and every amenity one would need.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing I think of that could be improved is their shuttle service to the airport by having an earlier shuttle.
review.locationRemarks: We weren't at the hotel long enough to comment on this.

review.reviewText: It was never good. No suitable facilities and even refrigerator is not there.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: But parking was expensive, $25 self park, $30 valet.
The hotel bed was super comfortable.  The surrounding were quaint for a weekend stay.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: This was a surprisingly nice place to stay.  We liked the small touch welcome gift, was personal and made us feel welcome immediately.  Think the only downside to the place was the bar area in the evenings.  It seemed not capable of serving all the folks that were there.  Only 1 server it seemed, we sat one night at a table in the bar area for like 20 minutes without being approached.  And this was after I asked her up at the bar if they come around to the tables and she said yes.  So I think some evening bar/lounge service improvement could be done.  Other than that, really liked this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Liked look and feel of hotel, grounds were nice, location nice, rooms nice.
review.negativeRemarks: As I said above the service in the bar/lounge in the evenings could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Nice lagoon by the hotel, pretty view and nice to walk around.  It is around a corporate park area, but still nice.

review.title: Would have been nice to have some local tours .

Close enough to the airport and not too far from the hustle and bustle of the city it was ideal for our holiday needs.  We would highly recommend this hotel to any travelling to San Francisco.

review.title: Lovely hotel - awesome bed and pillows!

review.title: Beautiful hotel next to the water!!

The hallways have gorgeorus carpet n sofas next to the elevators if u just wanna sit n enjoy the views! The lobby n place to eat is exactly how u see online

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: I made my reservations in February,2015. I asked for beds for three people. I have a confirmation email stating I will have a room with 2 double beds. Then about 3 days before my vacation started, I got another email from Expedia reconfirming my room with two double beds. When I arrived at the hotel. I was told that my room would have one king bed. I stated that would not be acceptable as there are 3 adults. The front desk lady said that Expedia should have contacted me to let me know. My print out stated 2 double beds with a NO cancellation policy. She kept saying she was sorry and I kept saying that was NOT acceptable. After standing there for about 15 minutes, she said she did have a room with 2 double beds. The room was nice but there was clearly a disconnect somewhere. I am just glad she "found" us a room!!
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room. Nice samples of soap,shampoo,lotion.etc.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been nice to have "free" parking.

review.title: Unfriendly hotel staff
review.reviewText: This hotel charges $25 per night for parking, as my spouse and I were deciding how to pay for the parking - the staff member checking us in said she would waive the charge.  We didn't ask for that, but were grateful to her as we hadn't expected it.  When we got home, the $75, three night parking charge WAS on my credit card that was used to check into the hotel. I feel like she lied to us to get us out of her lobby.  Also, there were no towel racks in the room to hang a towel for use the next day.  They ask that you be "green" and reuse the towels, but there is no where to hang them to dry. The cleaning service seemed to do the bare minimum as well.

Upon crawling into bed we were greeted with a most uncomfortable mattress. Stiff and lumpy, it felt like we were on a sleeper sofa mattress.

We were happy to leave in the morning.

Eventually we ended up using their intercom system to get someone to open the gate so we could get our car out. Then we tried to check out, but no one was around. We waiting for 10 minutes before a hotel person came to check us out. We even asked another staff member to help us or find someone who could and they told us to just wait. review.title: Nice hotel with a fabulous view of waterfront
review.reviewText: The airport is a little bit father than I would have wanted. A cab ride actually costs about $45 each way. The airport pick up from the hotel shuttle was very disappointing. After waiting for 45 minutes I finally had to take a cab spending $45. Fortunately the hotel reimbursed the cab fare when I explained my wait for the shuttle that never showed up. There is no shuttle back to the airport until 6AM, so if your flight leaves early you have to take a cab as I did spending another $45!! The hotel is really nice. Friendly staff and has the French touch to it (Sofitel being French.) The water front is exotic with view of Oracle's HQ. The food was good. They try hard to please their guests with their own unique cuisine and libation - plenty of light weighted and healthy choices. All in all, it was a nice experience and I would recommend business travelers and families for a stay at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Water front and proximity tech companies, notably Oracle.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service to pick up and drop off -  A MUST IMPROVEMENT.
review.locationRemarks: Water front exotic location and close to several world renowned tech companies in the area.

review.title: Mixed bag.
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with lovely rooms and good service; however, one of the draws is that they advertise that they are close to the San Francisco airport with a free shuttle to the airport.  They are not very close - about 13-14 miles away from the airport. And secondly, their shuttle is a six passenger van that was full when we arrived to take it. We had specifically inquired about it upon checking in and we were not told that it was very limited with first come, first serve seating. It was a rude surprise that we were not able to take the shuttle and had to get a cab that cost over $45.  We had turned our rental car in the night before with the expectation of taking the shuttle.  So while it is a nice hotel, I would not recommend it for purposes of being near the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The shuttle service. They need a larger capacity vehicle.
