review.title: Nice Hotel, could improve services.
review.reviewText: Fancy lobby. Receptionist not knowledgeable regarding the free breakfast included in our stay. We registered for 2 adults and 2 kids, they only gave 2 breakfast vouchers. They were not sure if the age of the kids that eat free are 5 or 12 years old. I had to show my reservation email that I included the kids in it. So they asked the manager and we had to come back to the reception at a later date to get the additional vouchers. During the breakfast, the service for our drinks was so slow that we already ate half of our food, we still have no drinks. I had to remind the manager about it. Waiting for our bill took a long time also that we need to remind them twice. The room was very warm when we got in. I adjusted the thermostat and during night time, it was still very uncomfortable. When we called, since the engineers are out, they sent a very small desk fan. Very nice hotel and amenities. I liked the fact that the pool is only 3 and a half feet deep so I can just hang out by the poolside while my kids swim and not worry that they will drown since it is shallow. That is a very big plus for me and my family. The staff at the pastries and coffee shop, and the bar was extremely nice also.

Oh dear Sofitel, what is going on? I arrived at around 8pm on a Saturday night and spent the rest of the night playing musical rooms without the music. I arrived exhausted and just wanting to go to bed and sleep. The hotel room is clean and the bed soft. Ahhhh! and then every time I fall asleep the air conditioning makes this huge noise as the vents contract. I try call downstairs and none of the buttons work. So up I get and go downstairs and they give me a new room, next to the service elevator and it reeks. So down I go again and say I will go back to my original room and they will send up an engineer.  The engineer arrives and he is a very nice man and I tell him to sit in the chair. At that point the showers from all around are going, the kids outside are screaming and he just looks at me in horror. I ask him to look at the phone, which he reprograms for me in 2 minutes. He calls for another room. We go to next room, walk in and there are no lights. He pulls the bed away and plugs in side light and says he will come back with a light bulb for the main light which he does. Finally 2 hours later I get to go to bed. Why is someone not checking your rooms. The next day at checkout they waived the parking fee.

review.title: It's a very nice hotel, that's for sure...
review.reviewText:
We stayed twice at this hotel, once on our way to Italy and then on our return trip. 

There are pros and consand the pros outweigh the cons.
So what are the cons?

Well, if you're depending on the "free airport shuttle", then you have to be prepared to be disappointed (at least some of the time). The shuttle operates only once every hour and takes a maximum of 6 people. So if you happen to be the seventh person, you'll have to take a cab to the hotel (about $40) or Uber (about $25). This promise, to me, was a bit over the top. They promise complimentary trips and most of the time it may well work in your favour. It didn't always work in our favour and you have to be prepared to:

1) Wait for an hour or more (if you miss the shuttle).
2) Be among the first six or you're in trouble. 
3) Allocate a minimum of 20-30 minutes to get to and from the airport.

Nonetheless, the staff go out their way to make you feel welcome. We needed a late check out as our flight was extremely late. Granted it was a quiet weekend, but often staff can "stick to rules". The staff went out of their way to give us an extra late check out. And even around the bar and restaurant we had nothing but extremely professional service.

The rooms were spacious and the beds very comfortable. Overall an extremely good experience and a very good stay indeed.

review.title: They made some really bad mistakes!
review.reviewText:
The hotel messed up the room reservations , the staff who is every bit as bad as
The rest of the world in poor customer service . the hotel manager the very next day fixed the problem and our small family reunion was saved. Don't take what the night manager or clerk says and get less than what you paid/reserved take it up with the daytime manager great lady.
review.positiveRemarks: The obionce and dog frienliness.
review.negativeRemarks: People who the hotel employs like I said earlier the ppl who check you in suck.

review.title: Shuttle Service is Sub-Par
review.reviewText: While the hotel and it's staff were great, their airport shuttle service from SFO leaves a lot to be desired.  My flight was late and after waiting for half-an-hour, I called the hotel.  Turns out the shuttle doesn't run from 11pm-6am.  So that was a $40 taxi ride to get to the hotel.  Then the next morning, it turns out the shuttle is one 6-person van and runs only once an hour!  The night before they had suggested I get there 10 minutes before it left to get a seat, but not true.  They have a list at the front to sign up on and I had to wait for the next shuttle, an hour later, because the 9am shuttle was full by 845am (and some of those passengers were holdovers from the 8am shuttle).  Because of this, I definitely wouldn't stay here again if I'm looking for an SFO airport hotel.

review.title: Complimentary Shuttle ????
review.reviewText:
Arrived into SF, got baggage and called Sofitel for pickup by "complimentary" shuttle.  Was told by front desk clerk that there was only room for six (our party had 4) and that there were already 3 people in line before us.  She said that 3 of us could go now, the fourth would have to wait over an hour for the next round.  Very unacceptable, I spoke with manager in the morning and discussed this and she agreed that they need a larger shuttle or another shuttle.  Had to pay an additional $45 including tip for taxi that I had not anticipated.
Once at the hotel, the rooms were very nice, beds super comfy and breakfast was excellent (French press coffee) and the views were gorgeous.  It was located around 15 minutes from the airport, just across from Oracle, in a nice safe area.  Don't know why they charge for parking though in the suburbs, I guess because they can.  I did not have a car so it didn't matter to me anyway.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds super comfy, breakfast was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: Office area, including Oracle.

review.title: Great SFO/mid-SF bay location. Free SFO shuttle.
review.reviewText: We've stayed here twice and both times have liked it for an overnight. It's a great airport hotel (just fyi: however located maybe 5 - 6 miles south of the airport, but they have a free hourly, on the hour, shuttle to SFO which is also where you can catch BART into the city from the International Terminal).  The staff is great. The rooms are nice and roomy enough. Quiet when we've been there. Pets are allowed, which means you should probably ask for a room that hasn't been used by pets (I don't know if they have rooms that are non-pet rooms, but this last trip, I'm pretty sure it was pet pee not human pee I was able to smell when waking up the next morning). Breakfast ends at 11am but there is a cute little cafe for coffee, pastry. Keurig coffee maker in room. Grounds are very pretty. All in all, very pleasing is how our experience has been.
review.positiveRemarks: More upmarket than most in  this area. Staff is great. Free shuttle to SFO for your flight or catching BART to town. W/end pricing is good.
review.negativeRemarks: More cleaning in the pet used rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to SFO (south of by 10 to 15 minutes), perfect for Redwood City (basicallly mid peninsula).

review.title: Great hotel but parking was an issue.

You are able to drive in and out but the fact that I had to pay was enough for me to not want to stay there again. It is bad enough that I have pay to park anywhere in SF so having to pay an additional fee to stay in a hotel that is nowhere close to DTSF sucked. So for anyone planning on visiting downtown SF be warned that not only will you pay $20 to park at the hotel, but you will also pay to park anywhere in downtown. So my total cost in parking fees alone for the weekend was 75 dollars... :-/

This is a great hotel to stay at if you want the staff to rob you and then the hotel do nothing about it. They stole an atomizer, $350 in cash and some jewelry when taking my bags downstairs and the management literally won't even apologize, even with the police report. I'd avoid this hotel at all costs.

PS - the staff all speak in fake french accents, it's hilarious.

The hotel is located in the Metro center of Redwood City, so there is literally nothing interesting in the surrounding area. 

And the food is boring and overpriced, like all hotel food.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: My family stayed in Sofitel the first time during our first visit to San Francisco.  Very convenient location, only 25 minutes to downtown San Francisco by car.  The room is clean and the hotel facilities are nice. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel In Need Of Director of Operations
review.reviewText: We booked two rooms, one for my husband and me, and one for our college age sons.  The decor of the Sofitel is beautiful and the room is comfortable and clean.  This hotel has a dysfunctional staff.  We chose to valet our car, as opposed to self park. But the valet guy said he was on break and I think our car sat outside the hotel all night because in the morning, it was not in the garage. It was sitting in the passenger drop off area.  This was the start of our problems.  We chose this hotel for the last night of our vacation because it is close to the airport.  My husband decided to take the car back to the rental company early in the morning and get to the airport ahead of us, via tram. The rest of us planned to take the hotel shuttle to the airport.  Only one thing, the hotel valet could not find our car keys.  After some time we became panicked, thinking that we would not be able to return the rental car and make our flight.  Finally, in desperation, I opened the valet's key cabinet and I found our car keys.  I went back to the room to pack and found they had locked me out.  I ran down to the front desk and one worker said to the other, "Well that's because she checked out."  I explained that we had not checked out, my boys were still in their rooms, and I was not even packed yet.  Adding to the stress and madness, the shuttle was1/2 hour late because it was broken down.  We barely got to the airport in time for our flight and I cannot describe how stressful this was!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is beautiful and comfortable.  The food and service at the restaurant is excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk staff and the valet really need to step it up.  A director of operations is needed.
review.locationRemarks: It is very close to the airport and there is a shuttle to the airport.  However, because this hotel is so dysfunctional, you may be late anyway.

review.reviewText: shuttle bus is helpful to manage the time to the airport.

review.title: Needs some updating
review.reviewText:
I have been to this hotel twice in the last few months.  The hotel is nothing to write home about.  The hotel staff seems like they do not want to be there and are very disinterested in providing the guests with excellent service.  The suite is clean fairly except for the mildew in the shower.  The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling and there are stains in the bathroom that are very suspect.  I always bring my Clorox wipes just in case and it seems to be handy in this case.  

The water at this hotel is extremely hot, so take caution when turning the water on.  The water that came out of the bathtub is yellow and looks like urine.  It is also very hot.  

We didn't have a great view, but if you can ask for the room with the view of the jellyfish.  It's cool because you can see the jellies pulsating and sometimes even see the electricity from the jellies and we were on the eighth floor last time.  This time the view was terrible.

The croissants at the bakery downstairs is very light and flaky.  You must try it if you you're in the mood for a croissant.  There is a chocolate mousse tart also which is divine.

If you are not looking for luxury and just a place to spend the night, this may be the place for you.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms/suites could be updated and I could definitely do without the mildew.

review.title: High Quality Hotel That's Convenient For Travel
review.reviewText:
This is the second stay at Sofitel Redwood City with a 4 year interval with the later stay being quite short. Both stays were very good.

The common areas are beautiful and have not noticeably deteriorated over 4 years. While not used, there was significant usage by other patrons who presented as comfortable and relaxed in the bar, etc. While it was not problematic from the writer's view, because of the Holiday period and the weekend stay, non-guests seemed to be a common presence for perhaps Holiday parties/events.

None of the dining options were used so on either stay so they cannot be commented on.

The hotel's proximity to the primary highway facilitated travel and access to sites tied to the purpose of the visit and to food options in the community.

The room was more than satisfactory in cleanliness for even for a fastidious guest, however, such a guest might have noticed some discolouration in the carpeting approaching the doorways (bathroom and main door ). The pillows were very comfortable and the sheets presented as very clean without tangible bleach scent and they felt soft on skin.

The furniture did show some wear (chips, worn away paint/surface) but it seemed consistent with normal wear and tear not abuse (baseboard areas in common hallways also showed a fair amount of wear also).Television selections were good but not a focus as trip was short and room time somwhat limited.

Check-in and out were quickly personably facilitated.
review.positiveRemarks: The overall ambiance and setting, general room comfort and proximity to primary travel artery were pleasing.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps parking could at no cost-current cost of $20 a day takes some getting used to when compared to commonly free parking in other suburban hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Right near Highway 101 for easy access to key locations north (San Francisco, etc.) and south (San Jose, etc.)

review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel but I would rate it a 3.5 not 4 star. I would stay here again because the value was very good and the staff is absolutely too notch. The rooms are comfortable and the food is good too.

review.title: Always excellent
review.reviewText: Rooms are fantastic, location is perfect, staff is excellent
Quick check-in, professional staff. After we got to our room, they called us to find out if everything is ok. Room is clean, comfortable beds, soft robes, nice coffee maker.

review.title: Hotel Staff
review.reviewText: I had a problem with the staff. They are not attentive and not friendly. She kept swiping my credit card. They told me that my card declined the hotel payment.They ask me for another card.  I called my credit card. The representative of my credit card told me that the hotel had charged me twice and it went thru. I went back down to the front desk and nobody knows anything. They did not apologize and was rude.

review.title: Front Desk
review.reviewText: Hotel was being renovated and the front desk staff did not explain why there were no double / double rooms when that is what I had reserved.  After a bit of bullish behavior on my part they did put us in a large corner room with a hide-a-bed which was made comfortable only after we took the feather comforter off the king bed, folded it in half and I slept on top of it.  It could have been a better experience if the front desk staff had been forthcoming with a reason for the inconvenience.

review.reviewText: This hotel was by far one of the bests we have stayed in. It was 30 minutes outside of San Francisco, but definitely worth the drive. It's elegant and in a business area, so it wasn't over crowded and it was real quiet.
The hotel was very aesthetically pleasing. Staff was very nice. The only thing I didn't like was that guests had to pay for parking, both self-park and valet.

review.title: Great business hotel in bay area

review.positiveRemarks: Sun drenched.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to downtown San Mateo which has decent restaurants.  It is not far from south bay and not far from downtown San Francisco.

review.title: San Francisco charm
review.reviewText:
Thank you David for the excellent service and knowledge! David was right, the hotel bakery has amazing French pastries! David made our stay fabulous! 
Also, we would like to mention how amazingly clean our room was kept! Thank you to the maid! You are top notch! 
I would definitely stay again Sofitel
My family and I stayed at this hotel for the weekend and had an amazing experience!!

review.title: NZ Travelling Family
review.reviewText: Hotel was average.  Staff were very pleasant and entrance and foyer great.  However our room on the 9th floor was a little tired.  The shower mixer kept falling off the wall, and the TV was much smaller than the previous 4 star hotels we had stayed at on our trip.  The hotel is quite some distance from the city - which is our issue for boxing.  Certainly targetted at business visitors as right amongest Redwood Business Park, so MUST have a car if their for pleasure.  Was charged $2.80USD for a glass of milk for a child at the cafe!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were friendly, entrance was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower Head repaired - room 909. Concierge desk always unattended.  Targetted approach to those with kids.  2 pillows per person (only 1 each supplied
review.locationRemarks: Apart from Oracle Boat, nothing nearby.  For travellers recommend staying in town - and saving on cars and parking.

review.title: Not worth it for the price! Outdated suites
review.reviewText: Walking into the hotel, the lobby looks beautiful, modern, and upscale. We then went to see our prestige suite which we paid a lot of money for, and it was awful! The room decor is very outdated(stuck in the 80's). The bathroom is dirty with an old broken phone, 80's lighting, chipped paint, and a wet dog smell. We checked out 4 suites and they were all this way. We chose the best one, based on the view only. The room honestly was so disappointing.  We only stayed until midnight and decided to check out. It wasn't comfortable and had a funky stench that wouldn't go away. Come here to hang out in their lounge and lobby. Don't waste your money on a room.

review.title: Made me feel like a queen!!!
review.reviewText: What can I say, absolutely wonderful experience. I arrived late and I was very sleepy and tired. I was checked in very quick. When I got to my room, I had a note welcoming me, midnight cake, a bottle of sparking water, coffee. The price, very reasonable, includes shuttle to and from the airport.. Get a package: airfare and hotel to get the best price; instead of, looking for those cheap motels and hotels that charge a lot and the rooms are dirty, the service is atrocious, and many times far away from the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, located close to the airport, service superb, clean and everything smells beautiful, perfect if celebrating a wedding
review.negativeRemarks: I needed a pen, not pencil, just minor stuff patrons remember

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: In short the hotel was fantastic; the only thing I have an issue with and it was not the hotel at all is the location; I thought it was a tad bit closer to San Fran then it was but other then taht it was perfect :)
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly and when you walked in it had an amazing smell; I really want to know how they make that smell linger it was fantastic!
review.negativeRemarks: Valet and Parking expense but hey it is what it is
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is exactly 25 minutes from San Jose, 15 min from Palo Alto and 25 minutes from San Fran depending on traffic. Keep that in mind when booking

review.title: Would have expected better
review.reviewText:
For a facility advertised as an "Upscale" hotel, I would have expected more. The bed was terrible and hard as a rock. The tub was advertised as a "deep" tub but it was no deeper than mine at home. 
While in the restroom the band playing in the bar on the first floor below could be heard in my room. After all day meetings and traveling all I wanted was to lay down and that was a challenge.
review.positiveRemarks: The windows opened
review.negativeRemarks: New mattresses
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO. I got to see the America's Cup racing boat in Oracle's front yard.

review.title: Hotel is very dirty. Employees unfriendly.
review.reviewText: This hotel tries to be upper class but is merely dirty, with poorly done and dusty renovations. The employees are very unfriendly and even though the hotel promised expedia a refund since the hotel triggered my asthma, the front desk sneakily charged more. You will be disappointed if you stay there.

review.title: Excellent hotel and staff
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and polite. The hotel is well maintained with a great view of the lagoon behind it.  Would definitely recommend staying there and we would do so again without hesitation. An outstanding hotel and an exceptional experience.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: I was not notified that we had to pay for parking.

review.title: Nice hotel!!
review.reviewText: We stayed in the Sofitel one night and we upgraded to a suite.  The suite was very spacious with a separate living space from the "living room".  We did not eat in the restaurant but it looked full so someone enjoyed it. They offered a sit down breakfast or some nice "grab and go" sandwiches or yogurt in the lobby sandwich shop. It was only about a 20 min. ride north to San Fran airport.  The only caution it is located in a office building type complex so it is not a place that has restaurants, bars or shopping in walking distance.  We drove one exit south (5 min) to the small town nearby and there were some fun restaurants there.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely hotel and our room was very nice.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is a drive away....but still close!  Easy drive to the airport or they provide free transportation to the airport.

review.title: Great hotel for business travel.
review.reviewText: Location is very convenient for getting to SFO or to companies in bay area since is between SFO and Palo Alto.    My room has a great view of the pond no the back of the hotel. Staffs are very friendly.   Unlike most of the hotel near SFO, it offers complementary parking. The only thing I wish to have been better is the swimming pool, which is to small get a workout.   But will stay there again.

review.title: great hotel as expected

review.positiveRemarks: turn down service and condition of the hotel

It is a Beautiful hotel 20 mins drive form the airport & 30 min drive to Standford University.  I was planning to stay there next week I have to go back to SF. But this time I will give the opportunity to another VIP acces hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort & cleaness

I am not a neat freak but one would think I am talking about the motel 6 down the road not a highly recommend hotel such as the Sofitel.

review.title: Worst hotel I ever stated in.
review.reviewText: I will never go back or recommend it to anyone. They promised and could not deliver. I booked a Luxury Room in a 5 star hotel and arrived in a mediocre hotel and room. The room was old and dirty. There was a mini refrigerator on the floor, molds on the bathroom walls, old yellow pillowcases instead of white, no light bulb in the lamp, dirty counters. Old moldy ironing board. Worst experience I've ever had in the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be carefully checked.

review.title: Awesome getaway for busy parents!!!  :)
review.reviewText: My husband and I dont get much us time so we booked room 5 minutes from our house and stayed 24 hours while we had my mom watch the kids.  It was awesome!  Food, bar, pool, room, gym.  The only thing we want in a room is air (a window, balcony, etc) so that was the only issue for us and we will be back.  Soon!!

review.title: Great Place to Stay Unless !!!
review.reviewText: We frequently stay at this hotel and generally love.  This time was disappointing because there was a very loud party on the lobby and pool area from the time of check-in until 8:00 pm.  We had a prestige room and asked for the highest level available.  She gave us the 5th floor and said that was all she had.  The noise in the room was disturbing with a constant heavy base shaking the walls.  We called and asked for an option.  She said nothing was available unless we moved to a room without a water view.  She would not give us a rate discount on options she offered that were less expensive to begin with.  We went on Expedia and discovered they had water view presige rooms available still for that evening.  We called this person again and asked her what rooms were available.  After being very testy with her she finally confessed that there was the same room as ours available on the 8th floor but we'd need to wait for it to be cleaned.  This was about 5:00 pm well after check-in time.  I followed up with a staff person who let me in the room and said it was clean and available.  Didn't hear back from the front desk for an hour and had to demand to be moved.  Finally we got into the higher level room which was much quieter but after two hours of frustration.  What's up with Amy?   She tried so hard not to accomodate us and then abandon us in the noisy room until someone else handled it.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the peace and quiet under normal conditions (without a very loud party going on) and the views of the water.
review.negativeRemarks: Close certain rooms if you want to hold a loud party and, of course, make sure the desk clerk is honest and accomodating to the request of guests.
review.locationRemarks: Location is in the heart of the SF Bay peninsula and everything is convently attainable.

review.title: This a gorgeous hotel ... amazing view!
review.reviewText: I would readily recommend this hotel to anyone.  It is very luxurious but didn't kill my budget. Amazing staff and up scale atmosphere.  Please stay here you will love it.

review.title: The Best!!!
review.reviewText: Everything was great: room, staff, lobby, etc. It's the best hotel I've ever seen!
I got this room at a discount - it would otherwise be out of my desired price range

review.title: Convenient to all of the Bay Area
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 nights while our oldest child was at an overnight summer camp nearby.  This hotel is located near the bay overlooking a lagoon.  It is in a really nice, quiet location surrounded by office buildings including Oracle.  But, if you like to sleep in, it is near the San Carlos airport where small planes fly out at about 8am. It has easy access to the freeway and is conveniently located central to San Francisco and Palo Alto and is near the entrance to the San Mateo bridge for easy access to the east bay.  The hotel is very well appointed with modern decor and is very comfortable.  The unusual thing is that our room was not made every day we were there.  Of the 4 nights, it was only made twice.  We don't mind since we kept our sheets and towels to save on water and be green but this may bother some.  There was some confusion since I had added two days to our stay and so in effect had two reservations which seems to have confused the staff even though I had the two reservations linked.  Overall it didn't bother us too much but it would have been nice to have our beds made at the least.  The room was very clean though, especially the bathroom and we all loved the shower which was like a rainfall shower. We loved having a view of the lagoon.  The staff was very responsive especially when the toilet got clogged (water saving flush) which they fixed within 10 minutes of our request to fix it.  We would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: location, decor, cleanliness, staff
review.negativeRemarks: make the room every night of our stay even though we request to keep the sheets and towels to be green....
review.locationRemarks: conveniently located to SF airport, SF, Palo Alto and surroundings, east bay, san mateo bridge....

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great view, wonderful location!
review.reviewText:
We were very pleasantly surprised about this hotel! We did have a rental car and wanted to visit other locations besides downtown San Francisco, so to us the location was phenomenal! I should caution you that it does cost $20 per day (NON valet parking) to park in the hotel's garage, but it was worth it to have our own car.

The hotel itself is beautiful, inside and out. We did not eat at the restaurant, but the area looked very nice. On the one day we planned to eat breakfast there, the fire alarms went off and caused the evacuation of the entire building for about an hour, so our plans for that day were delayed. (BTW, we were impressed with how well THAT situation was handled. The staff was apologetic and friendly about the whole thing. Turns out a bride hung up her wedding dress on a sprinkler head in her room and caused them to go off on that entire wing. Bad news for the hotel...and for the bride.)

Our view was great (5th floor facing the bay), and the decor was modern, clean and lovely. There is no fridge in the room, but there is a Keurig! The coffee shop downstairs makes a lovely latte and has some pretty great pastries. My advice: stop there on your way out because there are no other coffee shops anywhere nearby. Housekeeping did an amazing job, right down to the folded points on the toilet paper.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was modern and clean
review.negativeRemarks: Add a mini fridge to the rooms. We had leftovers and wine we would have liked refrigerated.
review.locationRemarks: Same complex as the Oracle headquarters, close enough to the highway for good access to anywhere but very, very quiet on the weekend.

review.reviewText: We had a wonderful 3-night stay here! I searched for lodging chiefly on three criteria: ease of access to San Francisco, price, and a view. We got all three at the Sofitel in Redwood City-- along with a tip from a reviewer--- ask for a "water view and an upper floor" -- and you'll probably get it!

review.title: Quality hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, spacious attractive room. We arrived about 10pm. Unfortunately we didn't enjoy the room long because of the interior sprinkler malfunction that forced evacuation of the whole hotel about 8:30am. People weren't allowed to return for 2 hours....we gave up and left. We would be happier if the hotel offered a refund.
review.positiveRemarks: Location on the water, quiet, roomy.

review.title: NICe
review.reviewText:
This is a nice hotel except the fire alarm when I live there.
Everyone was woke up and it turned out one of a fire alarm was broken.

review.title: Not as nice as it used to be.
review.reviewText: First, this hotel needs to be freshened up. The facility is tired and worn in all respects. Second, the hotel needs to be more fastidious in their customer booking. Not sure if they rely heavily on nearby Oracle or Stanford, but a group of twenty-somethings made our five night stay pretty miserable. Inconsiderate party goers present at all hours, slamming doors, etc.. Someone set off fire sprinklers early Sunday morning, causing a complete evacuation of the hotel. When we asked the front desk about what happened, the response was: "I dunno!" Not very professional to say the least. Lastly, the hotel has begun to charge for all parking with no arrangement for free self park space. As an alternative, we were told we could perhaps park in the business across the street. Are they that desperate for revenue?
review.positiveRemarks: Great, quiet location, but that doesn't make up for the rest.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: Nice hotel

This is close to Oracle Headquarters
Shopping/dining is pretty close by too

Almost appeared that the room was partially prepared and there was an interruption in process.

review.title: A little bit of France with great deal of service
review.reviewText:
I live between S. France and the Big Island of Hawaii and the Sofitel is my "go to" hotel during my transits.
The lagoon setting, immaculate, well appointed rooms and top notch service at every level of staff makes it that rare experience of a hotel you look forward to staying in.

The cafe off the lobby has excellent pastries and espresso as well as an assortment of fresh sandwiches for a quick meal. The restaurant menu is well assembled with light offerings for the
health conscious. The wine list is superb and the sommelier inserts a short list of his selections for the day.

The staff is, by far, the most professional and courteous I have encountered in my extensive travels. Every care is taken to make your stay pleasurable and it is all done with sincerity.

Many thanks to each of them
Lynn M. Mallard

review.title: Great hotel just outside of airport, close to hwy.
review.reviewText: Very prompt and courteous service. Fantastic bakery within hotel. Overall, pleasant stay.

review.title: Comfortable and relaxing stay!
review.reviewText: We decided on a last minute Valentine's weekend trip to San Francisco, and rather than staying in the city for more than twice the price and triple the parking, we decided to stay here and drive up to the city over the weekend. Aside from an annoyingly snooty employee at check-in who had trouble locating our reservation, everything else was PERFECT. The hotel is easy to find, the employees (aside from the one exception) were friendly, professional and eager to help, and overall our stay was a pleasure. The rooms are comfortable and clean, great beds, lots of pillows, cozy little sitting area and clean, large bathroom. The restaurant looks lovely, and has live jazz (at least on the nights we stayed), and we would have loved to try it but the Valentine's prix fixe menu wasn't to our taste and was being served both nights we stayed, so we skipped it. Room service was delicious, with enough variety on the menu to accommodate many tastes, and attention to detail was fantastic. While the location might not be for everyone, it worked perfectly for us, and the convenience of the coffee shop/bakery in the lobby was nice too. One bummer, housekeeping didn't come to clean our room during our stay, we left the room at 11 and got back in the evening to find everything a mess. That said, it was a busy weekend, and when we called for extra towels/coffee supplies, their response was great. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider staying here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Pretty much everything - the room was quiet, comfortable and perfect for us to relax and enjoy.
review.negativeRemarks: We definitely could have done without the snooty attitude when checking in.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is about 25 mins south of downtown San Francisco, so if you're going for those attractions, expect a drive.
