review.title: French hotel on murky lagoon
review.reviewText:
This hotel is immediately impressive, but the joy fades. Everything is pristine, including the room.
2 topics of disappointment --

The restaurant is expensive and the service is so slow I found it unbelievable. Must be the French way.
We had a "lagoon view" room, with only a peek view if you stand at the far end of one window. There is no exhaust fan in the bathroom (I thought codes required either a fan or a window). There are comforters with duvets on the bed and no top sheet. Despite turning the thermostat way down, I was too hot with the comforter and too cold with nothing. And the soundproofing must be non-existent; I could hear door slams and conversations and toilets flushing at night. Needless to say, I would never stay there again unless they make some soundproofing renovations, put an exhaust fan in the bathroom, and a top sheet on the bed. And, housekeeping did not turn off previous tenant's alarm on the clock radio so I was awakened at 6am on Saturday.
review.positiveRemarks: It really is beautiful and the rooms are big.
review.negativeRemarks: Read my experiences for suggestions
review.locationRemarks: Surrounded by office buildings. Obviously, there is much to do in San Francisco which isn't too far.

review.title: Nye
review.reviewText: The bellman were rude and unprofessional, and the bar was closed off to guests because of a party

review.title: very nice place to stay in.
I was at the hotel for a conference.
review.reviewText: The facilities are nice even though it's fake tiling in the showers. I would compare the room to what you'd find at a Holiday Inn Express for $130 per night. I'd gladly pay $130 per night but not the $180+ they are charging.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Price is high. Have real tile in the showers.
review.locationRemarks: Bay Area has plenty to do.

review.title: Makes you want to move to France
review.reviewText: One of the best hotel stays we have ever had. We stayed for 3 nights and can't wait to visit all the Sofitel properties around the world. Everything from the staff's thoughtful touches, to the dcor, to the food was top notch. The hotel staff was so mindful that it was my wife's birthday, and even though we did not make any special requests, they surprised her with the best French desserts one could get this side of the Atlantic. If you are looking for peaceful and quiet enjoyment with the most attentive staff then the Sofitel San Francisco Bay is the place to be.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. A total White Glove treatment.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing at all.
review.locationRemarks: The location was convenient from the airport without the airport hotel feel. Being close to the Hillsdale Mall made it even better for my wife.

review.title: comfort and elegance
review.reviewText: as always at the Sofitel, a delightful experience. just wish I could have stayed longer..
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable beds, and excellent service
review.locationRemarks: beautiful, restful location.

review.reviewText: I did not expect to pay $20/night for parking.

review.title: Nice quiet location
review.reviewText:
I hadn't been back to this hotel since my wedding reception in 1989, so wasn't sure what to expect. The hotel was very clean, modern and still had a great staff!

I was there for 4 nights and had a room with a desk that overlooked the lagoon - very relaxing. Would definitely return here for the pricing and quietness it offers.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, quiet, nice staff, up to date decor.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Close to 101 with access to the East Bay and South Bay. Located near Oracle and corporate parks which makes it quiet on the weekends.

review.title: Nothing Special -- to far from anything
Excellent stay at great rate.
review.reviewText: Overall first rate with the exception of parking rates.
review.positiveRemarks: Best hotel in the area
review.negativeRemarks: Self parking for free
review.locationRemarks: Close easy access to restaurants shopping airport.

review.title: Weekend stay for a family gathering.
review.reviewText: We were very comfortable. Lots of places to sit and visit in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: everything
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: nice place to walk.

review.positiveRemarks: Location was great on the lagoons around Redwood Shores. The staff was very nice and helpful. PCs in the public areas was great.
review.negativeRemarks: They had a special event where a tent had to be erected. It really cut off accessibility in one whole direction driving into the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: My Daughter lives in San Jose and we love the San Mateo/San Francisco peninsula, so much to do and see.

review.title: Very nice hotel great staff ... very accommodating
Beautiful View from a Spacious Room!
review.reviewText:
Had a wonderful experience at Sofitel. The staff was wonderful and our room was immaculate. We had a window facing the water and a gorgeous view of the mountains.

Would definitely return to Sofitel in the future!

review.title: Excellent service & experience
review.reviewText:
Great treatment from check-in to staff encounters. Everyone polite and friendly. Great room service. Stayed on a Friday night and though we planned on heading out to dinner, never left our room until checkout Saturday morning.
Matt at the front desk was particularly helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Great attitude from staff and very good room service
review.negativeRemarks: King room setup for single traveler, would like a couch or love seat. Travel with my wife often and find this often in hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Van's On The Hill restaurant in Belmont if you feel like leaving the comfort of your room. Great view of The Bay and a real throwback experience.

review.reviewText: The room was supposed to be furnished with the hotel slippers but they were not there so I called the operator. They only sent one pair up to the room. So my husband and I shared that pair of slippers. Hate to think that they tried to cut cost but they should have know that we have two adults staying.
review.locationRemarks: great!

review.title: Easy to check in
review.locationRemarks: Location difficult to find.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was 5 star. The entire Hotel was beautiful! The restaurant was Great, Room Service Amazing. Great Service and a Great Price!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Heat the Pool.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful Lake to walk around. 1/2 redwood city and 1/2 San Mateo.

review.title: Sofitel Redwood City
review.reviewText:
I am a loyal Marriott member but I had visited an expedia site and I saw the Sofitel. Looked luxurious, I booked. When I arrived at the hotel, staff was there to greet me and offer help. I went to registration and found Matt to be fantastic! He asked me about my choice in trying the Sofitel and offered us two breakfast coupons. Wow!
The bedding was so soft and enveloping, that I searched for it online. I also loved the modern lighted mirror in the bathroom. I think anyone would be very appreciative of the free water bottle in the bedroom as most hotels leave water out with a additional charge. The Kerig coffee maker was also fun to try.
review.positiveRemarks: The hospitality at the door and the registration desk were top notch. I was also very impressed by our waitress in the morning. Gave her a large tip!
review.negativeRemarks: The pool area was small without a jacuzzi. The cocktail staff around the bar were extremely slow and we left after waiting 20min. The bar wasn't busy?
review.locationRemarks: The location for Redwood City was great. The hotel was on a man-made waterfront close to but not on the freeway. The next day we went to Half Moon Bay

review.title: A disappointing "4 Star"
review.reviewText: Bellmen in front seemed very rude. Told us to move our car under the portacache as we were checking in and unloading. Parking is an additional $20 on top of the room fee. There is a pool but no spa.

review.title: The French Touch
review.reviewText: Nice area, safe environment and true French croissants.
review.positiveRemarks: Really like the style of this hotel and its cleaniness. Room is large flooded by natural light. Nice fitness room.
review.negativeRemarks: Down sides are 20$ parking. Very high for a lowly densified area. No points from rewards program if booked through Expedia. Insulting
review.locationRemarks: Mid distance from SF and SJ. Business people destination, not for tourists

review.title: OK...not exciting
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for 1 night with my family. easy to find, quite location, organized and clean rooms. This is one of the hotels that you will need to have a car to get to anywhere. nothing much within walking distance. The on-site bakery seems decent, bought a few pastries and have nothing to complain about. House keeping will need to pay attention to the details as traces of dust can be found around the room. Coffee machine is not cleaned properly, I need to do a few water run to clean up the machine and wipe the coffee stain off the K-Cup holder. This hotel will be perfect for those that are on a business trip, not ideal for family vacation. Location is good, 35 mins driving from Downtown San Francisco, 20 mins from SFO, 20 mins from Palo Alto. a good alternative for those who want to stay out of expensive San Francisco hotels but yet remain relatively close enough.

The hotel went under some major renovation in 2011/2012 to bring the design up to date. though if you look closely, you can still see traces of the un-renovated parts here and there.
review.positiveRemarks: Location - quite. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: house keeping will need to pay attention to the finer details.
review.locationRemarks: If you have a car, it is within 5-10 mins of driving distance to local super market, phamacy, restaurants and cafe. Also next to Oracle/EA

review.title: Nice hotel well place
review.reviewText:
We where not there a lot but pleased about it we where on the go all the time in San Francisco
Or on the coast
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to get to from airport as well as from city
review.negativeRemarks: A bit more about what can be done in the area
review.locationRemarks: See the review before

review.title: Best choice on the peninsula!
review.reviewText: We visit this hotel several times per year and have never been disappointed. The hotel is elegant without being stuffy. Rooms are clean and tastefully appointed, and the "Sobed" was incredibly comfy. Only one small complaint: housekeeping was still cleaning our room at 4:30 in the afternoon, when we arrived back after a long day in the city. We had to wait 25 mins for her to finish. Just seemed a bit late in the day not to have that already done. Overall though you can't go wrong with this property!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, but far from other restaurants, small shops etc. Breakfast was not very good. Pretty location and very clean. Staff was very pleasant.

review.title: Great hotel close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: The Sofitel is a great hotel to be near the airport and to access the Peninsula. We highly recommend it.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, convenient to train/airport
review.reviewText: My husband and I have stayed here before. It's a beautiful hotel, with a gorgeous, large lobby and a great bar. Many nice places for conversation, and a pool and patio overlooking a reflecting pool/lake. Very convenient location to Oracle (half a mile) and Cal train (1+ mile) - Belmont & San Carlos. My sister lives nearby and she says the restaurant is very good. We didn't eat here as there was a 30 minute wait. One thing to note: there are neither refrigerators, nor microwaves in the room. BUT! the staff did bring us a fridge (they have some they wheel about) and room service warmed up our leftovers the next morning and brought them to us on a silver platter! Very nice, friendly service at the desk and at the coffee shop also. Chocolate croissants were a bit chewy.

review.title: Luxury & convenience
review.reviewText: Everything was simple but luxurious. We were very pleased with everything.

review.title: Hardly strickly festival
review.reviewText: It was a very clean and friendly place!! Service was spot on and awesome views and beautiful women everywhere !! I will come back in the future!! There was a fashion show tht weekend and the girls that came from all over the world !!! It was sweet

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel super last minute (same day check-in) and I thought the location and value was not bad. Staff at the front desk was polite. Lobby was chic, as Sofitel hotels should be. Room was clean and spacious. Bed was very comfortable. I loved the bathroom toiletries!
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have an ipod dock in the room and perhaps a bigger television.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText:
Great Bed! Super Comfortable and quiet room for a good nights rest.
My only complaint was the music that was pumping through the lobby. Since this is an airport hotel, one must assume that it is the host to many wary travelers like myself that don't really care to be pounded by the thump thump of a new age techno band coming through a half rate lobby sound system. I was not pleasantly surprised to be greeted by the same thump thump in the lobby at 6:30am upon checking out.
Otherwise I found the hotel and staff top knotch and plan to return.
With earplugs...

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, near Oracle, 45 min to SF. Us 101 is complicated.

review.title: Quiet room, and vibrant bar area. Very comfortable
review.reviewText: Really great stay. We had the large room, with separate sitting area. Quiet and peaceful, yet the bar area was busy and vibrant. The hotel is situated near the SF airport, and could visit Monterey in the south, and Sausalito into the north. Recommend always
review.positiveRemarks: Our suite.
review.locationRemarks: Go up Ralston Avenue and you get into the hills..so nice to have these rolling hills to cycle or walk about in, so close..

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good experience, friendly staff, and nice restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, affordable, and proximity.
review.negativeRemarks: The $20 charge for parking was definitely a negative, especially since restaurant patrons got their parking validated. Made no sense.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in San Mateo
review.reviewText: We cant say enough about our positive experience at this hotel. Beautiful room, views and lobby. Good room service, and quick response to our request for more tea and coffee.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel Near the 101.
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for two nights. It is located in a desrable area, corporate park really, with sidewalks convenient for running or walking.
review.positiveRemarks: Location close to the freeway but very quiet. The fiteness center was also one of the best in a hotel I have ever seen.
review.negativeRemarks: The comforters on the bed seemed heavy and uncomfortable to sleep under.

review.title: Classy hotel
review.reviewText: The staff is very professional and the valet went out of the way to be helpful. Our room was very nice with modern decor, comfortable beds and nice bathrooms( loved the soaps). We also ate breakfast at the restaurant and although it's a bit pricey the four of us had different meals and all enjoyed them. We would stay here again.

review.title: ROMANTIC PLACE TO STAY.
review.reviewText: NICE, COMFY, LOBBY SMELL SO GOOD . STAFF SO SWEET.
review.positiveRemarks: BED SO COMFY, A LOT OF CANDLES IN THE LOBBY.
review.negativeRemarks: HOT TUB
review.locationRemarks: QUITE PLACE

review.title: Too much nose.
review.reviewText: people talking in the hallway were heard as if there was no door to block the sound. The expectation is that external sounds and voices are attenuated by the door. Unfortunately, there were many party-goers on our floor. didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant. this place would have been great if I was able to get a good night's rest.
review.positiveRemarks: view of the lagoon and the pool area is nice, if you're on that side of the building. furnishings and amenities are great, Bakery was nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: the one thing that needs improvement is the insulation quality of the door. The sound of people in the hallway talking are heard clearly.
review.locationRemarks: the hotel is rather isolated. attractions are a short drive away.

review.title: Wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText:
We were in town for our nieces wedding & it was also our 20th wedding anniversary. Even though our focus was on our niece Sofitel made our day very special by sending us a bottle of champagne & chocolate covered strawberries & also a very pretty card that I now have on my mantel signed by the staff. I am very grateful for this wonderful detail.
Hotel Sofitel is a beautiful, clean, elegant hotel. Their specialty is detail to their guest. This will be my preferred hotel of choice when visiting San Francisco. This hotel is outside of the city but with very easy access to getting there rather quickly. Because this hotel is away from the city it is very peaceful yet has a very hip atmosphere. I highly recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Sofitel is very beautiful & clean. The staff is very friendly. This hotel also smells very good!

review.title: Nice hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Heard doors slamming in the doorway really early in the morning when I was hoping to sleep in a little bit.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, ambience, nice comfortable room and service.
review.negativeRemarks: Stop the doors from slamming in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Belmont, Ca

review.title: Excellent hotel at Palo Alto
review.reviewText: We visited Stanford and stayed at this Sofitel for one night. The hotel was excellent, and we got a great last minute deal from Expedia. We spent a very pleasant evening in the bar which served wonderful drinks and snacks. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: European style hotel, convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Very efficient and friendly staff. Food was distinctive and of high quality. Wonderful bed (after 12 hour flight).
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom not up to European standards for a comparable hotel.
review.locationRemarks: South of SFO. Nothing to do nearby - it's an hotel in which to recover from or prepare for your flight!

review.title: Great Find!
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the cost, comfort, and location. We used this hotel as base camp for visiting all the local colleges (Berkeley, Stanford, and SDSU) and taking CalTran into SF (park and ride nearby so eliminated the need to fight heavy traffic into S.F.). Beds were comfortable, great bar, and pastry shop. Hotel staff are attentive to your need and the price of the stay was within our family financial comfort zone.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the pastry shop. Dog friendly hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish the swimming pool was bigger. The pool was crowded and a crowd of people hung around the area (since it was near the bar).
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to either San Francisco and Palo Alto so many things to do. You can take Caltran into S.F. and back.with ease.

review.title: French theme without french hospitality.
review.reviewText: They charge you for everything. Parking is 20.00 a day and no complimentary breakfast. The restaurant was high priced and the food mediocre. The view is terrible! The San Francisco Bay is 20 minutes away and cannot be seen from the hotel, so they need to change ther name.
review.positiveRemarks: Leaving
review.negativeRemarks: No charge for parking, better food at reasonable prices and move the hotel near the bay or change their name.

review.title: 3 nights at Sofitel SFO Bay
review.reviewText: Very good experience, clean, good and professional service
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms size, cleanliness and staff professionalism + the heated pool
review.negativeRemarks: The bar next to the restaurant was a bit noisy at night
review.locationRemarks: SFO city

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. The bed was super comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: relaxing, fresh air, nice view and clean
review.reviewText: we just want a place to sleep for the night but we don't wanna go anywhere and see other part of San Francisco all we wanna do is just stay in the hotel
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness, bed is soft and smell clean that's why you don't want to live the room

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: needed to attend a facility in San Carlos, you gave me a ride, was close to San Francisco Airport and the hotel was amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: evening entertainment, accommodations, view !!!!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.title: The only problem was check-in
review.reviewText:
I had reserved the room, and took the extra discount offered with the pre-paid option, but when arrived at the hotel around 4pm (well after the stated check in time) the room was not yet ready. We didn't have to wait all that long, but it seemed odd that the room would not be cleaned and ready to accept new guests that late in the day ... particularly as it was one of the suites!

The staff were very courteous and chased things down to get the room ready ASAP, and it was a nice stay other than this delay.

review.title: 4 star hotel alternate outside SF downtown
review.reviewText: Great choice away from the downtown. We wanted to drive around the area anyway so this is a great choice! Very clean room. Love the design. Love the very white soft towels. I would probably not plan to have room service because food is limited and can be pricey. My husband said he would want me to book at Sofitel again in our future SF vacations.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Parking please

review.title: Great for both business and recreational travel
review.reviewText: Staff was attentive. Room was large and clean. The location was central to my activities. Room service was wonderful.

review.title: Great experience.
review.reviewText: We found this hotel at the last minute and it turned out to be the best and most beautiful by a wide margin - and it was so much less expensive than staying anywhere in San Francisco. If you can rent a car and drive in to the city, this is a better choice.

review.title: Not impressed for the money
review.reviewText: Ragged towels. Stingy with shampoo. Staff way too impressed with themselves. Expensive parking. 4 star plus money, but not service.
review.positiveRemarks: Relatively quiet as long as other guests didn't close doors.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide a real sheet and blanket. Temperature regulation under a duvet is impossible. Provide more than one bath towel per guest.
review.locationRemarks: Nice setting on lake but nothing else nearby.

review.title: Hotel is nice but not excellent
review.reviewText: Parking onsite was $20 and they did not have a hot tub. Also their deep soak tub was a normal bathtub from what I could tell.

review.title: Great all around
review.reviewText:
Super friendly staff. Love the French touch.
Will certainly stay again when I come back to the area.

review.title: Sofitel
review.reviewText: Great atmosphere, great staff. Enjoyed my stay. Room was clean, and had everything I needed. The staff was prompt and friendly everywhere in the hotel. I especially liked the cafe area.

review.title: Weekend getaway!!!
review.reviewText:
Staff is friendly and the room is clean n comfy!!!
Its quite and have a nice atmosphere...
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy bed and coffee...
review.negativeRemarks: Safe deposit box and free shuttle within 5 miles radius!!! Its helpful so you dont need to bring the car in and out...
review.locationRemarks: If you are familiar with the location. There are plenty of restaurants and places to go.

review.title: Sofitel San Fran Bay / San Mateo
review.reviewText: Very nice place. Didn't spend a lot of time there but from what i saw its nice. Like the blue and white decor.downstairs. Make sure to check out the pastry bar near the lobby for some yummy treats! close to the airport and bout 20 min from downtown SF 30 min with traffic. Kinda nice cause the city is very busy things are more calm down at the hotel. If you speak french you'll love it for sure. Parking should be valet if they're charging $20 per day i think.
review.positiveRemarks: The Decor
review.negativeRemarks: Parking Fees. Too much not to be valet.
review.locationRemarks: south of the airport and downtown. a lot more quiet area of town

review.title: Great hotel , super comfy and relaxing.
review.reviewText: Great hotel staff and service. The rooms have beautiful views and the decor is very relaxing.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the cleanliness and the attention to detail, great toiletries etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much, the location is off the main grid, but just what we were looking for.
review.locationRemarks: It's mostly a business center area, so not much to do around there....

review.title: sofitel
review.reviewText: front desk staff were very pleasant, check in and out was very quick. rooms were very clean , and as advertisedroom service was very fast.vallet was very quick.overall good hotel with very good staff.

review.title: It is a beatiful hotel. Loved the fragrance
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful experience. we had some special requests that were honored and the staff was very nice to work with. The resturant was exceptional and the lobby furnishings are lelegant. The pool and the accomodations were just lovely. .
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the decorating, newness and smell
review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.title: Clean and up to date
review.reviewText: My rule of thumb is that I won't stay in a hotel room that is not as nice if not nicer than my own bedroom. This room met my expectations it was lovely.

review.title: Clueless staff.
review.reviewText:
We asked for a wake-up call at 8:30 am. At 2:43 am the wake-up call came. And then 15 minutes later. And then 15 minutes after that. I asked for the manager to call me in the morning. He didn't. But I found him. And he said it was a techical glitch...then asked if I was happy otherwise. I said but for the lack of sleep, it was great.

Stay away. Place is badly managed.

review.title: Hotel near San Francisco
review.reviewText:
A wonderful scent filled the area as we walked in the lobby to check in. The wait was only a couple of
minutes. The room was extremely clean, well organized and beautifully decorated. We really enjoyed the feather bedding. Room service was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: The bedding and cleanliness of the room. The Poland gym were a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: It was not evident that recycling was being done. Inside and out we did not find a place to put our cans and bottles. When I asked I was told it was d
review.locationRemarks: It was a location geared toward business travel but worked well for our vacation needs.

review.title: Didn't Live Up to its promise
review.reviewText:
Room had a musty smell. Even though this was a Sunday and hotel was vacant (I know this because when I called in the morning for check in time, they said I can check in any time, including at 10 AM), they purposely gave me a room with a bad view (view of the roof, rather than of the Lake or the Hills) since they like to charge more for the rooms with views. the description says "refrigerator available on request" but of course they were out of them even though the hotel was under-occupied. I had some perishable high end essert items which I had to throw away.

Also, parking was way too expensive for the sub-urban location they are in.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much.
review.negativeRemarks: A lot
review.locationRemarks: Walk by the Bay

review.title: Very nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Sofitel always delivers, I was lucky to book it specially when the San Francisco Airport was closed due to the Asiana accident, so I was stuck for a day and had to find acommodations.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything is excellent and they have the most comfortable beds that you don't want to wake up.
review.locationRemarks: I call the hotel and sent the shuttle to the airport, and the next day they took me back.

review.title: Nice hotel with a nice view
review.reviewText:
We wanted a hotel close to the airport for an early morning flight. We had a nice room with a great view of the pond but unfortunately we didn't get to enjoy the view since we were only there to sleep.
The staff was friendly, and the room was clean and nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds could be more comfortable, they're too hard in our opinion.

review.title: The epitome of fine hotels
review.reviewText: From the moment we were warmly greeted by the bellhop, through seamless check-in, this is a great place to stay...

review.title: Simply nice!!
review.reviewText: Great location, atmosphere, staff and decor. Great place to stay!

review.title: Perfect hotel near San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very, very pleasant, we had a junior suite overlooking the water and really liked the space and the view. And the price was very reasonable.
My whole extended family congregated at the hotel and everybody was happy.
Good location, equidistant to Stamford University and San Francisco, located in the charming town of Redwood City.
And it is only a few minutes from SFO airport.
It was perfect for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort and cleanliness. Good mattress, good linens.
review.negativeRemarks: Better airport shuttle schedule. It is available only on the hour and the only alternative is a $40.00 cab ride.
review.locationRemarks: Drive to the center of Redwood City for nice restaurants and walk.

review.title: Top notch Hotel and Staff.
review.reviewText: Incredible staff, they went out of their way to help my 92 year old mother. Getting her food and drinks, ran out to get our car. All without an expectation of tips, just from the goodness for their hearts. The hotel is well kept bright and airy on a man made lake just off the highway but you wouldn't know it. I'd stay here again in a heart beat
review.negativeRemarks: Pay parking ($20 day) and no option in the area.

review.title: Definitely staying again!
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the room. It was clean, beautifully furnished, and luxurious. The only thing I didn't like was the $20/day parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, furnishings, and free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is too costly.
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to Palo Alto.

review.title: convenient, quiet location
review.reviewText: we continually return to the sofitel when visiting our children, over many years.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient location, excellent ambiance, service, staff and competitive rates
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: easy access to hwy 101, airport, nearby cities, etc

review.title: comfort and tranquility..
review.reviewText: A first class hotel with first class staff in a beautiful location.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendliness and attentiveness of the staff
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful location right on the shore of a small bay that attracts ducks, geese, pelicans and and numerous other varieties of wildlife.

review.title: Very pleasant stay (with a minor glitch.)
review.reviewText: I was very happy with the Sofitel. The only difficulty I had was with the card key and operation of the gate of the parking garage. I had to call the front desk three times (during a 4 day stay) to get them to operate the gate for me. The card key opened my room just fine, but the parking garage didn't seem to be able to read it consistently. Staff was consistently pleasant, courteous, and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: the room and the courtesy of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking garage
review.locationRemarks: A beautiful area.

review.title: Good hotel for getaway
review.reviewText: We only stayed there for two nights, but we really enjoyed it. I had some mosquito bites after a first night there, so we mentioned it to the staff and they changed the entire bed for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby and knowledgable curtious staff
review.negativeRemarks: View of our room was facing the parking lot
review.locationRemarks: It's next to the Lagune.

photos.caption: the desert we enjoyed hanging in the hotel lounge

review.title: VERY dog friendly!!
review.reviewText: Incredible place! If you travel with your dog(s) this is the place to be. They completely cater to you and your little furry friend (30 lbs. or less to stay the night). The bar and restaurant area are dog friendly and your dog can even sit by the pool with you. Friendly staff, clean everything, and very comfortable. They even have dog biscuits on the room service menu!! It is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for...
review.positiveRemarks: dog friendly
review.negativeRemarks: prices of drinks in the bar, and prices in the little store
review.locationRemarks: beautiful location....very quiet

review.title: Great place to stay! :)
review.reviewText: We had a great time. Its a beautiful Hotel, spacious and very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Class act
review.reviewText: A bit far from San Francisco but great access to the airport. Great value as it was a very comfortable, sophisticated stay with all the amenities including a great gym (very well designed for a hotel gym). Really good cuisine and great room service. Everything you could ask for.
review.positiveRemarks: The gym and the sophistication level.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit far from San Francisco.

review.title: One bad Night. With 3 major issues.
review.reviewText: All the problems that were reported, I just received an apology. I was expecting a little more after not being able to sleep due to the spider on the wall (thinking about if there was more), Inspecting the sheets on the bed I found one of the sheets had urine stains the sheets were washed but still customers are not be exposed to that, The shower's drain was draining the water slow it took about ten minutes to drain out all of the water.
review.positiveRemarks: Their Luxury Look
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Servie
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel for business travelers
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, nice location, nice contemporary dcor, and nice comfort in room.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful hotel, nice location, nice contemporary dcor, and nice comfort in room.
review.negativeRemarks: Comforter in bed way too hot. AC does not cool room down adequately. Food in restaurant not impressive for a hotel this standard.

review.title: highly recommended
review.reviewText: it's a nice very hotel at an excellent location. The food at the restaurant /bar is delicious though a bit pricy.

review.title: solid Silicon Valley hotel for work or family trip
review.reviewText: This is a fine hotel for both business or pleasure. The location is central for Silicon Valley, and I've stayed several times. I only wish there were some better dining options close by (have not tried the hotel's restaurant yet, although the bar is nice). The overall condition of the hotel is very good.

review.title: Hotel Soffel
review.reviewText:
The room was nice. They overnight parking was pricey- $20 non valet. When the hotel staff member kept my drivers license in error
I got a call to come and get it. We felt they could have delivered it to us
review.positiveRemarks: Modern and nice

review.title: Perfect for personal or business travel
review.reviewText: Great location easy walk to shops,restaurants and sites
review.positiveRemarks: Like all San Francisco Hotels parking is expensive this hotel offers valet at $55 a night
review.locationRemarks: Located in financial district but easy walk to Ferry Building, ATT Park and even Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Classy hotel
review.reviewText: We allowed you to select the hotel for us. We were very pleased with the hotel you selected for us. We found the focus on French speaking customers very interesting. The hotel was classier than we expected. Joseph was extremely helpful when we needed to have our luggage moved and loaded in and out of our car. He is definitely an asset for the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The ritziness of the hotel. The wonderful help provided by the bell hops.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: The location worked out well for our anniversary trip vacation plans. Freeway friendly. Nice view of the bay.

review.title: Nice Environment
review.reviewText: clean rooms, clean public areas, comfortable beds, accommodating staff. Enjoyed our stay, will book with them on future visits.
review.positiveRemarks: quiet, cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: in room safe/lock boxes

review.title: European-Style Hotel at Reasonable Price
review.reviewText: A nice surprise. Our big king-size room overlooked the pool and water, and we watched a University crew race from our window. The hotel has a European feel, and is much better priced than a similar hotel would be in San Francisco, and it's only about a 20 minute drive south. Only complaint is the lack of towel bars, and an unusual shower door that had a big hole in the center of it that let shower water spray all over the bathroom. Oh, and maybe they could have real cream instead of fake creamers for the coffee.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size, nice bed linens, view, Euro vibe.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of towel bars, shower door, non-dairy creamers.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location overlooking the water.

review.title: Really nice for the money
review.reviewText:
Very nice Hotel about 15 mins from SFO. Real feel of luxury to the place & lots of space around, for the money it's a lot nicer than many of the Hotels in the Bay Area. Would definitely use it again and would even consider it for my trips to the south bay, it's a little bit far but again for the money, a lot nicer.

San Carlos downtown is about 10 mins away and has a nice street of restauraunts.
review.locationRemarks: Reasonably close to SFO, also close to downtown San Caros & it's nice choice of restauraunts.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Upscale, Beautiful Hotel!! Very clean, comfortable room. Would love to stay here again! Very helpful, pleasant staff. The Bay is a beautiful touch.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, staff was superb, perfect experience
review.positiveRemarks: friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: very clean, nice business location

review.title: Great value, classy venue
review.reviewText: This was our second visit and found the value and experience to be good. The comfort was downgraded because even though it looked like our room had been one of the rooms recently remodeled, the plumbing fixture in shower didn't work properly and each morning, the inside of the window was fogged up as if the AC wasn't working properly. In the restaurant, I liked the idea of the Delight menu with calories. The gym is great. The free parking and easy access to the freeway was a bonus. We were there Easter weekend, and the facilities accomodated all the extra festivities including weddings.
review.positiveRemarks: Background music in lobby and bar
review.negativeRemarks: The perfume smell/deodorizer in the lobby-too strong
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find, close to freeways and restaurants.

review.title: Great Service at a Nice French Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff is truly fantastic and goes out of their way to make you feel welcomed. Whether that's Edwin or Erick at the bar who even remember your favorite drinks from previous stays to finding macaroons in your room from the management welcoming us back. Being that I am an Expedia VIP I was offered anything from free internet to a late check out without having to inform them of my status, so that was a pleasant surprise. They are in the process of remodeling the rooms, so the reason for rating the comfort of my room as only a 4 is due to the lack of a fridge/mini bar in the room. However I've stayed previously in this same hotel and they do have fridges so this might be temporary.

review.title: Perfect staycation in Bay Area.
review.reviewText: Went on a local vacation. Staff upgraded our room, were very kind and accomodating. The hotel was quite and clean, close to great bike/walking trail and they kept our bikes for us and were always happy to get them or put them away again for us. The room was very warm, the bed a little too soft and something was making noise through the wall all night. Other than not the best nights sleep we had a great time and our other needs met in every way.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the langue and pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Room really warm and a little noisey.
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco and great biking trails.

review.title: Luxury Wannabe-Not!
review.reviewText: For a luxury hotel, for the rooms, it was on par with mid-scale Marriotts. Bathroom tubs had black mold around the shower. The door to the room would not shut unless one juggled with it and my room door was open when I first arrived because of that problem. It is an over priced Marriott.
review.positiveRemarks: Isolation from the city
review.negativeRemarks: Price

review.title: Good weekend stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location . Professional employees. I would recommend it to everyone

review.title: Poorly maintained room - not what we expected
review.reviewText:
Check-in was simple enough. Lobby is very sheik for the burbs. Elevators were fast but the hotel seemed deserted (it was late on a Friday night). When we arrived to the room, there was a baby crib in it (we do not have children). I attempted to call the front desk but the phone did not work so I simply pushed the crib into the hallway. Next we go to get settled and realize that the room was in terrible disrepair: broken lamps shades, unsightly damage to the furnishings, filthy carpets and walls, and the TV remote control did not work. It actually looked like we were put in the room reserved for partying teenagers. I only hope not all the rooms are in such horrible condition.

We were simply too tired to trek down to the lobby and file a complaint so we went to bed early. Decent night's sleep and I'm happy to report that our biggest fear (bedbugs) was not realized.

Overall - not what we expected from a luxury brand. I understand that the hotel will be renovated at some point, however, that's no excuse for poor maintenance. If I had put my business associates or an out-of-town guests there, I would have been embarrassed beyond belief.

Context - We're a professional couple in our late 30's local to the Redwood City area. Due to some construction at our house, we needed to stay somewhere local for one night. We picked the Sofitel because it's close to our house and supposed to be one of the best hotels in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Sheik lobby and beautiful views of the burbs; bathroom gave us some design tips
review.negativeRemarks: Unacceptable maintenance of the room
review.locationRemarks: Remote if you don't have a car or seek cultural/recreational adventures

review.title: FANTASTIC STAY!
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic time. The staff was amazing with their services and went above and beyond when they had chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room!! The hotel itself needs some upgrades to each room however I understand they are in the process of renovating it floor by floor which will make this hotel perfect when its done.
review.positiveRemarks: The service
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints
review.locationRemarks: A little far from downtown SF but it worked

review.title: Nice hotel and excellent price.
review.reviewText: The hotel is going through a renovation that should be complete by spring 2013. Rooms are otherwise getting a little worn out. Our bathroom also had several pieces of random guest hair stuck to the ceiling. It also would've been nice to have a microwave in the room to accompany the fridge. Would recommend their staff look up when cleaning. Otherwise, excellent service and compitent staff. Definitely recommend.

review.title: Affordable Luxury
review.reviewText:
Always a pleasant and quiet stay at Hotel Sofitel. Superb customer service and smiles from the front door to the front desk to the bar and bistro.

This is the quietest hotel I've ever stayed at! Phenomenal sleep to be had on their pillow top bed with the soft & airy down-like comforter. LOVE the Keurig coffee maker in the room. They provide a variety of k-cups (French Roast, decaf, Green Tea, etc.) but I can also bring my favorite blends from home with me.

The bistro's pastries are always fresh and delicious. The bar boasts gourmet award-winning drinks. My favorites are the Blackberry Margarita, Cosmo Smash and the Mango Bella. Yum! I make a point to visit the bar when I'm in the area, even if I'm not staying at Sofitel!
review.positiveRemarks: Bar with gourmet drinks and the bistro with fresh pastries
review.negativeRemarks: Wish the bar had a view of the bay
review.locationRemarks: Tucked within business parks, it's a quiet location yet close to the freeway

review.title: Beautiful and comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night. The hotel is really nice. We had a slight glitch with reserverations - really nothing; but for our short wait they upgraded our room and gave us two breakfast vouchers for the following morning. The breakfast was wonderful!

review.title: Standard business hotel
review.reviewText: Typical business hotel. Staff have an annoying tendency to ring your room 5 minutes after dropping off room service to enquire if all is well. Well equipped gym. Needs a steam room/sauna and an outdoor hot tub by the pool (which could be larger and better accessible)

review.title: Great Hotel for the price
review.reviewText: We have stayed here many times while visiting family. Price on weekends is very low by Bay standards. Very quite and comfortable with nice environment around the hotel for walking.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Very pleasant and convenient room, great service, bar and food! Love the free parking and shuttle to the airport

review.title: Overall, great hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel lobby was beautiful. Rooms were nice, however to me they lacked a few standard amenities such as inroom safe, mini fridge/min bar, and the tub was very small. Otherwise great hotel, exceptional service.

review.title: disappointed by the noise in the hotel room
review.reviewText: nice view, but got popcorn sealing and at night, there was a continues noise very 5 to 8 seconds like a air plan landing or something.

The junior suite was a good size and a nice layout, but the furniture in the living room was very small and uncomfortable. The hotel is also located in a business area, so it's likely not the best location if you plan on seeing the city. However we were there to visit family so it worked perfectly for us and we would stay there again.

review.title: Awesome Hotel~!

review.positiveRemarks: location, and clean contemporary decor, late in room dining.

review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for access to the airport

review.title: very nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: We didn't expect too much before we arrived. We booked one night as it is close to the airport, the review was good and the price was reasonable. We had a very nice surprise - the hotel is so nice that we wished we had booked for more than a night...

review.title: Definitely Disappointing
review.reviewText:
First night, got in around 1:30 PM (shuttle from the airport only goes 'til 11 PM BTW, it's a $40 cab ride) ordered room service. After the 15 minute promised time (actually I waited 20 minutes before calling) for the salad, I called down. They apologized and said it was on the way up and they'd comp it. 20 minutes later after I had fallen asleep the guy knocked on the door and I told him I didn't want it now, I was sleeping. He said it's complimentary, as if that would wake me up enough to stay up for a salad. I sent him back downstairs with the salad.

Next day we called down to inquire about the shuttle to BART (really just the airport), one of the primary reasons we stayed there. The front desk said no problem it runs every hour. We went down and the driver berated us and said the shuttle only goes if someone needs to catch a flight. We successfully encouraged him to take us. When we arrived back at airport BART station and called for the shuttle the guy who answered the phone seemed less interested in picking us up after he found out we had gone into the city and hadn't just flown in.

I will say there was one or two people who worked there who were super friendly, but between our bad experiences, wallpaper peeling off the wall (everywhere, not just the bathroom), desperate need of a paint job, dirty bathtub, and poor housekeeping, we won't ever visit another Sofitel. The best part of the trip is that we spent so little time at the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, but a bit worn
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, beautiful public areas, small gym and slightly worn and dated rooms.

review.title: Five Star Service, Clean and Spacious!
review.reviewText:
Overall, this is a fantastic hotel. The lobby was very spacious and the room was very clean and also spacious. The service from the curb through the concierge to the lobby bar was all beyond superb, even in comparison to other luxury brands.

After an incredible weekend in Napa, we stayed at this hotel the night before an early morning flight back home. It was an excellent finish to an already great weekend.

I have stayed at several hotels in San Francisco as well as the SFO airport area. This will be my hotel of choice for future visits.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and open design
review.negativeRemarks: The shuttle to the airport was limited at trip per hour, and didn't operate early (before 6AM). The town car service was great (and at cab prices).
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location! 10 miles from SFO so no noise issues, but only a 15 minute ride.

review.title: Check out room before you unpack.
review.reviewText: Although a non smoking room, the rug had cigarette burns and you could smell smoke. They offered to move us but we had already unpacked and was tired from our trip. I fault the housekeeping staff for not noting it in the room info on the computer or maybe they were too lazy to report it. Lesson. Check out the room completely before letting the bell captain leave. I would have expected more from this type of hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Smoky room

The hotel is great, location is far from the city but you can take the free shuttle to the airport and the train downtown from there (16.50 roundtrip).
If you want to drive to the city is about 30 minutes to union square or 45 to fishermans wharf where you can leave your car. Staff was very helpful. Breakfast is great.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very nice. Comfortable room and free parking

review.title: Great airport hotel option.

Took advantage of the free shuttle service to the airport, it was on time, all the staff very helpful. Room excellent very quiet I plan on staying there again. Dinner excellent, bar area fun. Breakfast a little expensive.

review.title: So Wonderful
review.reviewText: Wonderful, if there were children or younger adults in the hotel - we never heard them. The staff was so polite and available, but unobtrusive. Love this stay!!!

review.title: Perfect Hotel, Only a Short, Scenic Drive to S.F.
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised to find such a great rate during a holiday weekend (4th of July), so I reserved the hotel in a snap. I don't mind the drive to SF as we drive from So. Cal, so using our car is the preferred mode of transit for us. I paid in advance through Expedia and arrived the afternoon of the 5th. Check-in was very fast and the clerk was extremely courteous. I believe she upgraded our rooms, as well, because we had the view of the Bay as well as a Keurig coffeemaker in the room, which wasn't described for the standard that I paid for. We also had free internet (which was fine for internet browsing and the like) & free parking! That in itself is a major savings. Our room was perfect for the two of us and the bed was heavenly. It made it hard to get up and going since it was so soft and cuddly! If you stay here, and don't drink coffee, (like myself), visit the cute cafe in the front of the hotel and have an amazing hot chocolate with cinnamon for about $3. YUM!!
review.positiveRemarks: The view of the Bay, the closeness to wonderful San Carlos and the proximity to S.F without having to be in the thick of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Large incentive hold on my bank account after the room was paid for
review.locationRemarks: Beautful scenery near Oracle headquarters and just a short drive to S.F. Perfect!

review.title: great hotel for the whole family
review.reviewText: I think the hotel was great the staff was very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The view was great
review.negativeRemarks: The tubs were outdated

review.title: Take your little dogs with you!!
review.reviewText: This place was just incredible all the way around. From the friendly staff to the SUPER comfortable down beds. The most important thing for us is that we are dog lovers. This Hotel is worldwide based out of France. In France people take their little dogs everywhere with them (i.e. grocery store, restaurants) We took our two little dogs with us, and they got to sit by the pool, sit in the lounge, and stay in one of the nice rooms!! (usually if a dog can stay ya get a crap room). The ONLY issue I had, was that I didn't find out about it sooner. Thank You to EVERYONE at Hotel Sofitel San Francisco...
review.positiveRemarks: EXTREMELY dog friendly!!, down beds, pool open 24 hours
review.negativeRemarks: Drinks in the bar were a bit pricey...
review.locationRemarks: It's located in a business park about 20 minutes from SFO. The back of the Hotel is right on the San Francisco Bay.

managementResponses.response:
The entire Sofitel San Francisco Bay team would like to THANK YOU for your lovely message and great compliments. 

It is really a great reward for all of us to see how deeply you enjoyed staying with us . We are delighted that you enjoyed our luxury service with French flair. 

Thank you again for choosing us and for taking time to share your experience. We hope we'll have an opportunity to welcome you back very soon to Sofitel San Francisco Bay.

review.title: Outstanding Customer Service
review.reviewText: Beautiful environs on a lagoon but isolated from non-hotel amenities. Definitely need a car to move around.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent customer service
review.locationRemarks: Idyllic environs beside a lagoon

review.title: This is a Great Hotel, with a European Flavor
review.reviewText: This hotel would be great for anyone that was staying in the general area, most likely business travelers, however, this hotel is beautiful. There are no conveniences in walking distance, so if it is not at the hotel, you will need to get whatever you want/need when you are out for the day. The Staff was so accommodating and the rooms are a nice size. Some of the furniture in the room could stand to be replaced, but nothing extreme. The food was scrumptious, although a bit pricey. There is a gym and a very small coffee shop that doubles as a very small gift shop. It was too cool for the pool, but it was beautifully set up for outdoor lounging, including fire pits on both ends of the pool. And finally it is a hike from SFO so you would be wise to rent a car if you are going back and forth to the City/Wharf/Piers.
review.positiveRemarks: The Lobby and the Restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: The distance from SFO

review.title: Swanky Hotel!

review.title: Great! I will come to this hotel again.

review.positiveRemarks: Pet allowed is amazing! I see there are foods for pets, very unique. Room facilities are very nice.
review.locationRemarks: close to the SFO, if you take hotel shuttle, it takes around 20~25 mins

review.title: Amazing hotel for the price!
review.reviewText: This hotel was not what we expected for the price. It was amazing! Everyone was very friendly. We were greeted with a smile as soon as we reached the front door. The doorman and valets were amazing as well. The rooms were very clean and the service was outstanding. I would recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. Thank you for making our stay so wonderful!

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I and a great time to stay with SOFITEL for two days. The hotel is neat, elegant and lovely. The surrounding area a is quite and green. There is a beautiful lake nearby and many cute ducks swimming aross the lake.

The most important thing is their excellent customer service. With prior contact, the meeting service department prepared flowers and made special rrom decoration for my boyfriend's 30th birthday. We also received a birthday card with everyone's signature. That's very surprised and touching.

Very nice stay and unforgettable memory!
review.positiveRemarks: customer service

review.title: Summer of 2012
review.reviewText: Nothing wrong with the hotel, just small rooms a little outdated and definitely not a 4 star hotel. Not close enough to take the train to San Fran, cab rides where expensive from there ($40 - $60 to airport to catch the train to the city).
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby and bar are beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool is small and you have to walk through the bar to get there.
review.locationRemarks: If you are looking to go to San Fran this is not the place. Great location for getting to Silicon Valley though.

review.title: Amazing hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazing. I usually can't afford such a luxurious hotel, but thanks to Expedia's rates, I could. Everything about our stay was incredible. Feather pillows and duvet, and we ordered room service, felt so pampered. And every time I called the front desk, I was instantly identified by name and referred to as Madam. One morning an item was forgotten in our room service order, one call and it was fixed promptly, with many apologies (it really wasn't that big of a problem). I would stay here again in a heartbeat, it was that amazing. Only complaint was the stack of garbage in the parking garage. It appeared that stuff had been dumped there for MONTHS, it was an unsightly disaster. For such an immaculate hotel, to see that was very shocking. It needs to be cleaned up, pronto. Other than that, the place was just phenomenal. Loved it.
review.positiveRemarks: So luxurious. Fancy, clean, wonderful staff. Room service was incredible.
review.negativeRemarks: The messy garbage in the parking garage. And the fact that it is usually out of our price range. Wish they had lower rates.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location. If you are going to tour Fisherman's Wharf, etc., you will have a bit of a drive, but it's not unmanageable.

review.title: NICE Place to travel around SF area!!
review.reviewText: Overall, this hotel is very good! nice price with nice views!

review.title: Chic & Modern
review.reviewText: Loved the room and the bathroom. Very clean and chic. Love the type of toiletries used!
review.positiveRemarks: The wonderful Rainfall style showers.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to have refrigerators and safes put in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great location...close to San Francisco (20 minutes drive).

review.title: 3 days in Redwood City.
review.reviewText: Big rooms. Quiet location. No commercial nearby. Lagoon a plus. Helpful staff let us check in at 9 am. Luxury bath robe normally not in rooms of this price.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size. Bay window sofa. Ample free parking. Espresso machine in room. Free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Furniture a little old. Room rate is volatile (on Expedia). Steep changes from day to day.
review.locationRemarks: It is off-the-beaten path inside an office park by Oracle HQ buildings. No restaurants or shopping unless you drive.

review.title: Nice stay!
review.reviewText: I got a good deal since my family stayed there 3 nights. The environment was great...beautiful and quiet. The employees were helpful in answering my questions when I first arrived and assisting my family when we had a flat tire right in front of the hotel. Overall, my family and I are very satisfied and would recommend this place to our relatives and friends if they happens to seek a hotel in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful surrounding

review.title: a wonderful french hotel in all aspect.
review.reviewText: a wonderful french hotel in all aspect. if you want me to pick a bone out of an egg, i would say that hall way base board and room doors' edges need a little paint touch up. other than that there are nothing to complain. Great great place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: bay side pool, bay view room, great place to read after a day work,
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: 92 + 101 hwy mid point to any where

review.title: Sofitel Hotel a Vacation Stay In Itself
review.reviewText: I had never heard of this hotel but needed a hotel to accommodate both my family and me I read the reviews on Expedia by previous clients that stayed there and also looked at the pictures that was posted this helped me decide to book a reservation at the Sofitel San Francisco Bay hotel. I would say after having been there I would definitely recommend this hotel. The hotel is located outside of San Francisco off the 101 freeway in a very new industrial location. We were there over the long memorial day weekend. It was such a very peaceful area surrounded by buildings trees, grass, a lagoon, and some wildlife (geese). It was humorous to see a geese crossing sign as you drive towards the hotel. There is free parking at the hotel and lots of it, a plus if you are driving long distance. The staff was very professional, polite, and helpful. There was a french doorman that had such a welcoming, friendly attitude as he greeted my family and me. The lobby itself is very clean it had this classy, modern, chic decor. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean they have a cleaning service each day to clean and replenish toiletries, water bottles, k cups for there Keurig coffee makers they have for each room. Amenities are great there is a jogging path near the pretty lagoon, a swimming pool, and a well kept top of the line gym that provided clean towels, fresh water, and fruit. Overall my stay at the Sofitel was a vacation in itself and definitely would recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing about this hotel is most everything
review.negativeRemarks: My least favorite is the price of food in the hotel restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Located outside of San Francisco off the 101 freeway in a new industrial area surrounded by greenery, some wild life, and a beautiful lagoon

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
- Very nice hotel
- Free parking
- Free internet

- Far from San Francisco (30 mins)
review.positiveRemarks:
- Very nice hotel
- Free parking
- Free internet
review.locationRemarks: - Far from San Francisco (30 mins)

review.title: Great place to stay outside of the city.
review.reviewText: Stayed here while visiting some friends in San Francisco. Great place to stay, if you are willing to make the 20-30 minute drive into the city. We were willing to make that drive and it turned out great as it was easily half the cost of staying anywhere near downtown. The hotel isn't the most lavish of places, but it is very clean and a great staff. But it has to be said, that the greatest part of this hotel was the unbelievably comfortable bed. We shared a king size bed that was like heaven! For those willing to make a little drive into the city, save some money and have a great nights sleep on a fantastic bed, I'd highly recommend the Sofitel.
review.positiveRemarks: One of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on.
review.negativeRemarks: The drive was 20-30 mins to the city, but I knew that before I booked the room. Was not a problem for me, but it was my "least favorite" thing.
review.locationRemarks: Isolated part of Redwood City, in a business park. Not much around it.

review.title: very nice place
review.reviewText: The hotel was so classy and nice and most of all clean and comfy! the only problem i had was that when i had went to check in they did not have a room available for me yet. I was in a rush since it was my cousins wedding so i just went straight to my cousin's room and they called me when my room was fianlly available and sent the key to my cousin's room for me to get.

review.title: Relaxing stay
review.reviewText: Very relaxing and quiet... probably good for business meetings, banquets etc...
review.positiveRemarks: nice lagoon view

review.title: Superb quality and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Check in was easy and friendly staff. Room had a great lagoon view and was clean. The beds were comfortable and feather pillows and down comforter. I really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend to families with kids.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Easy on off freeway

review.title: A bit hip....
review.reviewText: We got a surprisingly good deal through Expedia. I would not classify the hotel as "super luxurious", but it is very clean and comfortable with a modern flair. Sofitel's European heritage peaks through, too (such as the L'Occitane toiletries). All this sets it apart from many other cookie-cutter business hotels (e.g., many a Hilton) that I have stayed at over the years.

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: Reasonable price, clean and comfort. The parking area is closed and convenient.

review.title: Sofitel San Francisco Bay
review.reviewText: I really love the Sofitel brand. I missed not having a boutique, as is available in Houton and D.C. properties, to purchase high-end women's clothing and accessories.

review.title: Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: Check in went very smoothly, room was clean, bed was comfy and and the room had nice amenities. We ate and had drinks at the bar, both were very good, as was the service. The only drawbacks to this hotel is that it is not really close to any other restaurants or entertainment, and that the decor in the room and layout seemed a little dated.
review.positiveRemarks: Drinks and snacks in the bar
review.locationRemarks: Not really close to anything other than office parks

review.title: Nice and reasonable
review.reviewText: Stunning, attractive lobby and bar areas down stairs. Rooms clean but without panache of the lobby; missing small details like place to hang towels (esp if you want us to reuse them) and bathroom exhaust fan. Beds comfortable. Furniture a little old looking but who really cares.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, industrial area away from traffic of downtown but close enough to go into town for the evening.

review.title: A Wonderful Stay at Sofitel
review.reviewText: We spent a wonderful Mother Day in the hotel and were very impressed by the quality its omidation and service. All the hotel staff were very nice and helpful, especially those at the reception desk. It was a regret that we did not ask for their names so that we can we could extend our thanks to each of them specifically. We have been to this hotel twice and will definitely stay there next time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: business travel in bay area
review.reviewText: a great hotel, friendly service, and convenient location when planning meetings/travel throughout the bay area. Free parking is nice plus as well

review.title: Didn't want to leave
review.reviewText: the staff remembered me from previous stays, gave me a view of the water in order for me to watch the rowing event from my room if I wanted, the lobby area, restaurant and pool were inviting, with great music, delicious food, superb service, and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds and great service from the staff
review.locationRemarks: quiet with views of the water

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. 20 minutes from airport. Lots of hotels closer to airport. The hotel shuttle does not start running until 6 am. to airport. If you have a 7 am flight you must take cab to airport ($50). Loved the hotel but is somewhat out of the way.
review.positiveRemarks: Room, dining and bar all get A+
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Out of the way. Nothing close by.
review.userLocation: Blue Grass Airport (LEX), Terminal Dr, Lexington, KY 40510, USA

review.title: Superb!!!
review.reviewText: For our weekend price, this hotel was exceptional!! Our room was clean, modern, and the bed was super comfy! I really liked the fact that they had bright bathroom mirrors (for applying make-up) and a small magnifying (lighted) make-up mirror! This hotel exceeded my expectations and I will definitely stay here again!!! Highly recommend!!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, down comforter, bright bathroom lights and just overall comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: My husband would have like a jacuzzi; only a swimming pool.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great; easy access to fwy!

review.title: Great Job
review.reviewText: Raul - the door man was very helpful and was a true professional and a credit to you hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, neat - nice staff
review.negativeRemarks: Taking the coffee in the lobby at 7am
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed EVERYTHING about my stay from the hotel shuttle from the airport until I took the shuttle back to the airport! I will stay there every time I come to the San Francisco area!

review.title: room can get a little too warm at night
review.reviewText: The only thing that would make the room perfect would be if the windows could open in order to get fresh air. Sometimes the room temp feels a little warm/stuffy at night... only negative.
review.positiveRemarks: the beds are wonderful!!!
review.negativeRemarks: windows dont open
review.locationRemarks: beautiful setting on a lagoon

review.title: Pleasant all around
review.reviewText: Great location (Redwood City on the water) light, bright lobby/bar area with pleasant views and attentive wait staff. Great little bakery and coffee shop (need to remind them to give real cups/saucers without assuming takeout) in the lobby. Easy parking, access to highways, courteous front desk and doorstaff. Didn't use the complimentary gym but it looked great. We were there for a family visit but it looks to be a great executive stay also with Oracle headquarters a few blocks away. Recommend highly and i've been everywhere

review.title: a hidden gem
review.reviewText: trained staff. courteous. eager to please. friendly. my favorite in the area-we always try to stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: staff, bedding, coffee shop, workout facility, self parking
review.locationRemarks: none

review.title: Disappted
review.reviewText: Lobby was fancy but the rooms are very basic. Staff also was not very friendly or helpful. Did not even offer to help us with our luggage. Would not go again

review.title: Sofitel San Francisco Bay is excellent
review.reviewText: Welcoming, great service, European elegance, very reasonable price.
review.positiveRemarks: Charm, service, decor, the Lake, and free parking
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Short stay before flight
review.reviewText: Stayed here before flying out of SFO. Very relaxing hotel close to the airport. They have a free shuttle to SFO that was very convient. The staff was very helpful in getting me to the airport. Also the bakery in the lobby is fabulous! The bar looked stylish and happening for a Friday night.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised at first but disappointed.
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised at first glance when we first arrived. The first thing i noticed when we were getting settled in was that there was no refrigerator but dismissed it because of the size of the ice bowl that was provided.We left for a scheduled birthday party and arrived back around 11:30. We ordered room service and settled in for the night only to find a bed with no sheets under a duve and comforter provided.We attempted to call but the phone next to the couch was not working and decided we would just settle for sleeping on top of the comforter under the throw blanket provided as we were to tired to go thru some one making our bed so late.Prior to going to bed we noticed the window was leaking so much that we had to use all of the towels provided to soak up the water that penetrated from the passing storm.The food was good and so was the service.We will most likely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: room layout, view, food, service.
review.negativeRemarks: No sheets on bed, water leaking from window, broken phone.
review.locationRemarks: Very nice views.

review.title: Sofitel in Redwood Shores, CA
review.reviewText:
Overall experience is OK. Finishes in the room are getting a bit worn and the caulking in the tub is needing repair.

Staff encounters were well above average -- 90%.

Cocktails were expensive with pricing errors between printed menu ($12) and billed amount ($15). Maker's Mark is good, but even $12 is too high. Irish Coffee had grounds (perhaps instant coffee?) in the bottom of the cup. My Maker's had "extra" greenery floating in it. No offer to replace the drink when pointed out to the overloaded server.

Price paid was good and the property is beautiful. Wouldn't mind going back someday.

review.title: Saints-49ers Playoff game, 2012
review.reviewText:
Stayed at the Sofitel in Redwood City for two nights while visiting the bay area for the Saints-49ers playoff game at Candlestick in Jan, 2012. We were glad that we had rented a car because the hotel is located in an office park and is remote from most amenities we were looking for. Staff very friendly, room very comfortable, and everything functioned as it should. We did not use the restaurant at the hotel because the prices are very high, and there are plenty of dining alternatives within an easy drive.

We won't be coming back but only because the 49er fans were the most obnoxious we've ever encountered as visiting NFL fans - nothing to do with the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: My wife was impressed by the decor of the lobby and common areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Could not contact the valet parking directly from our room. Had to call the switchboard and then be reconnected.
review.locationRemarks: Not walking distance to shops, restaurants, etc. If you don't bring a car you'll be spending a lot of $ and time in taxis.

review.title: Hotel Experence
review.reviewText: The hotel front desk personnel were extremely pleasant and helpful. The facility was well maintained.

review.title: Totally satisfied 4 nights' stay!!
review.reviewText: Chic location, quiet yet convenient. Great comfort in room and bed. Very good daily room cleaning service. Fine dining. Couteous and Cordial staff. Ernest effort to renew and maintain the premise. Fun, younger, mature, tech or professional crowds in the lounge every night. No problem recommending it or returning to it when a hotel in that area is required. Within 10-20 driving minutes to Palo Alto, Belmont, Menlo Park, Stanford etc... Worth paying a bit more to be pampered.

review.title: We loved it!
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel and will definitely be back.

review.title: Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location!
review.reviewText:
I had no qualms about Hotel Sofitel. They provided everything - bottled water, Keurig coffee, L'Occitane bath products, free wi-fi, even cotton swabs, cotton balls and a nail filer. They really did think of everything except toothpaste and mouthwash.

The room was spacious, although I did have double beds and the beds were comfortable and clean. They noted that the duvet is changed for every hotel guest.

I also thought the location was great - a very suburban, quiet neighbourhood with easy access to local eateries.

All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel and I would stay at Hotel Sofitel again if I am ever in the area. They also cater to individuals fluent in French - I am guessing they are a French hotel. Tres bien!!

review.title: Sofitel visitor
review.reviewText: DSK was nowhere in sight and I enjoyed this stay in this superior business-airport hotel. Breakfast was particularly good.

review.title: Sofitel was a very Pleasant Experience
review.reviewText: This Hotel was nicer than we expected. It's not too big nor too small and served our needs perfectly for that wk-end. We would definitely consider returning.
review.locationRemarks: Woodside area, specifically, Alice's Restaurant. It's a 40 min. ride, but well worth it.

review.title: Sofitel, so close to being great
review.reviewText:
So, it's in Redwood City pretty close to Silicon Valley, the heart of all things high-tech.
It's also a business hotel.
THERE WAS A WIFI OUTAGE FOR ALMOST 24 HOURS.
review.locationRemarks: SF

review.title: Good but nothing walkable
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, good for access to 101 and El Camino Real but nothing is walkable apart from a nice lagoon walk. You can get to local buses and the CALTRAN but this takes half an hour and is not a pretty walk, although completely safe.
review.locationRemarks: All of it.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Very well appointed, lobby/lounge. Loved the fire pits, highly recommend.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Room above average, everything else 5 star. Service exceptionally attentive and friendly. Be sure to dine at the restaurant, as the food is top notch.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is okay except the lack of free wireless in the rooms. For the price, I don't want to go to the lobby to use the internet.

review.title: good choice
review.reviewText: Quite a value for this hotel accommodation

review.title: only the best
review.reviewText: very impressed, have already referred to others. can:t wait to go back. they even sent someone to get playing cards for us at no charge. can"t imagine a better stay thank you sofitel

review.title: Excellent in every way
review.reviewText: Great service and super value in modern hotel. Sofitel is excellent!

review.title: comfortably elegant
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel.

review.title: bad location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were excellent and the hotel is very nice if you are looking for a quiet getaway. However, the location is very remote if you don't rent a car it is difficult and expensive to get around. The hotel offers a shuttle to the airport where you can catch the BART train. To take a cab is very expensive as the hotel is quite a ways out of San Fransisco. There aren't any restaurants in walking distance so you either have to take a cab somewhere or eat at the hotel.
