review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: It deserves its 4-star rating. Facilities and the location are great. It does get quite busy both on weekdays and weekends so you may have to tolerate a bit of noise at the lobby. Certainly not the fault of the hotel.

review.title: Nice rooms, but a quite a drive to San Fran
review.reviewText: This was a very nice and classy hotel, i would say a solid 3 and a half star hotel. The pool was below average and there was no hot tub. The gift shop was lacking, so make sure that you are well stocked, I did not dine in the restaurant, however it looked very chic. The biggest challenge was the distance from San Francisco, it was at least a 45 minute drive, and the hotel is located in a business park, so there is nothing around the hotel to do, the nearest commercial development is a 10 minute drive away.

review.title: Never go back
review.reviewText: The service was bad I couldn't sleep all night when down to tell them and they blew me off never will I stay there again and the price bad bad hotel

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: old furniture, no free wi-fi, no free breakfast or happy hours, dirty carpet, need car when stay at this location

review.title: Sofitel hotel in Redwood City
review.reviewText: Great vibe about the place, great staff.

review.title: Excellent services every time when I stay at this hotel
review.reviewText: Every time when I stay at the Sofitel Hotel at Redwood City, I a very happy with their services. Rooms are very clean and feel secure at the hotel. The lake next to the hotel is also beautiful. I like about the quiteness in the neighborhood. Strongly recommended.

review.title: Don R
review.reviewText: Beautiful upscale hotel near SF airport. Very reasonable.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The room was nice and clean. The wi-fi connection is free only in the bar area. In the rooms you have to pay.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friedly. The location is great, very quiet and good for people with pets. Since we brought our dog, it was very important to us to have a nice walk in the morning. We will definitely come again to this hotel again.

review.title: Luxury hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Got a great deal through Expedia (40% off) for a weekend stay, before flying out of SFO.

review.title: Serene surroundings
review.reviewText: Nice surroundings with serene water view. Very nice exercise room with ample of exercise equipment choices. Simple but clean room. Enjoyed the stay!!

review.title: Nice hotel but no free wifi
review.reviewText: This was one of the secret hotels. Overall the room I had & the hotel generally were very good. They also have a pc downstairs specifically to allow you to check in and print off your boarding pass. However this is the first hotel I have stayed at for a long time where one has to pay an additional fee to access the Internet. When you do use it is slow and drops regularly. This was very frustrating when trying to complete some work. With the hotel feeling a bit isolated as it's on a business park & Internet issues I wouldn't use it again.

review.title: France without jet lag
review.reviewText: Loved our stay at Sofitel. I am particular about bed comfort and quality lines and they do a first class job,Service was perfect at the hotel and for breakfast in their restaurant overlooking a lagoon. Lovely!

review.title: Fun get away!
review.reviewText: :D

review.title: Excellent Hotel with a 30 min drive
review.reviewText: Great hotel with luxurious lobby and great service. Very French and chic! The drive to San Franciso was a bit tedious and there are few restaurants around the hotel itself. Hotel staff recommended driving to neighboring San Mateo for dinner. I would recommend bringing your own iPod dock as the hotel does not offer one for charging or listening to your music. The restuarant offers a good breakfast for aroudn $18 per person. There is a scenic walking trail around the facility for a little exercise. Overall, a good experience.

review.title: Best Hotel in Redwood City
review.reviewText: This Hotel is little far from SF but clean, quiet and kind. 5 stars if you don't care about distance from SF.

review.title: It went downhill
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this property quite a few times. The past three times was great. The rooms were in excellent condition.

However, I must say I'm very disappointed with my last stay. I booked the "Prestigious Suite" again. Let's say there nothing prestigious about it. My first room, I walked in had a medication under the TV stand. My dog sniffed it, luckily I was there and take it away. I complained to the front desk, they gave me another room.

I was thinking great. Another room, that is cleaner. I was wrong. The door handle had gum on it. The bathroom was looks old and molded. The wall paper was peeling.

I have always thought of "Sofitel" as a boutique style hotel. I stayed at their property in Ningbo, China and it was absolutely beautiful. The Redwood City location, has lost it's Charm.

One thing, I must note. The staff were extremely friend and courteous. Although the property is run down due to lack of maintence. The staff is still wonderful and there to accomodate.

review.title: Good quality
review.reviewText: Striking lobby and very friendly staff. Room furnishings a bit worn.

review.title: Very nice overall.
review.reviewText: Would have been better if we had coffee service in the room.

review.title: Great Staff but...
review.reviewText: It's all good except for not having coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave in the room especially it's a 4-star hotel. Food at the bar and lounge is pretty good! Price a little bit costly but expected. The Staff were all very nice and professional! Overall, I had a great time and would probably come back! (only if they placed coffee maker in the room).

review.title: first choice hotel
review.reviewText: outstanding moderately priced hotel-never disappoints

review.title: Rooms need urgent full remodel
review.reviewText:
Very disappointed in the bed ( the mattress was old and couldn't sleep) it was replaced rapidly, but the replacement was just as old and worn out where I kept rolling down towards the floor). I don't usually mind the old decor of the rooms or the mismatched furniture, but the bed is a very important factor , since we need to be able to rest after a long trip. We stay there because of proximity and convenience. The pillows are starting to smell and the bathroom tile had mold.
Simply it was not "magnifique"

review.title: Lovely place.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice and the beds were extremely soft. The room was also very clean. My only complaint was the food was extremely too expensive so I had to venture out for food. And the location was a little too far outside of San Francisco then I had hoped. Otherwise, it was a very nice hotel. If you don't want to be too close to San Francisco and closer to the airport.

review.title: Will never go again
review.reviewText: Room service is not complete. We stayed 3 nights could not find any coffee in the morning. Some days room cleaning was not complete. Good thing was a small place for breakfast in the hotel

review.title: the best hotel in the area!
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is the best around - service, employees, beds, pet policy! I would stay at this hotel whenever possible!

review.title: Redwood City's finest!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel with quiet surroundings. We wanted explore San Fran and this location was fine as the drive to downtown was less than 40 minutes.

review.title: Would definitely stay at this hotel again
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and great value too!

review.title: It is a fine hotel, but it does not provide free internet service in room.
review.reviewText:
The first room I checked in didn't seem clean at all. The carpet was pretty dirty. On the second day after I asked for a room change and stated the reason for the change, they switched me to another room which has a new carpet. It seemed that they knew the first room had a dirty carpet. So why they tried to put me in that room in the first place?

Anyway, once I changed the room, everything seemed fine.

review.title: Sofitel, no French elegance
review.reviewText: Hotel lobby is gorgeous, but rooms are small and outdated. The bathroom was disgusting. Not staying here again would rather stay in the city.

review.title: 'A' for Effort by Support Staff
review.reviewText: The manager and staff of the hotel were very accomdating in helping us to have a pleasant stay. They adapted to the changes that occured because of the air line issues. The room was neet and clean and adequate for our needs. The location was realitively easy to get to with a number of auxilary stores within a short driving distance from the hotel.

review.title: quiet time
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a business park and since we stayed over the weekend things were nice and quiet.

review.title: it's a great place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice silent, comfort place close to the city

review.title: Modern and Comfortable
review.reviewText: The San Francisco Sofitel was a great find and a very good bargain considering the beauty of the hotel and its amenities. The design is very modern and comfortable. THe division of the room (it was a suite) into bedroom work/play areas works realy well. I only wish I had more time to enjoy it all (I got in a 10 PM and left at 4:30 AM!). Although I am fluent in French,I found the French "bons soirs" a little odd and artificial. One small drawback: on the Expedia site the hotel is listed as "near the airport". It is not. It is about 9 miles away to the south. If one has to return a car, it makes for an early start in the morning.

review.title: Convenient. yet not worth the regular list price
review.reviewText: Nice and clean option near the airport for 1-2 nights. However, if you don't require the full four stars, there are more convenient (closer to shops) and cheaper nice hotels in the area.

review.title: A little pricey, but nice overall
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice, the staff very friendly, and there's a really nice lounge off the lobby. The rooms are clean and very well appointed. The only negative was the price. Luckily, the company paid, but I wouldn't have paid that much for this hotel.

review.title: Anytime visting SF I would stary here every time!
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Sofitel before I would always stay there when visiting SF!

review.title: Good for short business trip
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice , but if you plan on staying on the week end don't plan on using the pool or the out side desk, as in between party and wedding the pool is close for guest.
Ig you are lucky is not too noisy .... I was lucky 10 days out of 15.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Nice lovely hotel that has a beautiful lake view. Clean and comfy room that meets a five star hotel rating!

review.title: nice hotel but dated
review.reviewText: Hotel is located near Oracle campus and clientele seemed to be more business traveler types. Lobby is nice and updated, but the rooms are noticeably dated.

review.title: excellant hotel,,great staff
review.reviewText: great bar lounge and fitness center

review.title: Business district hotel south of SF
review.reviewText: Great place to stay for the money. We chose to stay south of SF for we had stayed in SF last visit and thought we might venture south to Monterey or further this trip, yet still wanted to be able to go in to SF. Great location/price for that. We had to request that our sheets get changed for they had stains and there were stains on the chair and couch in the room- they appeared as though they could be removed. Other than that, the restaurant had a great menu as well as room service. Free parking is a plus too.

review.title: Needs updating, badly!
review.reviewText: Disappointed in the room condition. Carpet was stained, appeared old. Paint chipped along door frames. All in all, worn, tired and not welcoming.

review.title: Very Impressed!
review.reviewText: This hotel is truly beautiful inside. The service staff is very friendly. The beds are beyond heavenly. Note that there is a complimentary coffee concession on each floor in the mornings....so dont' worry that you have no coffee maker in the room! ,,,,Found that out AFTER buying a small coffee maker for the week. The food is quite overpriced, but to be expected in this type of hotel. FREE PARKING in San Francisco is literally unheard of in 5 star hotels, and this one offers it! WOW! Higly recommend!

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText: Hotel and room was as expected, beds were very comfortable. Hotel staff were helpful. Location was ok thought it was closer to downtown San Francisco. About 20 mins drive.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: Extremely nice, comfortable and staff very pleasant

review.title: Superb French Elegance
review.reviewText: The Sofitel has old world charm in a modern setting. The service is excellent - from the doormen to the front desk. They called me when I got to my room to make certain it met my expectations. The beds are fantastic.

review.title: Good if you don't need to be in SF downtown
review.reviewText:
Nicely located near a freeway but not disturbed by it, this hotel is on an artificial p that our 4-year old son loved exploring. A small strip mall nearby has a good grocery store and several restaurant and fast food choices. Having a car is essential at this location. Parking on the hotel lot was free as is internet use at several computers in the lobby. Connection in the room was not billed even though it was posted as costing $9.95 a day. Perhaps a weekend promotion--we didn't ask.

Room interiors are not as flashy as the exterior and the lobby would suggest, but they are comfortable and quiet. Breakfast is not included and costs $20 in the hotel restaurant, but it is good and just about worth its price.

Much recommended.

review.title: Very romantic.
review.reviewText: Very good Hotel. We used couple times, and always good. Tehy are located separate area by themself, and very nice srounding and quiet. Weekend rate is aslo attractive for private use.

review.title: Just OK.
review.reviewText:
Spent a week here on business. The hotel is nice, clean and seems well maintained. They are obviously trying hard to be stylish and "French". The staff was friendly, but service in the restaurant and bar was very slow - I gave up and went elsewhere. Not having a coffee maker in the room was a real pain.

The location was very convenient for me and I might stay again for that reason alone, but I wouldn't recommend it if you don't need to close to the nearby businesses.

review.title: Nice getaway
review.reviewText:
I live in the area and wanted a getaway and this was perfect. Not too far, and they allowed you to bring 1 dog. The room was nicely furnished, and the sheets were soft. I would stay here again.

FYI It's located around office buildings so there isn't much to do within walking distance. The in hotel restaurant overlooks the small pool, so not much privacy. This is not close to San Francisco, you will need to drive maybe 20-30 minutes.

review.title: Good Value for the Money
review.reviewText: This was our first stay at the Sofitel in the US. Location was convenient for our long weekend visit and would consider using Sofitel again if we could obtain the weekend pricing structure. It was great having complimentary parking.

review.title: Sofitel hotel stay
review.reviewText:
It was great, the hotel was really nice, a bit short staffed that night. They had 1 guy checking-in while he is also the valet, room service, and many other role that night cause he was the only 1 working in the hotel that night. We didn't really need any help, so it was fine. Everything in the hotel was awesome, parking was easy, nice view right in front of the hotel. I will go back again.
It's not tooooo far from SF.

review.title: Arash
review.reviewText: every thing is good except breakfast

review.title: Local overnight stay
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel located in a business area. Was upgraded to lagoon view room. Comfortable bed. Friendly front desk personnel.
Surprised that their was a charge for valet parking due to isolated location.

review.title: Mix matched and not impressed
review.reviewText: When I walked into the lobby it was what it looked like in the photos on their site very modern and trendy looking.. but when i went to my room it was very old looking looked like a best western room didn't match up to the lobby, the small couch was stained and the blinds did not close.Service was excellent just wish the room lived up to the entire look of the lobby.

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: as 4 stars as expected.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL
review.reviewText: BEST HOTEL IVE EVER STAYED IN

review.title: Would benefit by having mini-bar in room.
review.reviewText: Would benefit by having mini-bar in room

review.title: Great place to stay in Redwood City
review.reviewText: The Sofitel hotel was extremely comfortable and clean. It was a great stay while we were in the San Fran area. It was a bit confusing driving around the general area of the hotel. But the beds were spectacular.

review.title: A+++
review.reviewText:
Awesome place, very near to SFO, on quiet laggon. All landmarks are near by.

Service, quailty A++++. Had a ncie cafe and restaurent in hotel.

review.title: Oasis of peace
review.reviewText: A beautiful oasis of peace amid California's hustle. Every aspect of our stay was wonderful--the hotel is luxurious and the lagoon is sits upon adds a very special element. The beds were very comfortable. The room and bath were perfectly clean and well-maintained. The only bit of a set-back was the very high prices in the restaurant, which serves excellent food. The hotel sits in a business park, so there are no other options nearby for meals without a vehicle.

review.title: Pleasant, convenient, and a great value
review.reviewText: Particularly comfortable hotel given I got sick during my stay & was a shut-in for 2 days. Easy access to drug store, grocery store, take out food. Room service also good (but a bit pricy as with any comparable hotel).

review.title: Clean Hotel but not the best area
review.reviewText: I was satisfied with my room and the service - I especially enjoyed the European theme. However, the area surrounding the hotel the absolute 'burbs. There's nothing going on outside of the hotel.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.... minus some usual expected amenities.
review.reviewText: This Sofitel is a GORGEOUS hotel. It looks luxurious... However, there are some basic amenities that you would receive at say, a Howard Johnson, that you won't get here. (Like free high-speed internet or a refrigerator) Also- beware that room-service is EXORBITANT. I ordered a glass of milk that was advertised as $4.50 and by the time I paid for it I was charged $8.00. They tack on a delivery fee and taxes and fees............ (as if room-service isn't pricey enough.) I would stay here again, but I might shop around for a hotel w/ free internet, a microwave, and fridge...

review.title: Nice but Loud
review.reviewText: We stayed a few nights at the hotel and it was a very nice facility. The rooms were very nice and clean. The down fall was they hold large parties/events at night which can be very loud. We heard DJ music up until midnight one night. They did say they would move our room the next night if another function was to be held, but one of the desk agents seemed like we were just being picky.

review.title: LONG WEEK END
review.reviewText: WAS THE BEST 4 STAR HOTEL THAT I HAVE BEEN IN.

review.title: Sofitel thinks they are much better than they are
review.reviewText: Not impressed at all with the Sofitel.

review.title: Perfect service for your PET!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is the best hotel with Pet.
Room is clean and staff is pretty friendly.
I strongly recommend if you try to find the Hotel with pet.

review.title: Extra Mile
review.reviewText: My lady and I spent our 8 year anniversary here last weekend. I sent a quick note when booking to informed them that it was a special occasion for us. All I was expecting was just a nice greeting of some sort. They really went out of their way to make our weekend special. The check in hostess was very warm, greeted and congratulated us on our occasion. They also, upgraded our room. We left for dinner and upon our return they provided us a complimentary bottle of champagne. This was all at their courtesy. I have spent time in plenty of hotels. This was by far the most generous and thoughtful gesture that I could imagine. Nothing was expected but our expectations were well exceeded. Its rare that you find customer service that pays attention to the details and really excels at the execution of true customer satisfaction. Great kudos and thanks to the San Francisco Sofitel and staff. Thank you for a memorable weekend!

review.title: As always, very comfortable to stay
review.reviewText: Wheneevr I travel to San Francisco area, I always use this hotel. It is not crowded, price is good, services are excellent, very comfortable, no complaints. Hey, what can you ask more?

review.title: A good deal! for this luxury...
review.reviewText: The room looked much more modern in the web page and in the lobby. So I expected a bit more of this deco in the room. But the king bed was amazing!

review.title: Lacks a few standard items
review.reviewText: Spiffy hotel, but lacks standard items like an in-room refrigerator. Has odd lighting wiring (nev er did get one of the bedside lamps to work). But parking's free (vs. $3.95 for a bottle of Diet Coke downstairs). Feels super, though. Good bedding.

review.title: Beautiful hotel & great service! No parking fees & great location!
review.reviewText: The lobby and surroundings are beautiful, however the rooms where we stayed haven't been redone in years (cottage cheese ceilings,old bathroom fixtures and 80's color schemes). They could use some renovating. The beds are very comfy, but I prefer a sheet instead of just the duvet cover in case it gets hot. The hotel will accomodate you if you request it. Great capuccinos & croissants @ the lobby for breakfast.Will go back for sure!

review.title: TO FAR FROM SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: TO FAR FROM SAN FRANCISCO

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Air condition is out of order. Room is not clean. But staff is very kind.

review.title: Tres bien
review.reviewText: We only stayed a few nights, but were very happy with the quality, cleanliness and decor of our room, the hotel itself and it's location. The only thing that I wasn't too happy with was the coffee served in the little shop by the lobby - it was quite weak and quite expensive. However, Starbucks was close by - whew! I would definitely check in to this hotel again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. It was in a buisness area so a car was a must to go around. Quality was great for the price, a hotel like that in San Francisco would have cost at least 300$ a night. My only disapointment was the snack bar/gift shop. The service was terrible and things over price ( two cups of regular coffee cost me 6.50$).

review.title: too starnge rooms
review.reviewText: if you do not stay there but simply have a breakfast or lunch, the hotel is great. but if you are a hotel guest, then you will be surprised with weird rooms in very traditional american style. this is a french chain, so i would expect it to be new, laconic and mordern. the suite we have stayed had formally everything yet was ridiculous.

review.title: Refined Relaxation
review.reviewText: Service is friendly and professional. Views of the lagoon and the simple elegance of the decor make this an ideal hotel for a relaxing getaway despite its office park setting. Charges for internet access was the only annoyance.

review.title: fairly impressed
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the quite weekend (Saturday night stay) and the walk along the lagoon when there's no one bothering me on Sunday morning.

review.title: Best deal ever!
review.reviewText: Five Star, Soft, comfy beds and sheets, spacious rooms, service with a smile, yummy food, and a surprisingly hip and happening bar with a bar tender who knows how to mix a cocktail. My experience far exceeded my expections, no doubt.

review.title: NOT FOR THE MIDDLE CLASS
review.reviewText: The only complaint I have with this hotel is that it's not for regular people.. seems more suited for the higher class population.. And no coffee maker in the rooms either!!

review.title: Fun, Up Beat Layover / Stay Over Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel over 4th of July weekend with a last minute notice. The hotel had an upbeat atmosphere with a "European Flare" (Frency). Nice downstairs bar / lounge area, beautiful waterside views, friendly staff, convenient parking / valet service. Also very much enjoyed the fact this was a pet friendly hotel where we could have our dog for the night after a long day on the road. I would definetly recomment his hotel to anyone - but especially those traveling with pets.

review.title: Disappointed this time - better before
review.reviewText: We have stayed in this hotel many times, and were looking forward to it again. Unfortunately they booked an event that reserved the pool during the day (very disappointing to our child), and then the same group partied way into the night. Yelling and swearing in the halls at all hours of the night is not the experience expected at a Sofitel.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: We were on our honeymoon and had never been to San Francisco before. We happened upon this hotel on expedia and were more than thrilled with our entire experience. We will return and highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Chic with comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: Nice hotel - clean and chic with good quality amenities. Excellent beddings perfect for a good night's sleep. If possible, ask for a room with lagoon view. The hotel was very quiet, which was wonderful, perhaps because I stayed on a Saturday. The hotel staff was courteous, although the man who checked us in was a bit too stiff and unwelcoming (no smile and seemed to prefer to say as little as possible) Don't miss out on the bakery in the lobby - great pastries and coffee! The hotel is about 15 minutes south from SFO airport, which may not be as convenient for tourists if you plan to visit San Francisco for most of your trip. However, this is a great place for business travellers going to the San Jose area.

review.title: Decent Hotel for Redwood City Area
review.reviewText: Very attractive hotel but somewhat worn. Rooms are nice but furnishings due for an upgrade. Great parking. Pool area and pool area services leave a lot to be desired. Try for a room with water view. Lots of weddings here so can be noisy at night if you are near the wedding parties.

review.title: Redwood City's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: I went with my best friend to San Fran. Sofitel in REdwood City was just a 20 minute walk from the CalTrain which took us to San Francisco each morning. WE loved the hotel and service. Didn't realize it was a French hotel, but that made it all the more fun! There was a small pool outside but it was too cold to swim in at the time we went... but definitely warm enough to lay out. Grocery store was in walking distance as well, so we didn't even end up needing a car as we just walked everywhere or took the train or Bart system. It was a great experience and I can't wait to go back!

review.title: Beautiful SF Bay hotel
review.reviewText: What a location ! A five star hotel ! We totally enjoy our stay at the Sofitel. So relaxing !

review.title: Rooms dated and old
review.reviewText: The main lobby was beauitful and modern but, the rooms were dated and warn- although the bed was comfortable the sitting area was ragged. Rooms need to be remodeled- certainly not a 4 star rating. Coffee was only in the lobby until @6:30a and the desk staff did not go out of their way to accomadate.

review.title: Hotel Property is Good but Staff is No Good
review.reviewText: Overall hotel property is in a good shape. Very nice clean lobby except the bar & restaurant are located in the lobby. Very noisy as we were checking-in. Bit irritating when you try to communicate with the front desk. Same goes for following night. However, it didn't bother us when we were in the room. Room is very nice... no complain. Bed was very comfortable. TV is bit old.. could use a flat LCD TV. Our biggest let down was with the staff. Front desk staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. We didn't feel that we were welcomed at all as we were checking in. Second, we made two nights reservation thru Expedia but I made an extra night with the hotel directly as we were travling to the SF. They told us that we had to check-in twice. They couldn't do the paperwork. As we were checking-in second time around 10:00pm, front desk was having some problems but told us we could just go up to our room. When we got to our room, the room was not clean. When we call the front desk, they told us that they knew about it and have alerted their cleaning staff. Why didn't they tell us when we were checking in? They expect us to wait in our room until their cleaing staff cleans our room past 10:00pm. We had to pack our luggages and had to move to another room. No appology from any one from the staff. Unprofessional! Only person we like were the door mans. They were very friendly and courteous. I don't think we will use this hotel again :-(

review.title: Good but No Free internet access, no hot tub and pricey sodas from the store
review.reviewText: The title says it all. A very nice hotel. The room was great, big and comfy. The employees were very nice and professional. I was disappointed that a place that is so nice had no free internet. They also don't have a hot tub. There is a nice pool. It is a quiet and nice hotel and would recommend it to anyone just know you don't get some of the niceties even cheap hotels would give you.

review.title: Pretty nice hotel considering selection around SFO, although some probs...
review.reviewText: We had some pros and cons, but overall had a good time. Pros were: Beautiful lobby, nice location on SF Bay, nice pool area, really good price on Expedia, large room (junior suite), nice water view rooms. Cons were: First room they gave us was not cleaned, 2nd room smelled like chemical carpet freshener and windows did not open (I guess they do on the 3rd floor only), no coffee maker in any rooms, no hot tub at the pool (went down in the evening in robes, oops!), housekeeping knocked 3 times even though front desk gave us late checkout, heard every toilet flush and door close starting 8am, vacuuming started next door 9am (Sunday!!), rooms were outdated- looked more modern on the website, hotel was out of shampoo (a really nice housekeeper found me a bottle on the sly...). There were more problems than I'm used to having, but they were really nice to give us a 3pm check-out because of them. Staff was excellent and they serve food & drinks by the pool so we shook it all off the next day!

review.title: Elegance with a European Flair
review.reviewText: I had the pleasure of staying in the Sofitel in Redwood City, CA. Driving into the quiet complex where the hotel is located, guests will pass the imposing Oracle towers, the signal that one has entered the "Silicon Valley." However, much care has been put into the grounds of this small community. One can walk from the hotel through lovely CA neighborhoods or skirt the lagoon the hotel's rooms overlook. This is a huge facility with bright accoutrements. My only complaint is that meals are expensive and there are no coffee machines in the rooms, so morning coffee in the hotel is an extra $3-5 in the coffee shop. Traveling between the hotel and the airport will take you about 15-20 minutes along the 101 freeway.

review.title: average hotel but amazing food
review.reviewText: The night when me and my husband were tired to eat out we decided to dine in their resturant but it turned out to be one of the best food we have ever had with amazing rates!!

review.title: Fantastic San Fran Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I loved this hotel. The beds were soft and comfortable, the room was clean and quiet, the service was excellent. It was a bargin for its quality. Also, the room service was great!

review.title: Worth the cheaper price
review.reviewText: Service was very good but the hotel has not been completly renovated yet...and I'm guessing the Expedia deals are for the non renovated rooms. The service was wonderful and the best room service I have ever had. I'll stay there again.

review.title: Soothing Escape
review.reviewText: Friendly and polite staff

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. Weekend rates were great but Thursday night was a bit steep. Food and Drink a bit pricy but very good.

review.title: Nice Holiday Getaway
review.reviewText: This was our third visit to the Hotel Sofitel while visiting relatives in the Bay Area for Christmas. The hotel is always beautifully decorated for the holidays and the staff are consistently very freindly and welcoming.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel at any price. no complaints at all. room was clean, plenty of parking, staff was courteous. would absolutely stay there again.

review.title: The bed was so comfortable i didnt want to leave my room.
review.reviewText: Although I loved the hotel, I was very dissappointed with the food. Grab some fresh fruit, and a croisant from the front lobby, or take a 7 min stroll to the grocery store, and many restuarants.

review.title: Great Bay Area Choice
review.reviewText: The hotel was very modern and although in a business park area, pretty close to the airport. Rooms were nice and service was great.

review.title: Beautiful, Luxurious Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. What a wonderful place to relax. The fitness center was the highlight for me. Wow! The one downside was there were no cancellations permitted. I needed to leave earlier than expected and there seemed to be no exceptions.

review.title: Beautiful and comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in a really quiet area. The bellboys were and there weren't any problems checking in even when I checked in at almost 7:00 pm. The room was nice with an extremely comfortable bed. The only thing I didn't like was that coming back to the hotel at about 7:00 pm the cleaning lady was cleaning my room! And the food was expensive. Otherwise, the stay was great and would recommend it.

review.title: A great stay
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the hotel, very quiet area and beautiful view on the lagoon. You can walk around it and it's perfect to unwind after a visit to San Francisco, only 20mn, 30mn from the hotel.Close by is Redwood city where you have lots of restaurants, but there is one at the hotel too. The pastry there are fantastic. We enjoyed the whole experience.

review.title: Chic hotel with comfort
review.reviewText: Upon reviewing notes about this hotel, i decided to book here during a recent visit to San Francisco. I requested a room far from the service elevator but close enough to the main elevators. Upon arrival, they booked me exactly the opposite of what i had asked for. I was so dissappointed....However, they were quick to change my room to my pleasing. I must admit that the best things about this hotel, is the service, decor of the main lobby, comfort of beds, and the fitness room with new equipment. Staying here was well worth the 25 minute drive to San Francisco.

review.title: Sofitel San Francisco Bay's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Sofitel San Francisco Bay's Best Hotel

review.title: Not exactly worth the price
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel, and I would love to go back. However the room was not really what i had expected. I feel as though I paid the price for an expensive hotel, and got the quality of a cheap hotel. The room was very comfortable and the service was assume.But the room made me feel as though I was staying at the travelodge.

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: hotel was fine, staff good, etc. restaurant/bar over-priced. nice room, except for the air conditioner which blew directly onto the bed.

review.title: Love this place.............
review.reviewText: Very nice

review.title: Needs mini-bar cooler in room
review.reviewText: I'll return whenever travel to the Belmont vicinity is warranted.

review.title: Great Spot Outside of the City Proper
review.reviewText: Outstanding service. Great hotel. Hotel restaurant was a bit pricey, but the price for the location - a short drive into San Francisco - was great.

review.title: over priced
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel, but over priced.

review.title: Nice hotel at a great price
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel about 15 minutes from the airport.

review.title: Lobby nice rooms old flash back to the eightys!
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, great service, nice small gym, food good, location very good! Rooms, old, old, smelly, carpet bad, furniture beat up, missing grout in shower needs a remodel badly! Hope you like the french culture, staff is french.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: The hotel is closely situated near the 101 Freeway; clean and neat rooms; excellent & efficient guest service, e.g. the hair dryer blew out and w/in 3 minutes of calling the front desk, someone delivered a new dryer and then an electrician arrived to make sure that everything with the outlet was okay; price was a bit steep for the room size, but at least the company was paying!

review.title: High Tech retreat
review.reviewText: Sofitel "San Francisco Bay" is acually in Redwood City and serves many technology firms, especially Oracle. It is very busy and vibrant with business guests most of the week, but quiet and sedate on the weekends. The hotel accodates their business clients and vacationers with skill and courtesy. It is a great place to stay in the Bay Area, although it is not really convenient to San Francisco. But for those whose destination is in the "Silicon Valley" portion of the peninsula, it is to be highly recommended.

review.title: Not an airport hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is too far from the airport to be considered an airport hotel. The shuttle bus takes ages and only has 5 guest seats. It is first come first served soif you are on a deadline you end up getting a taxi. It is also not a spa hotel. It was however a very nice hotel, good rooms and good service and excellent if you are staying in the immediate area.

review.title: Room With A View
review.reviewText: Very Posh Hotel...excellent service....high standards.. I would highly recommend the Rooms with Lagoon View....my husband loved the eggs benedict for breakfast..They also have a coffee bar/bakery with really lovely pasteries. We will definitly be returning...

review.title: Will always have a special place in my heart!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the most bueatiful inside and out on the lagoon!! The room was soooo comfortable and accomidated my german shepeard!! The bed just huges you to sleep! The staff is the best I have ever encountered!! I got a back injury while I was walking my dog and the staff was sooooooo WONDERFUL! WAY ABOVE THE ABOVE AND BEYOND!! They took excellent care of my dog while I was sent to the ER. I truely feel that I have family here and will MOST DEFINIATLY RETURN! Not only will you have a terific stay but you will be assured that if for any reason something happens to you they will be you family away from home!!!! Thanks again to all of the staff!!

review.title: The staff were very pleasant and professional. We enjoyed our stay there.
review.reviewText: Clean, accomodate our needs. Shoul really be five star instead of four.

review.title: Great weekend getaway!
review.reviewText: Classy hotel with great service and food. Central location. Can drive to any location in the Bay Area. Appreciate that they allow dogs.

review.title: Not very impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel appears nice in general; however, the king size bed seemed smaller than regular king, the supposed-to-be heated pool was freezing, & both computer printers for guests' use were both not working.

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok. I expected more. I read that the pool was heated, it was not. The pool was dirty. When I checked in I went to check out the pool there was a napkin on the floor of the pool. For the next three days the napkin was in the pool, it fell apart and littered the pool. There was no hot tub. The design of the room was awkward. I was really excited to stay here because it had wonderful reviews and looked amazing but I was not impressed.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed here twice before and we really like it. The rooms are quiet and beds are cozy. It would be good to stay as a couple but we had our kids as well and they enjoyed the pool. One nice thing is on one side you are on the water and can see the ducks but on the other side you have a nice view of the Belmont Hills and as a bonus you get to see the small planes take off from the airport. (They don't fly at night!) The kids love this. My son spilled milk in the bed and the maids came and changed the whole bed.

review.title: GREAT STOP FOR A GREAT STAY!
review.reviewText: GREAT STAY VERY CLEAN GREAT SERVICE. THANKS

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: The exterior of the hotel was breath taking. I walked down the lake a few times. The event that weekend was for my 60th birthday. I could not have a better place to spend it

review.title: wifi
review.reviewText: For a four star hotel, I was quite surprised to discover that wi-fi is an additional $10/day. They have 4 computers in the lobby/gift shop for free guest use, but the hotel is huge and these computers were always in use. I was also disappointed that they didn't have a hot tub. The rooms were beautiful, though, and the comforters were so soft and snuggly.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: It would have been nice to have a coffee maker in our room. Otherwise, it was a great place!! Very "comfy", and the staff was very nice.

review.title: Lovely!
review.reviewText: We had a delightful stay.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel and service
review.reviewText: Great hotel - very nice decor. Lovely bar and restaurant, great to have drinks out by the pool.

review.title: Quite nice
review.reviewText: This hotel is pretty nice and the service is generally good. However, it is a little out of the way to San Fran and it may not seem that close if you count in the traffic.

review.title: Great Service, Unique Lobby, Great Price
review.reviewText: I had my wedding last week and the venue was just a few mins away from Sofitel, so I booked the executive suite there for 2 nights, a night before and after my wedding. The lobby was really really nice and it's totally my type - modern, simple, and elegant. I was a little disppointed when I got to the suite,but the waterfront view was great. The style of the furnitures was totally different than the lobby. It's about early 90's style, but well-kept. I asked the front desk they said they did the remodeling for the lobby 2 years ago and are working on the rooms slowly. Room was very clean and services were pretty quick (we had to call for extra blanket, tooth brush...etc.) I give a 4.5 overall and it's definitely a nice place to stay for a reasonable price.

review.title: A hotel with beautiful surroundings
review.reviewText: The hotel is lovely and the areas is peaceful and nice. Their bakery is excellent. Services at retaurants are good. However, the front desk staff is lacking in professionalism or even courtesy. A bad mistake was made when we checked in. After showing proof of our reservation etc, they only corrected the mistake grudgingly and without apology. Housekeeping took a long time to respond to calls. In general, the staff is not as pleasant as one expects from a good hotel. But the hotel itself and its environment made up for its shortcomings.

review.title: Great bed, Great view , little bit niosy
review.reviewText: We planned a vacation in San Fransisco and we didnt mind to choose Sofitel because of good price and this fact that we had a car to drive to the city, the distance from down town didnt look a big deal. Reception was good and based on previous reviews I asked for a room not close to a service door and with a good view.Our request cuased us to be given a room far from service door BUT we were just too close the elevator and becuase we were on the ninth floor the noise of elevator was sensible!(It might not be the case in lower floors) Anyway regarding the SUPER comfortable king size bed and great room view I think we got a good service out of the value paid .Also like to mention altough the hotel distance from SF downtown is around 25 miles but as we tried to spent as much as time we could for site seeing and stayed in the town till late night we found it not that convinient to drive back to the hotel when we were totally exhusted. By the way they have a nice outdoor pool good for summer time! Sean and Shoody

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and very comfortable beds too! I would definatly stay there again!

review.title: Sleeper and Outstanding together
review.reviewText: Sofitel Hotel was convenient to SF Airport. Staff was very accommodating. Bed was extremely comfortable. Location was great. all arrangements set up through Expedia were fine. No hiccups on reservation. The pastries in the hotel store were exceptional. I was able to take them to my daughter's home for Sunday Mornign special. I would go back with no reservations.

review.title: Bring a Car
review.reviewText: Very comfortable bed, good service, clean. Restaurant is overpriced, but the food is good. A car would be a good idea...nothing is within walking distance. One odd thing, no telephone book in the room.

review.title: Simple yet satisfying
review.reviewText: The room was standard, but it was clean, comfortable and just what we needed after a long day trip. The people was very nice as well. We simply loved it.

review.title: Would definitely recommend to others
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the room was. The room was comfortable, just a little on the small size. Also, located near a business park so a little out of the way. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to others. Very nice

review.title: Had a great time.
review.reviewText: Liked the location ~ 250 min south of downtown where noise and traffic an issue. Closer to Carmel !

review.title: The room was great
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful in every way except was very difficult to find at night if one is not familiar with the area. It is in a business park and we were there on the weekend so it was very tranquil and quiet. Just a 15 minute drive to San Francisco, very clean, evian water complimentary once a day in the room, and the bed was so comfortable with a feather bed below and down comforter.

review.title: Not very pleased
review.reviewText: your site indicates that there is hotel shuttel to/from SFO. We had a 6:30 am flight and arrived at the hotel at 8pm the night before, only to learn the shuttle did not start until 6 am in the morning. To late for us to use,I would not have chosen this hotel for our stay if I had known this. We asked the hotel manager to cover the cab fare for us and were declined.

review.title: very comfortable and impressive
review.reviewText: I got in from Asia around 8 am after 11 hrs flight so I was tired. Early check in was no problem and I told the front desk that I really appreciated the early check in. The room was very nice and clean, and the bed was very comfortable. If I have to find fault in this hotel, it probably was when I called to confirm the reservation. Instead of helping me directly on the phone, they switched to an answering service which gave me another number to call. If was so suddenly, I never had a chance to write down the number. I believe a hotel of this class should be a little more attentive to a customer's inquiry.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a really nice hotel, clean and very well maintained. The location was not the best (long trip to SF, lots of traffic) but overall would definately recommend the hotel

review.title: A most dreamy bed, still could not sleep!
review.reviewText: Lovely room, fine staff, but there seemed to be a service door near our room which had a 6 1/2 ton door which would close with a horrible slam. At one point I thought ". . did I actully feel the vibration to that door?". If you want to sleep in, forget it, the morning door slamming doubles as a wake up call device! A 20 minute drive to San Francisco, near Monster Park and minutes from SFO.

review.title: Outdated but nice
review.reviewText: PROS - Very clean; - Spacious rooms; - Helpful staff; - Very good mattress/blankets/pillows; - Complimentary parking. CONTRAS - Getting there is pain, even with their complimentary shuttle: only runs once an hour; - VERY far away from everything, unless you are visiting EA or Oracle; - No safe or minibar in room, very small old TV; - General aviation takes off from a busy airstrip just behind the hotel. Noisy after 9 am.

review.title: So, so
review.reviewText: Room was decent, but not great. Bathroom sink made strange, loud noises. Things just looked kind of worn. Not up to 4 star quality.

review.title: Best Hotel in the Silicon Valley/SF Bay Area
review.reviewText: Great location, between the Silicon Valley and San Francisco. Short drive/easy access from SFO. Very comfortable and clean room. Heavenly bed. Extremely friendly hotel personnel. A bit expensive, but great French restaurant.

review.title: Great atmosphere, great value on weekends
review.reviewText: The hotel is one of the most beautiful properties in the entire area, with outstanding facilities and staff. The atmosphere is very special and with high class.

review.title: Hotel condition is excellent but Front desk assistance not too friendly
review.reviewText: The hotel condition and maintenance are excellent but the Front Desk assistances were not very friendly when asked for shuttle to airport to pick up 2nd guest of the hotel.

review.title: Awsome place to say!
review.reviewText: This was a very nice place to stay. Although it looks like if it on a business park, the place is very nice and comfortable environment. I really recommend this place. Very luxurious...

review.title: Great Hotel to Stay @ !!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, beautiful and clean. However, the room we got with 2 double beds was kind of small.

review.title: Imagine this in Redwood City
review.reviewText: I was a little skeptical perhaps because I got such a great rate, well I was completely wrong. Great facility. Wonderful service. Updated decor. The only downside was the room was a little musty, the bathroom did not have an extraction fan leading to misting and finally one could not help but hear the constant slamming of doors by a couple of inconsiderate neighbors. That said we will be back.

review.title: noisy doors
review.reviewText: We could hear and feel the door closing in other rooms on our floor. It was too noisy to get a decent night's rest before our early AM flight.

review.title: We would stay again
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our vacation and would stay at the Sofitel again. The decor was lovely and the beds were extremely comfortable. The lagoon view from our room was also quite beautiful.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: comfy beds, excellent attention by the staff

review.title: Tres Chic
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel. Lobby, bar, and restaurant is well-done with a nice mix of trendy and modern mixed with elegance. Situated on local bay with beautiful water views. Service is good, but the food is pricey. Good location--close to freeway and airports, with San Francisco to the North and San Jose to the South.

review.title: Good value in SF Bay Area
review.reviewText: Hotel is very clean, Metropolitan-like. Rooms are quaint, some overlooking bay and pool - a refreshing view! Sheets and comforter are very comfortable - almost like the another high end brand hotel comfort beds. A great value for travelers and staying south of SF. A bit far (~12 mi south) from SFO. Bring own snacks and water to save on amenities costs.

review.title: Mediocre, but OK value for region/area
review.reviewText: Room was OK - fairly standard. Bed was nice but squeaky. Duvet comes standard, but sheets are not normally provided - they have to be requested. Shower was small - and grout needed to be cleaned or bleached.

review.title: Wish we had spent more time in Redwood City. This was a wonderful place.
review.reviewText: Great place! We will return.

review.title: Very happy with view, bed was very comfortable
review.reviewText: Would have been better with a mini fridge in the room but other than that it was great.

review.title: Would stay there again, great gym, watch out for the geese
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice/new, the staff were very accomodating and polite, very nice location. We were pleasantly surprised. We just stayed there (Aug07) and there were often geese in the middle of the intersection as you enter the hotel - so be careful. Definitely one of the nicer hotels in the south san francisco area.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The food was great.

review.title: Always an exquisite pleasure
review.reviewText: I've visited the Sofitel, Redwood City, on and off for 3-4 years now. It is, hands down, my favorite hotel in all of the Bay Area. The bedding is superb, and the room is always clean and well-maintained. Food and drinks are a bit costly, but the quality is there to match. I expecially like the newly renovated lounge area. Its open-air atmosphere is inviting yet has enough "attitude" to host even their Friday night DJ / dance evening. From the rooms, to the excellent view, to the fresh fruit and towels in the gym, to the free parking, to the in-room WiFi (excellent signal even on the 8th floor), this is my favorite hotel whether I'm visiting San Francisco, San Jose, or any of the other Bay Area towns. Even if you're visiting San Francisco, as long as you avoid peak traffic you hardly notice the drive. I've stayed in downtown San Francisco several times, often at 4 and 5-star hotels, and each time I regret not having stayed at the Sofitel.

review.title: Very Impressed!
review.reviewText: The service and the food in the restaurant was excellent! The hotel is beautiful! The staff was really nice. I will definitely stay there again!

review.title: I felt like I really got away....
review.reviewText: The only thing missing was a jacuzzi hot tub. It would have been nice. Breakfast was a little disappointing as the service was not so great at the Bay223 Cafe. The food was fabulous. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Great place and value just outside of the city
review.reviewText: The Sofitel is a great place to stay, especially if you are fed up with the noise and bustle of the city. People are friendly and helpful, the rooms are nice and quiet with comfortable beds. The lounge is a happening place most any night of the week. This has become my favorite place to stay!

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: thinks it is cooler than it is. very loud drunk people next door at 130 in the morning - could hear everything - they did send securtiy eventually - but it was still annoying

review.title: Nice lobby, room was ok
review.reviewText: I was in an Executive King Suite and wasn't too impressed - I've stayed in standard hotel rooms that were nicer, more modern and more comfortable. I think they took an older, lesser quality hotel and upgraded the lobby but skimped a bit on the rooms. Good room service, good breakfast, helpful staff.

review.title: Our favorite Bay Area hotel
review.reviewText: We take frequent weekend overnight trips to the SF Bay Area, and the Sofitel is the place we stay. It's near the Oracle headquarters south of SFO airport and appears designed for business travelers, so we've never had a problem getting a Saturday night reservation. Luxurious rooms, comfortable beds, friendly staff. Highly recommended.

review.title: Nicely appointed, superb atmosphere...
review.reviewText: Wow. That was my first thought when I walked into the lobby. Nicely decorated, clean and modern (even true of the Christmas displays). Staff was helpful, the gym was nicer than I'm used to, including clean towels, bottled water and fresh apples and TVs on the treadmills. Computers with free printing are available downstairs... perfect for printing a boarding pass or checking email. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in. There were a few minor downsides, including something unpleasant looking on the headboard (!) and hot water pipes that made a lot of noise when the sink was used. Other than these, I would heighly recommend the Sofitel.

review.title: Great for it's price
review.reviewText: If you're planning a visit to SF I would consider this hotel . It's the best value of money. In my opnion I would rate this hotel 4 stars

review.title: Loved It!
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful haven after hectic days. We loved the room and everything about this excellent hotel. We are planning on coming back with some friends.

review.title: Will Definately Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: My husband does not take much time off work so when he said "book a hotel in San Francisco for this weekend", I turned to Expedia for help. We wanted to visit the City, but not spend a fortune on a nice hotel and parking, so I searched near the airport. I chose Hotel Sofitel because of the reviews and was not disappointed. We, along with our two daughters booked a double room with a view of the lagoon. The only drawback was the window did not open. The view was very nice. We loved the walking path that ran along the lagoon and even stopped to let our girls play in the playground nearby. We hoped for a jacuzzi but were satisfied to sit next to the pool for awhile before retiring to our room. Parking is free in a covered parking garage....big plus! The beds are small, but very comfortable, no complaints here. Room was very clean. Smelled smoke in the hallway near a couple of rooms, but thankfully it did not penetrate to our room. No in room coffee and the cafe downstairs had a huge line all morning. We decided to wait until we checked out to get breakfast nearby and have coffee then. Or you could order some to the room if you like. If you want to visit San Francisco on a budget but still want to stay at a nice hotel, Sofitel is it. We plan on returning.

review.title: Sofitel Is Always Terrific (At Weekend Rates)
review.reviewText: The Sofitel is away from the city center and somewhat isolated in terms of locale. However, it is only a couple of miles from some very nice restaurants. The atmosphere is sophisticated and elegant. For high tech business travelers, it is within walking distance to Oracle's headquarters. For social travelers, it is a very comfortable hotel (feather beds and down pillows!), with great weekend rates. It can be expensive during the work week as it caters primarily to business travelers. I have stayed at this hotel several times and it has always been a pleasure.

review.title: Beyond Expectation
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the best I've stayed at. Everything was better that I expected. I would return again..

review.title: Wonderful for the price...
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent! The bed was so comfortable I almost didn't want to get up!! Very clean and the staff was great. I also like the fact that they offer a covered parking deck - free of charge. The room was a bit small but the hotel was beautiful. I got my room at a discounted rate so it was worth the price, however, I'm not so sure it would have been worth the full price considering the room was small. Absolutely no interference from the airport which is about 15 minutes away.

review.title: Nice accomodations
review.reviewText: Nice accomodations, the door person didn't open the door for us even though our hands were full, the tea we ordered through room service came without milk/cream.

review.title: Very Modern and Nice
review.reviewText: We just spent one night and were there hardly long enough to form much of an opinion but over-all we were very satisified. Our room was clean, European modern, with all the usual amenities plus a few more (like tons of pillows) and was lacking only in having a coffee-maker. There is a coffee shop on the first floor though that also serves up great pastries in the morning. If you're staying in this part of the valley, I recommend Sofitel, especially if you can get a good price like we did here on Expedia.

review.title: Extremely happy with this hotel
review.reviewText: A great place to stay. 25 miles from San Francisco and an easy drive to downtown for dinner or whatever. The room could not have been lovelier and the bed was extremely comfortable. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Great Hotel & Good Food
review.reviewText: Only issue : If you come by shuttle from the Airport, you cannot have access to shops, malls,,... by foot.

review.title: Nice Hotel - Resonably Priced
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Sofitel for 4 nights. It was very nice and was in a good location. My only complaint is that the pool was very cold, perhaps not heated at all. The kids were freezing! You also could only enter the pool area by going through the restaurant/bar. Not a good thing when everyone is dressed up and you are all wet in a bathing suit.

review.title: Excellent all around
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, staff was superb, hotel is comfortable. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: This hotel is 2 minutes from our offices and the perfect place to house our Board Members.

review.title: Outstanding hotel
review.reviewText: Sofitel is a great place to stay. I read in other reviews complaints about their location. Sure, it is in the middle of a business district, but Hillsdale Mall is only a few miles away. Besides, there is no need to look for places to eat, the restaurant at Sofitel is simply excellent. Parking is free, friendly staff, view at a lake, calm atmosphere, good restaurant, what else can you ask for?

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: room was good size, staff extremely friendly and helpful, very clean. heated pool was a little chilly but ok. free parking!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: What a great spot, hotel close to the airport. Parking (self) was free and easily accessible, which is a great in San Francisco. Very modern and neatly decorated. Enjoyed our short stay.

review.title: Very Impressive
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice location, helpful staff. DO NOT MISS the restaurant and the bar at the hotel; one of the best. I will definately recommend this hotel. Make sure you get a Lagoon view room to enjoy the magnificent view of the Lagoon.

review.title: Jewel of the Peninsula
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Sofitel during a visit to the SF Bay Area. The hotel is beautiful, clean and very comfortable. The hotel staff was very helpful. Beautiful swimming pool! My room had a lagoon view which was amazing at night. I visit the Bay Area every year and I will definitely stay at the Sofitel!

review.title: Best Value for your money
review.reviewText: Confortable hotel with fair prices being close to SF

review.title: Very stylish and trendy
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Simply excellent.

review.title: We keep going back
review.reviewText: We have stayed here several times. It is convenient to the freeway, has beautiful rooms, and is in a fabulous setting.

review.title: An excellent hotel
review.reviewText: This was an excellent hotel. The restaurant and room service were very good. Great service. It was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I would very highly recommend it. There are not a lot of good options for nice hotels in the area, but this one was really outstanding. Free self parking. I don't like to pay $9.99 for 24 hours of internet service, but this is a small detail.

review.title: Wonderful location, pool, beds...relaxing
review.reviewText: All Sofitels have the same beds and this one is no exception--but the beds are exceptional, down, crisp white cotton, huge and wonderful like a cloud. The hotel has a very nice outdoor pool overlooking the lagoon, which is nice for swimming or just laying around in the ever present Redwood City sun. The staff are mostly very nice, we had room service each morning, turn down service in the evening, etc. Room cleaing was well done. The carpet in the room had some pieces of perhaps candy that someone had dropped on the carpet, and, no one had done enough to remove. I did more with a wet washcloth than the cleaning crew had done. One staff member in the small store on the main level had a real attitude problem to the point where people were talking about it--but rest of staff great. We ate dinner twice in the restaurant downstairs and had excellent food and service. Bathroom high acceptable but not fantastic, and, such a nice hotel especially in California should have better bath products but they were pretty standard. All in all, this was a very comfortable hotel bordering on luxurious when it comes to the bed, and, my friend and I had a super and relaxing time. Getting into San Francisco is easy from the hotel as well, it's a short hop so if you're thinking this is too far away, you'd be wrong. Have a great time!

review.title: Looking to feel Special?
review.reviewText: The Sofitel in Redwood City was a very special place to stay. The room was absolutely grand and the people were very friendly and helpful. I was on a leisure trip, but the Sofitel would be a super place for any type of business occasion too.

review.title: I felt like a princes
review.reviewText: this was an unexpected surprise. We picked a hotel to be near relatives and got more than we expected. I wish we had more time there

review.title: Peaceful setting with a happening bar
review.reviewText: Comfortable rooms, contemporary public areas and a peaceful lagoon setting provide a terrific oasis in the San Francisco Bay area. The bar is surprisingly lively on any given night.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: The service was great. The beds are very comfortable and the room was very clean.

review.title: Will certainly go out of my way to stay here again.
review.reviewText: My wife and I spend a four day weekend and really enjoyed ourselves. Room was clean and nicely furnished. Westward facing view provided for some spectacular over the water sunsets. Great restaurant. Had lunch with friends from San Francisco who all ordered the Mahi-Mahi and were very impressed with quality of food and service. Evening bed turndown with fresh orchids added a nice touch. Doormen were exceptional. Very friendly,courteous and efficient. Had the best Bloody Mary since arriving in California. evening bed turndown with fresh orchids added a nice touch.

review.title: Availability
review.reviewText: Had to wait past 6 PM for a room even after they had told me at 1:30PM they would be able to give me a nonsmoking room at 3PM.

review.title: Excellent value & quality
review.reviewText: Although my particular room was obviously an older model without typical modern upgrades, the beautiful, quality appointments and accoutrement gave it an upscale look and a luxurious feel. The bed and linens alone, were not only inviting, but steeped in comfort and quality. Cleanliness, atmosphere, attention and detail are of utmost importance, obviously. The lounge, restaurant, boutique/bakery/coffee stop are not only inviting and appealing to the eye, but stock only the best, and the staff, in every realm, treat everyone as royalty. The immediate view is somewhat strange at first since the hotel is in a business "park," but the adjacent lagoon (which the 24-hour pool overlooks), views of the San Mateo Bridge and the Bay on one side, and the hills on the other, make for a breathtaking experience. The close proximity of the hotel to all things nearby make it an ideal, classy, yet affordable respite for vacationers, tourists, business persons, or those looking just to escape for a night or two. I will return over and over again.

review.title: Wonderful sense of relaxation
review.reviewText: The Sofitel is a great hotel to stay at when on a business trip because it is beautifully appointed and the whole atmosphere is one of calm and relaxation, especially the guest rooms. Service is exceptional and the bar and restaurant remind one of what you would encounter in a large European city.

review.title: So far the best I've stayed at near San Francisco
review.reviewText: Pleasant staff, beautiful environment. Every need anticipated and met. Very accomodating.

review.title: Beautiful, roomy, comfortable, and luxurious
review.reviewText: Fabulous room--very clean, lovely fixtures, great robe and towels, bed is to-die-for comfortable with goose-down pillows and mattress!

review.title: Would definitely return!!
review.reviewText: This Sofitel was exactly what you would expect from the chain. The service was fantastic--from check in, to maintenance (the blow dryer burned out and we had someone in housekeeping install a new one immediately). We had dinner in the hotel restaurant and the food was exceptional. Went to the market for a dessert--they have a great selection and are VERY good!! Because of our great dinner experience we decided to have breakfast. Breakfast was as delicious as dinner. The French coffee a treat!! The overall experience was wonderful and the Expedia rate reasonable for a four star hotel. The hotel was only about 20 minutes from the airport with light traffic.

review.title: Softiel San Francisco Bay is a glitzy front
review.reviewText: This hotel looks really uptown, however, we found it to be cold and lacking in many amenities. The restaurant was overpriced and the service and the food was marginal at best. You have to request a coffee maker for your room. The room was small. While adequate, the pillows were good, however the shower head was positioned too high for my taste. I would not stay at this hotel again. It may be French, but something is lost in the translation here.

review.title: Luxurious accommodations and a Great bar
review.reviewText: This hotel was so much nicer than we expected for the price. The price for a weekend stay was unbelievable considering fow very luxurious and elegant the hotel is. And the bar and restaurants were fantastic. It seems kind of out of the way, but it is only a few miles from downtown Redwood City and a cab was a good (and affordable) choice. Stop by the Fox Theatre and the Little Fox bar for a great evening -- we are definitely going back.

review.title: comfort
review.reviewText: The feather bed was comfortable, but too warm!

review.title: So-So Sofitel
review.reviewText: ALthough the staff was very courteous and helpful, I would not stay here again. Where many of the chain motels offer free internet service to their guests, Sofitel charges a $5 connection fee(connecting their computer to the internet) and a dollar a minute thereafter. Cheap. Also, the room we stayed in didn't have a bathroom fan, a balcony or a window that could be opened for fresh air. The service in the restaurant for lunch was poor. The hotel and rooms are clean and well-decorated, with nice toiletries. The concierge and doormen are exceedingly polite, as are all the personnel.

review.title: Could service more actively
review.reviewText: This was our first time travel with our 11 months old baby. As first time parents we were unexperienced about traveling with baby. When we checked in they saw our baby with us but didn't ask us if we need any baby equipment such as crib or changing table (those are available in the hotel).We assumed that we would have to let the baby co-sleep with us. Thankfully my sister came to visit us and told us the that we could ask for a crib. The service could be more senstive and actively especially for parents with babies.

review.title: Well worth it - if you don't mind a 30 minute drive into the city
review.reviewText: Very nice view of the lagoon, great customer service, free & ample parking, close to the airport, great penninsula access. But, if you plan on visitng the city often, it is a 30-min trip, depending upon traffic.

review.title: Great Bed & Nice Surroundings
review.reviewText: Sofitel was a great Hotel. Service was friendly, and even though I waited about 5 minutes to be checked in since the receptionist was on the phone she gave me complimentary drink tickets for the bar which was nice. The rooms were very comfortable, a down comforter which gets the duvet replaced daily, and and overall luxurious bed. Nice bathroom and amenities. However, for being located in Silicon Valley, the heart of the technology world you would think they would have Internet Service for free. It costs $9.95 to have it in you room - pretty crazy since the hotel is located in a major business district and Oracle being right down the street. Overall, a nice place to stay though.
